articleData.chapterTitle_bc: What is Terastallize in Scarlet & Violet?

chapterContent.content: Terastallize is the new battle gimmick introduced in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet, akin to Mega Evolution, Z-Moves and Dynamax in previous generations. It is a way to enhance your Pokémon with different move types from their base type.

chapterContent.head: What is the Terastal Phenomenon?

chapterContent.content: The Terastal Phenomenon makes Pokémon shine like gemstones. It has only been observed in the Paldea region, which Scarlet & Violet take place in.

When a Pokémon Terastallizes, it becomes covered in a jewel-like exterior and a crown-like Tera Jewel grows on top of its head. The type of exterior and Tera Jewel varies according to each Pokémon. All Pokémon can Terastallize.

chapterContent.head: What does Terastallize do?

chapterContent.content: Terastallize modifies the Pokémon’s type during battle. Each Pokémon has a Tera Type, which determines what type they become after Terastallizing. The Pokémon’s Tera Type is hidden until the moment they Terastallize, allowing you to surprise your opponents!

Every Pokémon has a wide variety of possible Tera Types. For example, most Eevee have a Normal Tera Type. But there may be some Eevee with a Flying Tera Type. There are 18 possible Tera Types, which means a staggering number of Pokémon and Tera Type combinations!

In addition, when a Terastallized Pokémon uses a move that matches its Tera Type, that move will become more powerful. If that move matches the Pokémon’s Tera Type and one of the Pokémon’s original types, the boost will become even stronger!

Terastallizing can also have defensive uses, since it changes your Pokémon’s weakness. For example, if you are fighting a Fire-type with a Grass-type, you can turn the tables by Terastallizing your Grass-type into a Water-type!

chapterContent.head: How to Terastallize

chapterContent.content: To Terastallize your Pokémon, you will need a Tera Orb. After Terastallizing a Pokémon, the Tera Orb will lose its Terastal energy and you can’t use it again until it has recharged. You can recharge the Tera Orb by touching crystals overflowing with Terastal energy or by visiting a Pokémon Center.
During battles, you can Terastallize whenever you want. But only one Pokémon may Terastallize per battle. Pokémon will remain in their Terastallized form until the end of battle.

chapterContent.head: How to find rare Tera Types

chapterContent.content: Pokémon with rare Tera Types often appear in Tera Raid Battles. These are similar to Max Raid Battles in Sword & Shield, but more fast-paced.

While exploring Paldea, you may come across shining crystals on the field, where you can challenge Terastallized wild Pokémon. You can challenge Tera Raid Battles by yourself or with up to three other players.
Unlike Max Raid Battles, you can attack seemlessly without waiting for other trainers to choose their actions. Also, there’s a time limit for the battle, so you need to think fast!
After defeating a Terastallized Pokémon, you’ll have the chance to catch it. You can also earn items from winning too.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Tera Types & Terastallize

chapterContent.content: This page explains how Tera Types and Terastallize work in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet and what they can actually do for your Pokémon and team in general.

chapterContent.head: What are Tera Types?

chapterContent.content: Tera Types are a “third” type that every Pokémon has. It’s visible in the Pokémon menu, but only for yourself.

In most cases, a Pokémon’s Tera Type is the same as one of their usual Types. For example, you may have a Sprigagito (Grass-type) whose Tera Type is Grass. However, sometimes a Pokémon’s Tera Type can be different. Like an Eevee (Normal-type) whose Tera Type is Flying.
A Pokémon’s Tera Type has no effect until the Pokémon Terastallizes.

chapterContent.head: What is Terastallize?

chapterContent.content: Terastallize is Scarlet & Violet’s new battle gimmick, akin to Mega Evolution, Z-Moves and Dynamax in previous games. When triggered, it transforms the Pokémon into its Tera Type.
All Pokémon can Terastallize. To make a Pokémon Terastallize, you simply press  when selecting a Pokémon’s moves, when the “Terastallize” icon is available.
When a Pokémon Terastallizes, they will be surrounded by a crystal-like luster and a crown will appear on their head, indicating their Tera Type.
While Terastallized, the Pokémon’s Type(s) will change into its Tera Type. Eg. a Rock and Dark-type Tyranitar can change into a Ghost-type.

In addition, the Terastallized Pokémon’s moves will receive a damage boost if they match the Pokémon’s Tera Type or one of the Pokémon’s original Types. If the move matches both of these, the damage boost will be even higher.

chapterContent.aside: You can only Terastallize one Pokémon per fight, but it lasts for the entire battle.

chapterContent.content: A Tera Orb item is required for Terastallize to be available. Also, after using Terastallize in battle, the Tera Orb will lose its charge. You can recharge it by visiting a shining crystal on the field or a Pokémon Center.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: What are Tera Raid Battles?

chapterContent.content: This is a guide for the new Tera Raid Battles in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet. We go into detail about what Tera Raid battles actually are, how to start one and what events there are.

chapterContent.head: What are Tera Raid Battles?

chapterContent.content: Tera Raid Battles are a type of co-operative battles, where up to four Pokémon trainers can team up to battle a powerful Tera Pokémon. They are similar to Max Raid Battles in Pokémon Sword & Shield, but more fast-paced.

chapterContent.head: How to Start a Tera Battle

chapterContent.content: While exploring Paldea, you may come across shining Tera Raid crystals on the field. A bright pillar of light will also appear above them, making them easy to spot. If you inspect these crystals, you can enter Tera Raid Battles. If you played Pokémon Sword & Shield, they are similar to the raid dens.

A window will pop up showing the silhouette of the Tera Pokémon, as well as the star rating, which indicates how difficult the Tera Raid Battle is. You can only take one Pokémon with you in a Tera Raid Battle–this can be from your party or your Pokémon Boxes.

Next, you can choose to challenge the raid by yourself or with other people. If you choose other people, the game will search nearby if you have local communication enabled or online if you have Internet communication enabled.

chapterContent.aside: To play online, you must have a Nintendo Switch Online subscription.

chapterContent.content: You can also join a friend’s Tera Raid Battle by inputting the Link Code for that raid. Or you can search for raids hosted by other players via the Tera Raid Battle menu.

chapterContent.head: How do Tera Battles Work?

chapterContent.content: After starting a Tera Battle, you can perform the following actions:

chapterContent.li: Battle: Select a move for your Pokémon, like normal.
Cheer: Choose from one of three cheers, which boost your offensive stats, defensive stats or provide healing.
Run: Give up.

chapterContent.content: After selecting an action, the action will be performed without having to wait for other Pokémon trainers to choose theirs. This is different to Max Raid Battles in Pokémon Sword & Shield where you must wait for all trainers to select an action for that turn.
Your goal is to deplete the Tera Pokémon’s HP before the time limit is up and without your entire team losing all of their Pokémon.

If you succeed in defeating the Tera Pokémon, you will have the opportunity to catch them. These Pokémon often have rare Tera Types, so it’s usually a good idea to try. Besides that, you can earn items from winning as well.

chapterContent.head: Tera Raid Battle Events

chapterContent.content: From time to time, special Tera Raid Battle Events may appear on the overworld. You can challenge these battle events by searching for Tera Raid Crystals with a mysterious aura around them. These crystals will also sparkle on the map.

Tera Raid Battle Events often contain rare Pokémon and/or Pokémon with a higher frequency of certain Tera Types. For example, from 24th to 27th November 2022, you can encounter Eevee with a variety of Tera Types.

chapterContent.aside: To find Tera Raid Battle Events, your Nintendo Switch must be connected to the Internet. The game will then automatically download the latest Poké Portal News, which may contain new Tera Raid Battle events. You can also manually download Poké Portal News via the Mystery Gift menu.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: How do you Unlock 5 and 6 Star Tera Raids?

chapterContent.content: Pokémon Scarlet & Violet is out now and Tera Raids are a large part of the online component of the game. Tera Raid dens are ranked from 1 - 7 stars and this page will detail how you can unlock each star.

The unlocking of 5 and 6 Star Tera Raids is a complicated process and one that has had a lot of players stumped. At the bare minimum, you’ll need to reach the credits at the end of the game and begin undertaking the Tournament and the Academy.

chapterContent.head: What are 5 and 6 Star Tera Raids?

chapterContent.content: Whenever you interact with one of the crystal dens in the Paldea region, you’ll see that its difficulty is designated by a number of stars. You’ll have to progress through the game to find tougher Tera Raids with the highest, 5 and 6 stars, being elusive indeed.

Beyond fighting higher level Pokemon in these dens, you’ll also get access to some of the rarest items in the game such as the Herba Mystica, needed for [Shiny Hunting Sandwiches](Shiny Hunting Sandwiches) so they’re well worth your attention.

When fighting in 5 Star Tera Raids, Pokemon will be at Level 75, and you’ll find them incredibly difficult to complete with AI teammates. Instead, you’ll want to go online if possible, to give yourself a better time against these battles.

6 Star Tera Raids are far rarer, and the difficulty takes another step up too. The Pokemon you’ll face are Lv 90 (although only 75 once you catch them) and you’ll almost certainly have no choice but to enlist some friends online to take them out as the AI won’t be able to keep up with these challenging battles.

chapterContent.head: Tera Raid Unlock Conditions

chapterContent.content: With that in mind, you’ll find the full conditions for how to unlock each Star difficulty for Tera Raids. This is still very much a work-in-progress at this point, and we’re looking to further break down the conditions, at which point you’ll find the updated information here.

As you can see from the above table, to unlock 5 Star Tera Raids, you’ll need to fully complete the game, including the Area 0 Storyline that takes place after the initial three. You’ll see the credits at this point and then when you return to the game, 5 Star Tera Raids will start appearing.

As part of the post-game adventures, you can setup a tournament at school which will allow you to refight a lot of the story battles and more at a higher level. Once you complete this, you’ll be asked to take out some of the 5 Star Tera Raids. After a certain amount, you’ll be contacted again about the appearance of new Tera Raids. Beware, even once you’ve fulfilled the unlock conditions, both 5 and 6 Star Tera Raids are still extremely rare to find out in the field.

chapterContent.aside: We’re still verifying just how many 5 Star Tera Raids you need to complete to unlock 6 Star Tera Raids and will update this page with the info when we have it.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Best Pokemon for Tera Raids

chapterContent.content: Pokémon Scarlet & Violet is out now and Tera Raids are a large part of the online component of the game. Due to the difficulty of trying to complete Tera Raids offline and Online these Pokemon Builds will make life easier.

chapterContent.head: What Are Tera Raids?

chapterContent.content: Tera Raid Battles are a type of co-operative battles, where up to four Pokémon trainers can team up to battle a powerful Tera Pokémon. They are similar to Max Raid Battles in Pokémon Sword & Shield, but more fast-paced. While exploring Paldea, you may come across shining Tera Raid crystals on the field. A bright pillar of light will also appear above them, making them easy to spot. If you inspect these crystals, you can enter Tera Raid Battles. If you played Pokémon Sword & Shield, they are similar to the raid dens.

However, once you complete the Victory Road Story Path you’ll gain access to all types of Tera Raids which range from 1 to 7 Star. The difficulty of these battles will depend on the star, so if you go into a 2 Star Raid you’ll face a Level 20 Pokemon, but if you go into a 6 Star Raid you’ll face a Level 75 Pokemon. Basically any Raids from 5 Star and up will require a properly set up Pokemon, so you can comfortably complete them. Below we’ll list the best Pokemon Builds to take into these Tera Raids.

chapterContent.head: Best Solo Tera Raid Builds
Best All Around Tera Raid Builds
Coming Soon

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: How to Use Iron Hands to Solo Tera Raids

chapterContent.content: Pokémon Scarlet & Violet is out now and Tera Raids are a large part of the online component of the game. Due to the difficulty of trying to complete Tera Raids offline, Iron Hands will make life easier.

If you’ve been delving into the world of Tera Raids and have reached the point of taking on the challenging 5 and 6 Star Tera Raids, you may realize just how much more strategy comes into play. More importantly, you may notice that clearing these Offline with the AI is incredibly challenging, to the point of almost impossible. Even Online can be challenging if your teammates choose Pokémon that are not ideal.

chapterContent.head: How to Catch Iron Hands

chapterContent.content: Enter, Iron Hands!

Before you can even get started on this method, you’ll need to actually catch this Paradox Pokémon and to make matters even more complicated, Iron Hands is a Violet exclusive, so you’ll have to trade for it if you’re on Scarlet.

Like all Paradox Pokémon, Iron Hands can be found in Area 0, the Great Crater of Paldea. You won’t be able to access this endgame area until you’ve completed Victory Road, Starfall Street, and Path of Legends, at which point, The Way Home will begin as the final storyline for Pokémon Scarlet and Violet.

Although you have access to Area 0 at this point, it’s better to wait until you finish the storyline and return to Area 0 after the credits. You can then start your descent again from Research Station One and make your way down as more and more Paradox Pokémon begin to appear. In terms of rarity, Iron Hands appears to be one of the more common Paradox Pokémon so it shouldn’t take too long to bag one and add it to your team.

chapterContent.head: Using Iron Hands in Tera Raids

chapterContent.content: Now that you have Iron Hands, what is it about this Paradox Pokémon that has the Pokémon community go wild for him? There are two main moves you’ll want to make note of.

The first, is Belly Drum, a move that increases the user’s Attack stat to the maximum amount (6 stages), at the cost of halving their HP. This will allow Iron Hands to pump out a lot of damage, even in the higher Star Tera Raids.

Once you’ve raised his attack to max using Belly Drum, you’ll want to attack your foe with the Drain Punch move. This will deal significant damage to them while also restoring Iron Hand’s HP, giving it great survivability.

Using this method, you can use Iron Hands to carry you through Tera Raids solo or be one of the main players in an Online raid. To make life easier for yourself, be sure to Level Iron Hands as high as possible (Level 100 is of course preferable) and make use of Hyper Training to increase its stats further. Of course, having some useful hold items on Iron Hands can only serve to increase his survivability that bit more, especially for those tricky 6 Star Tera Raids.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: How to Use Gholdengo to Solo Tera Raids

chapterContent.content: Pokémon Scarlet & Violet is out now and Tera Raids are a large part of the online component of the game. Due to the difficulty of trying to complete Tera Raids offline, Gholdengo will make life easier.

If you’ve been delving into the world of Tera Raids and have reached the point of taking on the challenging 5 and 6 Star Tera Raids, you may realize just how much more strategy comes into play. More importantly, you may notice that clearing these Offline with the AI is incredibly challenging, to the point of almost impossible. Even Online can be challenging if your teammates choose Pokémon that are not ideal.

chapterContent.head: How to Get Gholdengo

chapterContent.content: You may have already seen one of the best methods for soloing these Raids in the form of Iron Hands and we’d still recommend that option if it’s available to you. One of the main issues here, however, is the fact that Iron Hands is a Violet exclusive so if you’re playing Scarlet and have no way to trade for it, it won’t work for you.
This is where Gholdengo comes in.

Gholdengo is available in both Scarlet and Violet, but of course it’s a much longer process to obtain Gholdengo than it is for Iron Hands. To begin with, you’ll need to catch yourself a Gimmighoul, noting that you can only catch the chest form, not the various roaming Gimmighouls you’ll encounter across Paldea.

The next step in obtaining Gholdengo is to evolve that Gimmighoul, and you’ll need to accrue 999+ Gimmighoul Coins, a task which will take some time. To make life easier, focus on the Gimmighoul Chests, these will award between 50-60 Coins per battle and massively speed up the process.

chapterContent.li: Check out our page on Where to Find All Gimmighoul Chests if you want to track them all down.

chapterContent.content: Once you have all the Gimmighoul Coins, grab your Gimmighoul and level it up. You can do this easily with Exp. Candies or a Rare Candy itself although you may want to catch one of the higher level Gimmighoul’s as your base such as the Level 50 Gimmighoul found east of Casseroya Falls on top of the watchtower. Once you level up with the coins in your inventory, you’ll have yourself a Gimmighoul while also keeping the Coins!

chapterContent.head: Gholdengo Build in Tera Raids

chapterContent.content: Now that you have Gholdengo, what is it about this Pokémon that has the Pokémon community go wild for him? These are main moves you’ll want to make note of:

chapterContent.li: Recover
Nasty Plot
Metal Sound
Steel Beam

chapterContent.content: Recover is self-explanatory, it’s a Normal-type move that allows the user to recover 50% of their HP. This is a difficult move to learn due to there being no TM, but Gholdengo will learn this at Level 42.

Nasty Plot is an incredibly useful move that will raise your Pokémon’s Sp. Atk by 2 stages, meaning you can use it three times to max it (at 6 stages). Seeing as you’ll be using a Sp. Atk move, this is crucial. You can earn this TM by speaking to Ms. Raifort in the Staff room after completing the Midterms to start her Bonding Quest.

Complete this (which includes capturing the 4 Ruinous Legendaries) and you’ll obtain it. Alternatively, you can actually get one much easier if you have access to Area 0. Go to Research Station 2 and climb up the ledges behind it to find a pickup.
Metal Sound is a debuff move that will harshly lower your target’s Sp. Def by 2 stages, allowing your Sp. Atk to cause more damage. Thankfully, Gholdengo will learn this at Level 28.
Finally, Steel Beam will be the move you use to attack the target with, and you’ll need to track down the TM for this. You’ll find that in a cave to the west of the Fairy Crew base.

Finally, you’ll want to make sure your Gholdengo is holding the Metal Coat item, this will boost power of Steel-type moves (of which Steel Beam obviously falls under). You can simply head to the Delibird Presents Store in Levinicia and purchase it.

chapterContent.aside: This strategy assumes you will raise the IV of your Gholdengo’s HP and Sp. Atk to 252 for a much easier time. It will also help if it has the Modest Nature.

chapterContent.content: The strategy works as follow, and applies to most Tera Raids:

chapterContent.li: Use Metal Sound three times (to lower the target’s Sp. Def)
Use Nasty Plot twice (to raise your Sp. Atk 4 stages)
Use Steal Beam

chapterContent.content: Using this method, you can use Gholdengo to carry you through Tera Raids solo or be one of the main players in an Online raid. To make life easier for yourself, be sure to Level Gholdengo as high as possible (Level 100 is of course preferable) and make use of Hyper Training to increase its stats further.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Best Azumarill Tera Raid Build

chapterContent.content: Pokémon Scarlet & Violet is out now and Tera Raids are a large part of the online component of the game. Due to the difficulty of trying to complete Tera Raids offline, Azumaril will make life easier.

If you’ve been delving into the world of Tera Raids and have reached the point of taking on the challenging 5 and 6 Star Tera Raids, you may realize just how much more strategy comes into play. More importantly, you may notice that clearing these Offline with the AI is incredibly challenging, to the point of almost impossible. Even Online can be challenging if your teammates choose Pokémon that are not ideal.

chapterContent.head: How to Catch Azumarill

chapterContent.content: If you haven’t yet caught yourself a Azumarill, then you’ll want to make a trip up to Casseroya Lake as it can be found roaming around on the outer edge of the lake, however, its a rare spawn, so you may need to run about for a while until one comes up. Azumarill’s can also be found in the water, so if you’ve unlocked the swimming travel ability via defeating Bombirdier, the Open Sky Titan, then have a swim about to see if you can find it there.

Azumarill is a Water and Fairy  Type, so it’s extremely weak to Grass  and Electric  and will take 2x damage from them, so you want to use those Pokemon Types which are slightly above its level to lower its health before attempting to catch it. Additionally, the level range of Casseroya Lakes Pokemon is around 49-55, so you’ll want to make sure your team is leveled up and you have enough Hyper Potions to bring along.

chapterContent.head: Azumarill Build For Charizard Tera Raids

chapterContent.content: Now that you have Azumarill , what is it about this Pokémon that has the Pokémon community go wild for him? These are main moves you’ll want to make note of:

chapterContent.li: Play Rough
Superpower
Belly Drum
Liquidation

chapterContent.content: Play Rough is a Fairy-type move that inflicts damage and has a chance to lower the target’s Attack stat by 1 stage. Superpower will lower the opposition’s Attack and Defense stats by 1 stage. Belly Drum is a move that increases the user’s Attack stat to the maximum amount (6 stages), at the cost of halving their HP. Finally, Liquidation has a 20% chance to lower the opposition’s Defense by one stage.

Once you’ve acquired the above attacks, you’ll want to start the battle with Belly Drum to increase your attack power, then follow it up with Liquidation and Play Rough. This is a really good strategy against Dragon-type Pokemon, so it’ll be a good option for the Charizard Event on the 2nd of December.

Unlike Belly Drum, Superpower and Play Rough are both attacks that can be taught to Azumaril by leveling up. In order to learn Play Rough you’ll need to reach Level 25 and for Superpower you’ll need to reach Level 50.

Unfortunately, Azumarill can’t learn Belly Drum via leveling up nor is there Belly Drum TM to be found in the open world, so you’ll need to visit the Delibird Presents Store in Cascarrafa City and purchase the Mirror Herb for 30,000 Poke Dollars. Next up, you’ll need find and capture several Hariyama which can be found in West Province Area 2 until you find one that has the Belly Drum Attack.

Once you’ve done that, remove all the Pokemon from your Team aside from Azumarill and Hariyama, then remove one attack from Azumarill. Finally, participate in a picnic and Azumaril should automatically learn Belly Drum.
Liquidation is a TM you can find out in the open-world. It can be found in several locations, but the easiest place to find it is on Glaseado Mountain.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Best Maushold Tera Raid Build

chapterContent.content: This page details how to use Maushold in Level 6 Tera Raids and the Level 7 Black Crystal Charizard Tera Raid in Pokémon Scarlet and Violet.

chapterContent.head: How to Use Maushold in the Charizard Tera Raid

chapterContent.content: Maushold has the ability to be a formidable Tera Raid Pokémon in your party. This includes not only being strong against Level 6 Tera Raids, but also during the timed Level 7 Raids, such as the Black Crystal Charizard Tera Raid event on the December 1 to December 4 2022, and December 15 to December 18, 2022. Head over to our guide on the Charizard Tera Raid for more information.
Make sure that you also aim to level up your Maushold to level 90-100 if you’re planning on using it in Level 6 and 7 Raids!

chapterContent.head: How to Get a Maushold

chapterContent.content: Maushold is a Normal-type Pokémon. To get one, you’ll need to first catch a Tandemaus, which is a Generation IX Pokémon found near the Pokémon League. In order to evolve a Tandemous into a Maushold, you’ll need to level it up to Lv 25. If it reaches this level during a battle, you will physically see it evolve. Otherwise, it will evolve without you noticing if it’s in your party or box.

chapterContent.head: Maushold Population Bomb

chapterContent.content: The most important move you’ll need your Maushold to know is the normal-type move Population Bomb. Population Bomb is learned at Level 53.

Population Bomb deals a base power of 20, hitting the target up to ten times per use (so 200 power if it lands all hits). Since Maushold is a Normal-type and Population Bomb is a Normal-type move, Maushold will gain STAB using it, so the damage will be boosted by 50% (in other words, 30 power each strike).

Each of Population Bomb’s hits has a separate accuracy check. The accuracy is 90% meaning you should land a lot of strikes, however, if one of the strikes miss, it will cancel the rest of the strikes. In its basest form, this attack doesn’t do a whole ton of damage, but it has a lot of potential!

If you want to use Maushold as a strong Tera Raid Pokémon, you’ll need to equip a held item that plays well with Population Bomb. Additionally, you’ll also want to make sure to unlock Maushold’s hidden ability, Technician. Read on for more information on best held items and how to unlock the Technician ability.

chapterContent.head: Best Held Items for Maushold and Population Bomb

chapterContent.content: Your Maushold’s held item should be working to make Population Bomb super strong. Below you’ll find some information on some of the best held items, what they do and where to get them!
Wide Lens is arguably the best held item for boosting Population Bomb as it will increase the accuracy of each strike from 90% to 99%, meaning that you should almost always hit 10 times.

That said, if you do miss an accuracy check, this means that the rest of the move is cancelled. So even with 99%, there’s still a chance that you could miss your early strikes and miss out on the full 10 hits.
If you crunch the numbers, on average, Wide Lens gives you roughly 9.4 hits.
Wide Lens can be purchased for 20,000 Pokédollars from the Delibird Presents store in Levincia.

Loaded Dice is another option, although not nearly as good as Wide Lens. If Maushold is holding Loaded Dice, only one accuracy check is performed (at the beginning, not for every hit) and, if the attack connects, Population Bomb will hit at least four times.
If you do the Maths, on average, Loaded Dice gives you roughly 6.3 hits. This is far less than what Wide Lens would give you!
Loaded Dice can also be purchased for 20,000 Pokédollars from the Delibird Presents store in Levincia.

chapterContent.head: Maushold Technician Hidden Ability

chapterContent.content: Your Maushold will either have the Friend Guard or Cheek Pouch ability - none of which are particularly good when trying to boost Population Bomb’s damage and strikes. You want Maushold’s Hidden Ability, Technician, which increases the power of moves which have a base power of 60 or less by 50%. This will increase each hit from 20 to 30, meaning that if you land 10 strikes with Population Bomb, it’ll have a base power of 300 (450 with STAB).

To get the Technician Ability, you’ll need to obtain Ability Patches. These are a rare drop only obtained from Level 6 Tera Raids. They aren’t always rewarded from these raids either so you might have to complete one or two of them before you’re able to unlock the Technician Ability.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Best Sylveon Tera Raid Build

chapterContent.content: Pokémon Scarlet & Violet is out now and Tera Raids are a large part of the online component of the game. There are certain Pokémon that are perfect for Tera Raids and this Sylveon build is one of them.

If you’ve been delving into the world of Tera Raids and have reached the point of taking on the challenging 5 and 6 Star Tera Raids, you may realize just how much more strategy comes into play. More importantly, you may notice that clearing these Offline with the AI is incredibly challenging, to the point of almost impossible. Even Online can be challenging if your teammates choose Pokémon that are not ideal.

Additionally, December 2nd, 2022 saw the start of the Charizard event and players have been busy trying to train the perfect Pokémon for this 7 Star Tera Raid. This Sylveon build tested by the excellent Pokémon community is especially useful for this, but all other Tera Raids too.

chapterContent.head: How to Catch Sylveon

chapterContent.content: In past Pokémon games, the Eevee evolutions can usually be a bit of a pain to find, but thankfully this is much easier in Pokémon Scarlet and Violet. Due to the existence of Tera Pokémon with fixed spawns, you’ll be able to find a Level 50 Tera Sylveon. Head to North Province (Area Three) and search to the east of Team Star Fairy’s base to locate it.

Alternatively, you can find regular Sylveons just outside Alfornada or by catching an Eevee and evolving into Sylveon through that method (which is by far the most time consuming). If you’re wanting to make use of Sylveon in the Charizard event, it’s best to go for the Tera Sylveon as it’ll already start at Level 50+, reducing the amount of levelling you’ll need to do.

chapterContent.head: Sylveon Build in Tera Raids

chapterContent.content: Sylveon has two really useful builds available to it, and the build we have covered for the Charizard event makes use of using Moonblast to deal with Charizard’s weaknesses. The purpose of this build, however, is a more general purpose build to be used in 5 and 6 Star Tera Raids but is also very useful for the Charizard event. This build makes use of the Hyper Voice move with a focus on Sp. Atk (vs Atk for Moonblast).
You’ll want your Sylveon to have the following:

Once you have your Sylveon, the first thing you’ll want to do is change the nature to Modest, this is done by purchasing a Modest Mint from Chansey Supply and then using it in your inventory. This will grant your Sylveon an increase of Sp. Atk at the expense of Atk.

You’ll want to ensure you Hyper Train your Sylveon, with a focus on HP (for survivability) and Sp. Atk (to make better use of Hyper Voice) along with ideally having Sylveon as high as level as possible (Level 100 being ideal).

You’ll need your Sylveon to have the Pixilate Ability, this turns Normal moves (of which Hyper Voice falls under) into Fairy moves, making this especially useful for the Charizard event. The good news is, Pixilate is Sylveon’s Hidden Ability, the bad news is, it’s a Hidden Ability. This means, to unlock it, you’ll need to get your hands on an Ability Patch and these are only available as a rare reward from 6 Star Tera Raids.
For your Held Item, you’ll want to give Sylveon the Metronome, as this will boost the power of a move that you use consecutively, something you’ll be doing a lot with Hyper Voice.

The final part of the build are the moves you’ll be using. Hyper Voice, the main move of this build, can be learnt by using the TM. You can find this TM by heading to South Province Area Six and heading just south of the Leaning Tower of Paldea fast travel while Sylveon will learn Misty Terrain naturally at Level 35.

Shadow Ball gives your Sylveon something to use against Ghost-type Raids and you can find the TM inside Area Zero, close to Research Station 4. Finally, Fake Tears will lower your target’s Sp. Def and can be found as a TM in South Province Area Two.

chapterContent.head: Sylveon Tera Raid Strategy

chapterContent.content: So now that you have your perfect Sylveon trained, how do you put all of this into action in a Tera Raid situation?

You can start a battle by using Misty Terrain to prepare the battlefield, this is especially useful against Charizard. Whether you decide to do this or not, you should settle on using Fake Tears to lower your target’s Sp. Def as low as possible before using Hyper Voice to dish out the damage.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Best Dachsbun Tera Raid Build

chapterContent.content: Those in the UK know about the immense health benefits of having a sausage wrapped up in Pastry, but we hope the same doesn’t apply to the Pokémon world. Dachsbun’s inspiration is very clear all terrible jokes aside, and it’s becoming a key player in Tera Raid top builds.

There’s a tonne of strategy and research to do when taking on anything higher than a 5-Star raid, which is why we’ve gone all in on events such as Charizard the Unmatched event and the best Pokémon Builds to use.

We’re seeing a huge surge in Azumarill and Sylveon builds at the time of writing because of the aforementioned event. With this Charizard sporting a Dragon Tera-type, Fairy-type builds are out in force and ready to take on the franchise’s pseudo-mascot.
Let’s get into everything players need to know about the best Dachnum Tera build:
Dachsbun can be caught at the following locations:

chapterContent.li: South-West corner of Paldea outside of Alfornada
Just outside of Medali
Near the South Province (Area Three) Pokémon Centre

chapterContent.content: Alternatively players can catch it’s pre-evolved form, Fidough at the start of the game and evolve at level 26. Unlike other best Tera Raid battle Pokémon, Dachsbun is easy enough to find and evolve. The hard part is leveling Dachsbun up past level 90 for it to hold its own in 6 and 7-Tera Raid battles. The good thing about grinding Tera Raids however are getting the following items to level up Pokémon quickly:

chapterContent.li: Rare Candy
Exp. Candy M
Exp. Candy L
Exp. Candy XL

chapterContent.head: Dachsbun Build In Tera Raids

chapterContent.content: The best way to use Dachbun in a Tera Raid is as a tank support. Much like its use against Charizard, Well-Baked Body is going to work amazingly against any Fire-type opponent due to taking to damage and increasing its defense stat by two stages when hit. Focusing EVs in HP and Defense will further back up this build, with its Impish Nature stocking up Defense further. To protect this strategy, we recommend using the Ability Shield as a held item to make sure this ability can’t be changed during battle.

Draining Kiss ensures players can deal Fairy-Type damage whilst generating HP in the same turn. Play Rough raises a users attack stat by one step, with Misty Terrain preventing any status conditions for grounded Pokémon. It’s certainly a team player, with Tera Blast available for Dachsbun to deal massive Fairy-type damage when Terastalized,

chapterContent.head: Dachsbun Tera Raid Strategy

chapterContent.content: As previously mentioned, Dachsbun is a brilliant support Pokémon with enough Attack behind it to make a difference in battle. We would recommend starting with Misty Terrain to ensure grounded Pokémon don’t get any status conditions. From here, carry on with Draining Kiss to heal any damage and Play Rough to build up Dachsbun’s Attack stat when its health is full. If the opportunity presents itself, Terastalize and use Tera Blast to deal Fairy-type damage.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: What are Black Crystal Tera Raids?

chapterContent.content: This is guide for the special Black Crystal Tera Raid Battles in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet. These are high-level raids and will contain very powerful Pokémon you can battle.

After completing certain postgame events, you may encounter Black Tera Raid crystals on the overworld. These feature specific Pokémon and/or Pokémon with a specific Tera Type. These Pokémon are also incredibly strong!

During 1st to 4th and 15th to 18th December 2022, Charizard will appear in Black Crystal Tera Raid Battles. Charizard does not normally appear in Paldea and the Charizard caught here will have the Dragon Tera Type, plus a rare Mark: Mightiest. You can only catch one Charizard (per save game) during this event.

chapterContent.aside: Although you must be in the postgame to find Black Tera Raid crystals, you can join somebody else’s Black Crystal Tera Raid Battle at any point in the game. Of course, it’d probably help if your Pokémon are suitably strong. No earlygame weaklings, please!

To find Tera Raid Battle Events, your Nintendo Switch must be connected to the Internet. The game will then automatically download the latest Poké Portal News, which may contain new Tera Raid Battle events. You can also manually download Poké Portal News via the Mystery Gift menu.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Black Crystal Tera Raid - Charizard

chapterContent.content: Not every Pokemon is available in Pokemon Violet and Pokemon Scarlet. In fact, one of the most popular Pokemon of all time, Charizard, can’t be obtained through normal means. If you want to add this Pokemon to your team, then you will need to participate in a limited-time event before it goes away for good. Below we go over everything you need to know about the Seven Star Black Crystal Tera Raid that will guarantee you your very own Charizard to take home.

chapterContent.head: Event Times

chapterContent.content: Thursday, December 1, 2022, at 4:00 p.m. to Sunday, December 4, 2022, at 3:59 p.m. PST
Thursday, December 15, 2022, at 4:00 p.m. to Sunday, December 18, 2022, at 3:59 p.m. PST

chapterContent.head: What is a Tera Raid

chapterContent.content: These are special Tera events that can be triggered through interacting with Black Tera Crystals on the map in the postgame. For a complete overview of Tera Raids, check out our helpful guide here.

chapterContent.head: How to Get Charizard

chapterContent.content: To get Charizard, you presumably have to beat the game to unlock the Black Tera Raids. After that, you need to interact with the crystals during the time periods above to take on Charizard and have a chance to bring it home. Only one Charizard can be obtained per game, but the site does mention that there may be more chances in the future to gain more Charizards.
The official site also states that you can participate in this raid even after capturing Charizard. At this point, you will be given other rewards for your participation.
We will update this page with further information when the Charizard raid goes live.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Best Charizard Event Pokemon Builds

chapterContent.content: The best Charizard event Pokémon builds very much depends on the type of moves the Level 7 Tera Raid Black Crystal Charizard will feature. Providing the Pokémon in question is touching level 100, a strong type advantage will shine through the Dragon-type onslaught.

chapterContent.head: The Best Charizard Event Pokemon Builds

chapterContent.content: We’ve got five viable best Charizard event Pokemon Builds to choose from. They’re in no particular order but they do share that all-important Fairy-typing which is super-effective against the Dragon Tera-Type the Black Crystal Charizard will be sporting. Let’s get into it:
A Water and Fairy type, Azumaril is only weak against Electric Types. This means it will take neutral damage at best from any Steel-type moves Charizard may pull out. Here’s the full picture:

The above moveset is focused on reducing attack and damage stats whilst maximizing Azumarill’s damage output. Superpower lowers attack and defense, Play Rough lowers attack and Liquidation gives players a 20% chance of knocking an opponent’s defense down by one stage. Belly Drums kicks up a user’s attack stat up to the maximum amount at the cost of 50% HP, which is a powerhouse move when combined with Azumarill’s moveset.
Huge Power ability will also boost Azumarill’s attack stat, with its Adamant nature boosting its attack stat further.
Help with finding Azumarill, its moveset and more can be found in our best Azumarill Tera Raid build.

chapterContent.aside: Before the release of Pokémon Gold and Silver on Game Boy Color, fans assumed Marill was an evolution of Pikachu. First appearing in the west as part of Pikachu’s Vacation, the accompanying short of Pokémon: The First Movie, the official English name wasn’t confirmed back then.

chapterContent.content: Maushold is taking competitive play by storm at the moment thanks to its killer normal-type STAB move Population Bomb. IT has a base power of 20 but can hit up to ten times at 90% accuracy. It’s a game changer for sure in a pinch, but Normal type attacks aren’t the best way forward for the best Charizard event Pokemon Builds. Let’s get into a build that is:

Population bomb has been included in this build for obvious reasons, it’s a powerhouse of a move as previously stated in our best Maushold Tera Raid build. Play Rough is going to deal 2 x damage to the Black Crystal Event Charizard whilst lowering its defense by one step, with Charm knocking down an opponent’s attack stat by two steps. Encore will come in handy if the Charizard in question has a move that isn’t very effective towards Maushold and the team, making it repeat the move for three turns.

The Friend Guard ability will also reduce non-direct damage to the team by up to 25%, which will no doubt come in handy. Mausholds Adamant nature will also increase its attack stat but will unfortunately lower its defense stat.

Everyone’s favourite pastry dog Pokémon comes loaded with a singular Fairy typing, meaning maximum effectiveness and one of the best Charizard Event Pokémon builds. Here’s what buns it’s got in the oven:

The best part of this build is Dachsbun’s Well-Baked ability, shielding it from fire-type moves. Granted, we’ll be seeing the Event Charizard sporting Dragon and possibly Steel type, but we’re bound to see fire attacks in action too.

Draining Kiss doesn’t only cause damage but heals the attacking Pokémon too. This means this Fairy-type attack will turn the tide of battle against Dragon types. We’ve also got Terra Blast making the most of Dachbun’s Fairy Tera Typing and reaping the rewards of a higher attack stat thanks to its Adamant Nature.

Misty Terrain will protect grounded Pokémon from all status conditions, meaning the Tera Raid team and player can concentrate on the offensive. Finally, Play Rough will lower The Event Charizard’s attack stat which will no doubt come in handy.

chapterContent.aside: Chinese moon goddess Chang E is often depicted as being accompanied by the mythical moon rabbit. Adorned with multiple ribbons and a robe, it may have served as Sylveon’s inspiration due to fairies being associated with moonlight.

chapterContent.content: Introduced in generation six, Sylveon is one of the finer examples of a Fairy type Pokémon. It’s also one of the best Charizard Event Pokémon builds thanks to its effectiveness against Dragon types, although we’ll have to watch out for any Steel type moves:

Sylveon is a powerful Fairy-type attacker. Its ability Pixelate turns Normal-type moves into Fairy type and gives an extra 20% damage boost to boot. This gives Last Resort a powerful boost against Charizard for those in a tight spot who want to turn the tables before a KO.

Its Adamant nature boosts attack and will make attacks such as Play Rough more powerful whilst knocking down the event Charizard’s attack stat by one step. Moonblast is a powerful special attack that also has a 30% chance of reducing Event Charizard’s Special Attack stat down by one step. Dazzling Gleam really shines in doubles battles as it hits all opponents at once, but nonetheless, it’s a great move to pair up with Sylveon’s Fairy Tera Typing.

Grimmsnarl is a great tank choice when it comes to deciding on the best Charizard event Pokémon builds. Very much playing the fall guy of a Tera raid team, Grimmsnarl is best played out with the following build:

Grimmsnarl’s Prankster ability boosts status affecting moves up the que by +1, which means it can get a move such as Light Screen in sooner. Not only will this help shield the Tera raid team, but Taunt will draw Charizard’s attention and allow the rest of the team to execute their strategies without interruption.

Its Calm nature stacks up Grimmsnarl’s Calm nature boosts its special defense, which is arguably the most important stat facing Event Charizard. Draining Kiss can support this further by replenishing HP whilst dealing Fairy Type damage, something that its Fairy Tera Typing will exaggerate.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Charizard Tera Raid Event - Moves, Stats and Drops

chapterContent.content: The infamous 7-Star Tera Raid event, Charizard the Unrivaled, has finally dropped and runs from December 1st-4th and December 15th to 18th. There’s more content than originally expected for the 1.1.0 version update, including two 5/6 star Terra Raids that will come in handy when fighting Charizard.

chapterContent.head: Charizard Black Crystal 7-Star Tera Raid Event

chapterContent.content: Whilst we’ve already given readers the best Charizard Black Crystal Event Pokémon builds, we still need to know its moveset, stats, and item drops. We thought we’d just go mad and provide this information for all three new Terra Raids, so let’s get straight into it:
Let’s start with the main event, here’s what trainers can expect from Charizard the Unrivaled:

This all Female Fairy Type is a perfect Tera Raid to accompany Charizard the Unrivaled thanks to it’s big counter potential. It’s going to be in 4 and 5-star Tera Raids post-1.1.0 update, so let’s get into all the information trainers need:

Mimikyu is a favorite along competitive players for a reason. It levels fast and has an ability that buffs an opponent’s fight attack. Its Ghost/Fairy typing also gives it a good spread of attacks, strengths and weaknesses. Let’s get into what trainers can expect from these 4 and 5-Star Mega Raids:

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Eevee Spotlight Tera Raid Event

chapterContent.content: Pokémon Scarlet & Violet is out now and Nintendo will be updating the game with regular Tera Raid Events. The Eevee Spotlight is the first such event, releasing on November 25th 2022 and running until November 27th. This page will give you the details on everything you need to know.

chapterContent.head: Eevee Spotlight Tera Raid Event Release Time

chapterContent.content: The most crucial question here is “when does the Eevee event begin?”, and you’ll find the details in the table below:
We’re not aware yet if this, or any other Tera Raid Events will be returning so don’t miss your opportunity to catch these elusive Eevees while this event is active!

chapterContent.head: What is the Eevee Spotlight Tera Raid Event?

chapterContent.content: At the time of writing, it’s been one week since Pokémon Scarlet & Violet and by now, you’re probably well aware of what Tera-Raid battles are. As you explore Paldea, you’ll come across crystal dens and, when interacted with, you’ll be able to fight against special Tera Pokémon who you can fight alongside three other players online or with the AI handling them if you can’t find anyone to play with.

Once you’ve downloaded the latest update, you’ll start seeing special crystal dens out in the wild. These will have a swirl around them, and these indicate that this is an Eevee Spotlight Tera Raid. Once you interact with them, you will then be able to participate in one of five different Eevee encounters based on the star level of the battle.

chapterContent.head: Eevee Tera Raid Event Rewards

chapterContent.content: One of the main rewards from this event are the different Eevee’s you can catch with different Tera Types. You’ll have to look around, as each battle against these Eevees will have it as a random Tera Type, but all of them can be found throughout the various new crystal dens. On top of this, you’ll get a whole host of rewards based on the star level you fight the Eevees at and you can find out all the details below:

chapterContent.aside: The Rewards table below shows the potential rewards from a Tera Raid, you are not guaranteed to receive all of these items.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: What are School Classes for?

chapterContent.content: In Pokémon Scarlet & Violet, Naranja (Scarlet) and Uva (Violet) Academy play a large role in the region of Paldea. As part of being a student, you can take classes and this page will detail what the purpose of this is.

chapterContent.head: When Can you Begin Taking Classes?

chapterContent.content: The start of Pokémon Scarlet & Violet begins with you making your way to Mesagoza to enroll at the Academy there alongside Nemona. Once you reach the Academy, you’ll go through some mandatory story scenes and soon after, the Treasure Hunt will begin and you’ll officially start the three story paths, Victory Road, Path of Legends, and Starfall Street.

At this point, most players will set off to explore Paldea and everything it has to offer, completely forgetting about the school. However, you can now undertake several classes, all of which will lead to a midterm test before you can take the next set of classes, all of which culminate in a final test.
As you progress through the story paths of Pokémon Scarlet & Violet, you’ll unlock more subjects you can take classes in, which means new teachers to befriend.

chapterContent.head: What do you get for Classes?

chapterContent.content: You won’t get to see the main benefits of classes until post-game, but until then, they’re useful beyond just the background lore of the Paldea region.

Every subject has its own teacher and they all have a bond that you can raise every time you attend one of their classes. The questions you get in regular classes seem to have no real benefit on the increase of your bond with them, but the midterms do have a huge impact if you answer the questions correctly.

chapterContent.head: Befriending Rewards

chapterContent.content: As you finish your final tests and befriend your teachers, there will be another event with each of the teachers where you’ll obtain a reward. You’ll find the list of rewards below:

You’ll see that there are some really great rewards from this list so it’s well worth taking the time to attend the classes and pass the tests with flying colors. If you’re looking for the test answers for all of these classes, you’ll find them on our guides for them here.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Biology Midterm and Final Test Answers

chapterContent.content: In Pokémon Scarlet & Violet, Naranja (Scarlet) and Uva (Violet) Academy play a large role in the region of Paldea. As part of being a student, you can take classes and this page will detail what all all test answers are for the Biology Subject.

You’ll take Biology with Mr. Jacq, and his lessons and tests will focus on topics such as how to improve the friendship of your Pokémon, information on breeding and evolution, and tips on how to catch Pokémon. More lessons will become available to you after you progress through the game and you can take each lesson consecutively.

Taking Classes all follow the same structure, you must first sit three lessons, all of which have a question to answer. Your choice here doesn’t impact your bond with your Teacher, but we’ve provided the correct answers regardless.

Following the first three lessons, you’ll take a Midterm which has four questions where you’ll need to get at least three correct answers to pass. You will then be able to take a further three lessons before the Final exam, which will complete the subject.

chapterContent.head: Pre-Midterm Biology Lesson Answers in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet
Biology Midterm Test Answers in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet

chapterContent.content: Successfully passing the Midterm will award you with five Exp. Candy S and unlock the next set of classes.

chapterContent.head: Pre-Final Biology Lesson Answers in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet
Biology Final Test Answers in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet

chapterContent.content: Successfully passing the Final exam will award you with five Exp. Candy M and complete the subject. Remember you can speak with Mr. Jacq to show him your Pokédex, you will obtain the Shiny Charm if you manage to record all 400!

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Picnic Shiny Farming Method

chapterContent.content: It’s no secret that there are always little tricks to trying to farm shiny Pokemon. Pokemon Scarlet and Pokemon Violet are no different in that regard. In many ways, farming shiny Pokemon is easier than ever in these games, with several different ways to increase your odds. Of course, to have the highest chance of catching a shiny Pokemon, you will need to game the system a bit using the Shiny Picnic Method. Below we go over how to use picnics to farm shiny Pokemon.

chapterContent.head: The Shiny Picnic Method

chapterContent.content: This method may seem a bit strange at first, but it uses the game’s own reset system to help you make the most of mass outbreaks. Below are the simple steps needed to farm shiny Pokemon using mass outbreaks and picnics to amplify your odds.
A few tips for this method are using methods to increase your odds of actually finding a shiny.
In addition, if you don’t like the available mass outbreaks on your map, you can move your Nintendo Switch clock forward a day in order to reset your mass outbreaks.

chapterContent.head: How to Further Increase Your Shiny Odds

chapterContent.content: Without increasing your odds of getting a Shiny Pokemon, you are looking at a 1/4096 odds of actually getting a shiny. In other words, you will be farming all day and probably for some time after that to find your first shiny Pokemon. To speed up this method, there are three things you can do.

chapterContent.li: Get the Shiny Charm for filling the Paldea Pokedex.
Making Sparkling Sandwiches using Herba Mystica.
Defeat Pokemon during the mass outbreak.

chapterContent.content: You can combine all three of the methods above together to greatly increase your chance of finding a shiny Pokemon in the wild. Just make sure to save before starting each farming session in case something goes wrong and you need to reset to an earlier point.
Here is the chart that shows you the odds of catching a shiny Pokemon with each method.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Where to Get Herba Mystica

chapterContent.content: Pokemon Scarlet and Pokemon Violet come with a ton of new mechanics, including a food system. You are now able to make sandwiches, and for the most part, you will be picking ingredients up from stores in the various towns in the game. Some ingredients are rare and can only be obtained through special means. These are called Herba Mystica and can boost your odds of finding shiny Pokemon, making them a must for many players. Below we go over everything you need to know about Herba Mystica and how to use them.

chapterContent.head: What Are Herba Mystica?

chapterContent.content: Herba Mystica are food items in Pokemon Violet and Pokemon Scarlet. To use them, you must set up a picnic and make them into a sandwich. They are a rare item that can only be obtained in the post-game, and there are five different types.

You can only get Herba Mystica from participating in five-star and up Tera Raids. These are rare items, and you are depending on the game’s RNG system to give them to you. Your best chance of getting one comes with completing a six-star Tera Raid. Here is what Pokemon will drop each Herba Mystica.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Meal Powers in Scarlet & Violet

chapterContent.content: This page lists all the Meal Powers in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet and their effects.

chapterContent.head: What are Meal Powers?

chapterContent.content: Meal Powers are bonus effects you can obtain from eating sandwiches during picnics or foods at restaurants etc. These effects can help you obtain certain Pokémon or rewards more easily.
Meal Powers only work for a certain duration: 30 minutes.

This should be more than enough time to achieve everything you want though. However, in the case of Sparkling Power, it can be hard to stock up on and you might not encounter a Shiny Pokémon within 30 minutes.
What you can do is disable Auto-Save, save the game and use the Meal Power. Then if, after 30 minutes are up and you didn’t get what you want, reset the game.
Yes and no. With one food source, you can stack up to 3 Meal Powers. However, if you eat another food source, its Meal Powers will overwrite the previous ones.

chapterContent.head: List of Meal Powers

chapterContent.aside: Meal Powers have different strength Levels. A Level 3 Meal Power provides the biggest boost.

chapterContent.content: Effect: Increased chance of finding Pokémon Eggs from the picnic basket.
This is super useful when breeding Pokémon, especially if you’re breeding lots of Pokémon, for shiny-hunting purposes etc.
Unlike other Powers, Egg Power is universal and doesn’t apply to certain types only. Making it even more useful.
Effect: Increased chance of catching Pokémon with Poké Balls.
If you’re trying to fill your Pokédex or catch some tricky Legendary Pokémon, you don’t want to leave home without this. This will make it easier to catch Pokémon of a certain Type.
Effect: Increased amount of experience points from battles.
Are you stuck at a tricky fight or feel like your Pokémon are a bit under-leveled? Well, this Meal Power could be useful when grinding out Levels for your Pokémon.
Effect: Increased amount of TM materials from battles.
You can never have too many materials. Especially if you’re trying to teach your Pokémon multiple TMs.
Effect: Increased amount of rewards from Tera Raid Battles.
A no-brainer if you’re attempting Tera Raid Battles to nab rare items like Tera Crystal Shards and Herba Mystica.
Effect: Increased chance of encountering Pokémon with Titles.

A bit on the obscure side. Every Pokémon you catch has a chance of possessing a Mark, depending on the circumstances of their capture. Marks can be viewed in a Pokémon’s status screen. If a Pokémon has a Mark, you can equip it to bestow the corresponding Title to that Pokémon.
Effect: Increased chance of encountering Shiny Pokémon.
Essential if you’re serious about shiny-hunting. This only works on wild Pokémon, not Pokémon hatched from Eggs or encountered in Tera Raid Battles.
Effect: Increased chance of encountering Pokémon of a large Size.

You may have noticed that the same Pokémon can come in slightly different sizes. This is noticeable when you encounter a big group of Pokémon–some may be smaller, while some may be bigger. Anyway, this effect makes it more likely for Pokémon of a certain Type to be big. Great if you love having big things.
Effect: Increased chance of encountering Pokémon of a small Size.
This is the same deal as Humungo Power, but for small Pokémon. Great if you love having teeny tiny stuff.
Effect: Increased chance of encountering Pokémon of a certain Type.
Last but not least, if you’re searching for a Pokémon species that has a low spawn rate, you’ll probably want this.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Every Sandwich Recipe in Scarlet & Violet

chapterContent.content: This page lists every sandwich recipe in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet. Also includes their effects and how to obtain.

chapterContent.head: How to Use Sandwich Recipes

chapterContent.content: To use a sandwich recipe, inspect the picnic table during a picnic and choose “Make a Sandwich”. The available recipes will then appear along the left side of the screen. As long as you have the required ingredients (shown on the right side), you can make a sandwich using those recipes.
If you press , you will switch to “Creative Mode”, where you can create a sandwich using any ingredients you own. To swap back to “Recipe Mode”, press  again.

chapterContent.head: How to Find Sandwich Recipes

chapterContent.content: At the beginning, you will have 5 basic sandwich recipes. To obtain more recipes, visit a sandwich shop in Mesagoza, with a big sandwich sign above the door. There’s one nearby to the left, when entering via the south gate of Mesagoza (map marker).

Inside the shop, speak to the guy with the “New sandwiches” text bubble. At the beginning, he’ll probably have nothing to teach you. However, as you progress the game, you may learn new recipes from him. Whenever he has new recipes to teach, you’ll receive all of them at once.
In addition, there are some recipes that require Herba Mystica, obtained from 5 or 6-star Tera Raids. Once you have one of these, try speaking to the guy in the sandwich shop.

chapterContent.head: How To Unlock More Sandwich Recipes

chapterContent.content: Throughout the game you’ll come across and have to defeat different Gyms which will reward you with Gym Badges. This will allow you to have higher level Pokemon obey you and you’ll want to revisit the Sandwich Shop to learn new recipes. If you would like to know what order to tackle the gyms in, then refer to this page: Best Victory Road Route in Pokémon Scarlet and Violet.

chapterContent.head: List of Picnic Sandwich Recipes

chapterContent.aside: This page is a work-in-progress

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Best Sandwiches for Hunting Shiny Pokémon

chapterContent.content: One of the most popular things to do in Pokemon Scarlet and Pokemon Violet is to hunt for shiny Pokemon. These are Pokemon that are extremely rare and have a different color palette than they normally would in-game. Shiny hunting has become much easier in recent generations, and just by making some sandwiches, you can boost the rate for shiny Pokemon to appear in your game. Below we go over how to make sandwiches for shiny hunting and just how much these items will affect your shiny rate.

chapterContent.head: How Much Do Sandwiches Boost Your Shiny Rate?

chapterContent.content: The most important thing to know when shiny hunting is the math. Just how much time can you save shiny hunting when making Sandwiches in Pokemon Violet and Pokemon Scarlet? Making a sparkling sandwich gives you three more rolls, increasing your roll total to four. Put into normal terms, you have a 1/1024 chance of encountering a shiny Pokemon when using this method alone.

What if you have the shiny charm or use mass outbreaks though? Then how do your odds even out? Below we have a table displaying how to get the lowest number of encounters needed to find a shiny Pokemon.

With that being said, if you’re not just ok with going along with whatever Pokemon decides to outbreak, you will want to make sandwiches that not only increase the shiny rate but increase the spawn rate for the Pokemon you are looking for.
If you don’t like your current mass outbreaks but are interested in resetting them. Simply move your clock to the next day on your Nintendo Switch.

In order to make Sparkling Sandwiches, you will need to gather different types Herba Mystica from five-star or above raids, with six stars seeming to be the easiest to get Herba Mystica from. These can take a while to farm out and can only be done once you have reached the Pokemon Scarlet and Pokemon Violet post-game. Once you do collect some, then you can have a picnic and make the following recipes to help boost your shiny Pokemon rate.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: How to Breed Pokémon in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet

chapterContent.content: This page offers all the information you’ll need for how to breed Pokémon and hatch eggs in Pokémon Scarlet & Violet.

chapterContent.head: Breeding Pokémon at a Picnic

chapterContent.content: In this Pokémon game, breeding works a little differently. In order to breed Pokémon and hatch eggs, you’ll need to use the Picnic system. You can start a Picnic anywhere in the world, except where the terrain is unsuitable (slopes, water) or in cities.
When you successfully breed two Pokémon, you’ll be able to check the basket at the end of the picnic table for eggs!

chapterContent.head: What Pokémon Can you Breed?

chapterContent.content: In order to actually breed 2 Pokémon, you’ll need to have compatible Pokémon of two different sexes. Compatible Pokémon are Pokémon that are found within the same Egg Group. There are 15 Egg Groups with several breedable Pokémon in each group.
Head over to our guide on Egg Groups for more information on all the Pokémon found in different Egg Groups!

Once you have a male and a female Pokémon from the same Egg Group, start up a Picnic! It’s now a waiting game - it seems to be random how long it takes so you may be here a while! Just keep interacting with the basket at the end of the table to check if there are any eggs.

You can improve your breeding rates by making Sandwiches with Egg Power. Fruit Sandwiches and Peanut Butter Sandwiches can give you Egg Power. You can also purchase food with Egg Power from various shops across Paldea. Check Medali’s wide range of restaurants for food that has Egg Power!

chapterContent.head: How to Hatch a Pokémon Egg

chapterContent.content: Once you have an Egg, move it from your boxes into your team and start running around! The amount of running around you’ll need to do is dependent on the egg you’re hatching so it could be quick or you might just need to run around for a good while. Luckily, it still works if you’re on your mount so you can go quickly.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Ditto Egg Group

chapterContent.content: This page offers information on breeding Ditto at picnics in Pokémon Scarlet and Violet.

chapterContent.head: How to Breed with Ditto

chapterContent.content: Ditto is a Pokémon that is often hard to find because it can assume the appearance of other Pokémon. If you do manage to find and catch one, Ditto is unique in the fact that it can breed with any Pokémon from any Egg Group (except the No Egg group)!

All you’ll need to do to breed with a Ditto is pop it in your team and set up a picnic. You’ll then need to wait until an egg appears in the basket by the picnic table. If you want it to breed with a specific Pokémon, you’ll want to remove all the other Pokémon from your team. Breeding can sometimes be quite a waiting game but you can do some other stuff to speed things along and increase your chances of finding an egg! Head over to our guide on How to Breed Pokémon in Scarlet & Violet.

chapterContent.head: How to Find Dittos

chapterContent.content: Dittos are quite tough to find but there are a couple of things you can do to help during the hunt.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Delibird Presents: Mesagoza Item List

chapterContent.content: Delibird Presents is a unique shop where you can exchange money for rare items. These items are needed to help boost Pokemon stats, evolve certain Pokemon like Eevee, and customize your Rotom Phone.
The first Delibird store you will encounter is in Mesagoza, just down from the Pokemon Academy.
Below is what they sell, where they are located, and some information about all the items.

chapterContent.head: Delibird Presents Mesagoza

chapterContent.content: You can find the Mesagoza Delibird shop located at the bottom of the city. Simply take a left after entering through the gate that connects to Los Platos, and you will see the storefront.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Deli Cioso

chapterContent.content: Throughout Pokemon Scarlet and Pokemon Violet, there is a large number of shops selling goods. Out of these, the shops that sell ingredients for sandwiches are some of the most beneficial out there. Deli Cioso is one of the very first shops you will run into in the game and a great place to stock up on all the sandwich basics. Below we go over everything this shop sells along with the prices for each item so that you can be the most informed shopper possible.

chapterContent.head: What Are Ingredients Used For in Pokemon Scarlet and Pokemon Violet?

chapterContent.content: Ingredients are used to make sandwiches in Pokemon Scarlet and Pokemon Violet. You can do this when you set up a picnic to help you gain useful buffs, like increasing the rate at which your Pokemon gain experience. The ingredients found at Deli Cioso, like the peppers, are actually extremely important as they are used in sandwiches that up Pokemon spawn rates and make it easier to find shiny pokemon.

chapterContent.head: Useful Links

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Chansey Supply

chapterContent.content: There are tons of stores located around the Paldea region in Pokemon Scarlet and Pokemon Violet. These stores sell many of the items you need to ensure a top-performing team. Unlike in previous games, though, stores are just something you go to one specific town to shop at. There are chains, like Chansey Supply, that appear in several of the major cities all across the region. Below we take a look at Chansey Supply, what they sell, and how to unlock all of the store’s items for purchase.

chapterContent.head: What is Chansey Supply

chapterContent.content: Chansey Supply is a store more or less selling supplements for Pokemon. If you have played previous games, then you will immediately recognize items on the store’s list, like speed-enhancing Carbos. This store is essential to increasing your EVs and is an important stop for any trainer out there. With that being said, though, many of the items will only unlock after you have progressed in the game. This is especially important if you are trying to buy nature mints.

chapterContent.head: Chansey Supply Locations

chapterContent.content: There are several Chansey Supply locations sprinkled around the Paldea region. Here is where they are located.

chapterContent.li: The Chansey Supply in Mesagoza is located near the eastern Pokemon Center.
The Chansey Supply in Levincia is located at the end of the street from the northern Pokemon Center.
The Chansey Supply in Cascarrafa is located on the same level as the Pokemon Center.
The Chansey Supply in Montenevera is located at the end of the street opposite the Pokemon Center.

chapterContent.head: Chansey Supply Items and Unlock Requirements

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Restaurants

chapterContent.content: A huge part of Pokemon Scarlet and Pokemon Violet’s gameplay is using food to give you certain buffs. While you can make your own sandwiches and just have a nice picnic for yourself, there are some easier options for players wanting to skip the mini-game and seeking out ingredients. Simply head to a restaurant and grab a meal that will give you the buffs you want. If you are a bit lost on the whole process, then don’t worry. The guide below goes over every in-game restaurant, their locations, and each franchise’s menu.

chapterContent.head: What Are Restaurants Used For in Pokemon Scarlet and Pokemon Violet?

chapterContent.content: You can go to restaurants to buy meals that increase your stats. The effect will take place immediately as you will consume the food as soon as it’s purchased. Each restaurant has a non-changing selection of food, so it’s a nice place to grab some quick boosts. If you’re looking to do things like shiny hunt, though, then you will need to focus on making your own sandwiches. We have a guide on making sandwiches which can be found here, and one that details meal powers that can read here.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Darktide Imperial Edition Skins Available During Full launch

chapterContent.content: Fatshark is offering players a deluxe version, featuring cosmetics as a support reward for the Imperial Edition. However, the Darktide Imperial Editions skins are not available until the full game launch on November 30. The result is that players who bought the Imperial Edition will have to wait until the full game launches.

Over on the game’s official Discord, community manager Hedge posted the update regarding the Imperial Edition skins: “PRE-ORDER ITEMS AND IMPERIAL EDITION SKINS. These items will be granted to eligible players on November 30th!”

Fatshark stated in the main beta update post shared on their site and socials that the game is still in a testing phase. Therefore, players can expect wipes and beta progression to not carry over to the full game. Moreso, not all of the game’s features are present in the pre-order beta while the devs still improve performance, and test progression, levels and more. Even the cash shop is not in the game just yet, which will prevent you from spending that Aquilas premium currency you get from the bundle too.
Therefore, most of the game’s cosmetics are not available in the game, bar a few base cosmetics through character achievements and the recently revealed Twitch Drops.
Once when November 30 arrives, players will be able to get their hands on the Imperial Editon skins, featuring:

chapterContent.li: Loyalist Pack: Purge heresy in style with these 4 unique class outfits, 8 weapon skin patterns, one set of headgear as well as an Ogryn body tattoo.
Mortis Veteran Portrait Frame: A cosmetic portrait frame used to pay tribute to the fallen defenders of Tertium Hive.
Caducades Backpack: A cosmetic backpack for human characters. Scavenged from the fallen troops of Cadia, this backpack has been repurposed to serve those still alive and fighting.
2500 Aquilas (premium currency)

chapterContent.content: If you’re interested in getting cosmetics in Darktide, why not check out the Twitch Drops and the cosmetics you can get by completing the penance achievements in the game?

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Darktide Beta Start Time for Pre Orders Revealed

chapterContent.content: Fatshark has announced that the Darktide Beta start time for those who pre-order will go live on November 17, at 18:00 UTC. Players can go in and test the game in a closed beta-like setting, helping to test the game before its official release date arrives on November 30.

chapterContent.aside: The beta is now live. If you cant download, restart Steam. Steam just sent out an update, so things are a little slow. Doing this should eventually get your download to work.

chapterContent.head: Darktie Pre-order Beta Start Time set for 18:00 UTC

chapterContent.content: The news of the Darktide pre order beta comes through an official update via the Darktide discord. Aqshy, a community manager on the Darktide Discord, posted this update on the FAQ text channel: “The pre-order beta will go live 10am PST/18:00 UTC/19:00 CET November 17.”
For those wondering, the release time for the world timezones for our most common readers are as follows:

chapterContent.li: AEST: 04:00

chapterContent.content: As it stands, there is currently no pre-load time for the beta. The downloads will only go live as the pre-order beta begins. So, if you are interested in giving it a go, you will likely jump in sometime after the launch in your region. There also needs to be confirmation of the size of the beta too. The previous beta test was around 32GBs, so it’s safe to assume that the pre-order beta file size will be similar, likely trending more towards the 40-50GB margin. If you have slower internet download speeds, you can better plan your beta playtesting experience if you’re at work or happens to be home while the beta officially goes live.

Remember, this is not an earthly access release, and the devs are still very much committing this is a private beta. You will encounter bugs, technical issues, and other shenanigans as the devs are still working on the day 1 patch. You will experience issues, so any feedback you can give the devs to get the game ready for the actual release date is still very important.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Will the Darktide Pre-Order Beta Progression Carry into Full Release? Maybe

chapterContent.content: The Darktide pre-order beta is going live on November 17, and players will get to test the game in the final two weeks before the official launch. When the beta was announced, there is questions over weather the pre-order beta progression will carry over to the full game. The answer to that is partially answered.

chapterContent.head: Will Darktide beta progression carry over? No guarantees as of yet

chapterContent.content: At the time of writing, there is no guarantee whether or not the progression will carry into the full Darktide launch. Hedge, one of the community managers over on the Darktide Discord stated on November 10 in the general channel:

This is one of the subjects that will need to be kept an eye on during the pre order beta test. The result is that players will need to monitor the Darktide Discord and see the official stance at any point during the two-week beta period.

Essentially, the beta period will remain largely a test. If the game requires a wipe because of broken or unbalanced content, they will wipe it to refresh the slate clean. However, if the game stays b balanced and with a reasonable progression, then chances are the progression will carry onto the full launch.

The full intention of the beta is to work out whats fair, progress well, and also find bugs and other technical issues ready for the day 1 patch. More so, we are also aware that the contents of the pre-order beta That could also indicate that players may need to be reset or hit a wall that doesn’t exist in the game. Again, this could work in our favor to keep progression from the beta to the full game, or it could go against it. As we get closer towards the end of the beta, chances are we ill know the true answer to that question.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Fatshark Reveal Darktide Twitch Drops for Pre-order Beta and Launch Week

chapterContent.content: Fatshark, the publisher and developer behind the anticipated Darktide horde coop ARPG game, has revealed Twitch Drops will run through the first pre-order beta weekend. Here is everything you need to know about the Darktide Twitch Drops promotion.

chapterContent.head: How to get Darktide Twitch Drops

chapterContent.content: In total, there are seven rewards players can get for the Twitch Drops campaign, which is as follows:

To get these drops on the eligible dates and requirements, you need to watch streams on twitch from eligible !Drops enabled streamers. Note that each of the drops is only available for a 24-hour period. The campaign for each reward begins at 12:00 UTC, which you can find in your local time by visiting the Twitch Campaigns section and scrolling until you see Darktide.

These Twitch drops will last through the weekends of the Pre-order beta, and the official first-week launch of the game. However, players must first create a Darktide account, and connect it to their Steam or Windows PC accounts. You will need to head over to this accounts portal to get started.
