chapterContent.head: Where to Find Raider Stronghold

chapterContent.content: The Raider Stronghold is located underneath Tyr’s Temple, with the entrance being on the northern side of it. This is probably the easiest of the four camps, due to there not being too many enemies. You will only find four regular Kol Raiders here, so there’s not much to actually trick you. Once you defeat all four enemies, you will be done with this camp.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find Raider Hideout

chapterContent.content: This camp is not too far from the Raider Stronghold. A little east of it on the map, there is a split, where you can either go up a slight hill or take a lower path. If you go the lower path, you will come to the entrance for the Hideout. There will only be a small number of enemies here at first, but more will show up as you kill the first wave. There’s nothing out of the ordinary, though, as it’s just mainly the normal Kol Raiders, with a few Scouts mixed in. There is a pot that produces a fire bomb here, in case you want to use that to your advantage in battle.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find Raider Keep

chapterContent.content: On the southern side of Tyr’s Temple is where you will find the entrance to this camp. It’s not actually connected to Tyr’s Temple, but on the southern side of the ice wall there. You will have a good number of enemies here, mostly normal Kol Raiders and Scouts. Be mindful of the Scouts on the upper levels, as they will sit there and try to peg you with their fire projectiles.

chapterContent.head: Oluf Nautson Boss Fight

chapterContent.content: This guy will spawn whenever you clear out the fourth camp, so the challenge will depend on which camp you do last. The easiest, in terms of layout, is probably the Stronghold, as it’s a circular, flat room. Whatever the case, Oluf is basically like a Chief, but a little more challenging, and with some more moves in his arsenal. Let’s take a look at his moves first.

Oluf will do a sweeping attack with his weapon (yellow ring), followed by a quick jab with the handle, then another sweeping attack (yellow ring). Of course, the yellow ring means it will break your guard, but these should be easy enough to dodge/parry.

Oluf will do an overhead swing, complete with a red ring, and smash the ground with his weapon. There seems to be a bit of a fire shockwave from this, but it’s pretty small, so don’t worry about it too much. You should be able to dodge this, and the splash, without getting hit pretty easily. Note that as the battle goes on and his health gets lower, he will chain multiple of these in a row.

Oluf will lunge forward, with his weapon, and attempt to grab you. This move is unblockable, so make sure to dodge out of the way when you see the red ring. If you do get snatched, Oluf will just lift you up and fling you away.

Oluf will lift up something and drink from it, causing him to regain some health. This will have the double blue rings, so you can stop it by double tapping the shield button. He can, and will, do this multiple times throughout the fight, so always be on the lookout for it.

As with the majority of boss fights, Oluf will eventually start chaining together attacks once his health gets lower. This is especially true of the Ground Smash attack, with there being a blue-ringed version at the end of the little combo. Keep an eye out for his guard breaking attacks, as well as his unblockable ones. You will also want to stay close enough to avoid having him recover too much health with his drinking. It’s not really a tough fight, as Oluf doesn’t seem to have too much health.

You will receive the Token of Elemental Evasion Amulet Enchantment, as well as the Crackle of Bilskirnir resource. This resource can be used to craft a Relic, but you need one of the Lost Pages to do that. After defeating Oluf, exit the camp and return to your wolves for a scene, and the end of the Favor.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: The Crucible

chapterContent.content: This page details everything you need to know about how to complete The Crucible favor, including where to start the favor by acquiring the first Muspelheim Seed Half at Modvitnir’s Rig in Svartalfheim, and where to find the second seed at Dragon Beach / Alberich Hollow in Svartalfheim. Once you have both seeds, you can then travel to Muspelheim via a Mystic Gateway to begin the Muspelheim Trials / Challenges.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the First Muspelheim Seed Half at Modvitnir’s Rig in Svartalfheim

chapterContent.content: To begin this favor, you’ll need to find the first Muspelheim Seed Half from the Legendary Chest at Modvitnir’s Rig. We’ve included a brief overview of this below.

You should naturally find the Legendary Chest at Modvitnir’s Rig as you make your way up to the mining rig furnace. You’ll need to hit a spinning wheel to open the gate, then climb around and up the platform. You will find the chest which contains the first Muspelheim Seed Half at the top of the platform.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Second Muspelheim Seed Half on the Dragon Beach of Svartalfheim

chapterContent.content: Now that you have the first Muspelheim Seed Half, it will likely be some time before you can acquire the second. This is because you’ll need a special weapon, the Draupnir spear, to gain access to the higher regions of the Dragon Beach, which stretch into Alberich Hollow. You will acquire this spear as part of the main story, during the Forging Destiny main quest.

Once you have the Draupnir spear, go to the area of Dragon Beach shown on the map below, and use the spear to gain access to the higher platform. You can then follow the path towards Alberich Hollow until you find a Legendary Chest covered in gold. You’ll need to take one of the nearby bombs and throw it at the chest to destroy the gold around it, giving you access to loot the chest. With both seeds now in your possession, you can use any Mystic Gateway to travel to The Crucible area of Muspelheim, where you’ll begin the next part of this favor by completing the first 6 Muspelheim Trials there. For more information on these, see our How Muspelheim Trials and Challenges Work in GoWR page.

chapterContent.head: How to Complete The Crucible Muspelheim Trials

chapterContent.content: The Crucible favor won’t be properly finished until you’ve completed the first six Muspelheim Trials that you have access to. We’ve detailed individual guides for each of these, so if you’re struggling with any in particular, be sure to check the links below.
This is a fairly simple trial which requires you to make use of all three major weapons: the Leviathan Axe, the Blades of Chaos, and the Draupnir Spear to kill the enemies within the time limit.

This trial is among the most difficult of the starting six, since you need to avoid being hit even once. You’ll need to become familiar with the enemy spawns and enemy types, including their attack moves, to get through this one.

This trial requires you to stagger and launch enemies to cast them into the lava pits in order to kill them. You won’t be able to kill them with regular attacks or even a combination of runic attacks most of the time, so you need to find ways to cast them into the pits instead.

This trial feels more like a mini game than a combat challenge. You need to throw orbs which are dropped by enemies into a realm tear shift, and you need to do this within a time limit. Some orbs are worth more points than others.

In this trial you’ll need to manage how and when you kill a single elite. If you kill the elite while there are more than 4/4 enemies in the arena (that number includes the elite!), you will fail the trial. You must keep the number at or below 4/4.

The King of the Hill trial is one of the most tricky for some, since you need to keep a number of enemies outside of multiple circles. If there are enemies within the circles when the time runs out, you fail. There are three waves to this trial, each one introducing another circle and tougher enemies.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: The Final Challenges

chapterContent.content: This page details everything you need to know about how to complete The Final Challenges favor in Muspelheim, God of War Ragnarok. We’ll cover each of the main challenges including Shield Breaker Challenge, Endurance Challenge, Onslaught Challenge, Ring of Fire Challenge, Boss Rush Challenge, and Phantom Challenge. You will need to beat all six at least once to complete the favor.

chapterContent.head: How to Complete The Final Challenges of Muspelheim Favor in God of War Ragnarok

chapterContent.content: The basic principle for completing this favor is simple enough: you need to complete all six major Muspelheim Challenges, but you can only access these after completing at least six of the Muspelheim Trials. The difference between Trials and Challenges in Muspelheim and how to unlock them can be confusing at first, so be sure to check our page on How Muspelheim Trials and Challenges Work in GoWR if you need help there. However, for the purposes of this favor, the challenges that you need to complete are listed in the table below.

As you can see, there are specific Trial Combinations to unlock each challenge, which means you need to complete one trial from each of the specified sword monuments which are marked by a particular rune (F, N, and R). All of these trials (and their associated sword monument runes) are listed in the table below.

These are the initial six trials that you’ll have access to and which you need to beat at least once in order to complete The Crucible favor. After that, the following additional trials will be unlocked for each sword monument:

You can choose to complete any one of the three trials on offer from each of the sword monuments, so long as you complete one from each monument with the appropriate rune associated with it. For example, if you want to unlock the Shield Breaker Challenge, you need to complete one of Weapon Mastery, Flawless or Rampage from sword monument F, and then one of Population Control, King of the Hill, or Kill Fuse from sword monument R. You can then go to the central sword in the arena just below where the forge is and interact with it to access the challenge.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: The Lost Lindwyrms

chapterContent.content: This page will detail how to start The Lost Lindwyrms Favor in God of War Ragnarok. It will also give the locations of all the Yggdrasil Rifts that give you a Lindwyrm.

chapterContent.head: How to Start The Lost Lindwyrms Favor

chapterContent.content: You won’t be able to start this Favor until you have complete the main quest, The Word of Fate. Once you have done that, return to Sindri’s House and you can head on over to Ratatoskr, who will have a new Favor for you to do. However, you should wait until you have acquired the Draupnir Spear during the main quest, Forging Destiny, as it’s pretty much required to get them all. You won’t be able to actually finish the Favor until after finishing Creatures of Prophecy, though.

Ratatoskr realizes that Nidhogg is dead, but the problem is that all of its offspring, the Lindwyrms, seem to be missing. There are six of these and the squirrel wants you to hunt them down using a special trap. Make sure you grab the trap before leaving Sindri’s House, as you won’t be able to do this Favor without it. Thankfully, all of the Lindwyrms are in Yggdrasil Rifts, found throughout both Svartalfheim and Vanaheim. However, two of them will require you to progress through the main story a bit more.

chapterContent.aside: You can get these in any order, but some are long the main path, or when doing the optional Favors, so it’s good to get them while you’re in the area.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Lindwyrm in The Forge in Svartalfheim

chapterContent.content: The first Lindwyrm can be found not too long after acquiring the Draupnir Spear. During your way back from The Forge, you will arrive at a spot where you need to actually use your spear. Basically, there are wind vents coming out of the way in plenty of spots throughout the game, with a number of them being seen before you even had access to the weapon. Listening to Brok during this segment, you will throw the spear at the wall to get an extra foothold, allowing you to reach a higher ledge. If you don’t pay full attention to surroundings, there is another wind vent a little higher up, and to the left, of the first one.

Climb up the first spear, then use the second (higher) one to jump the gap and reach the Yggdrasil Rift with the Lindwyrm. Note that if you’re doing this later on, then you will need to go from the Nidavellir Beach gateway, and take the train thing back up to The Forge. From there, pass through the main gate and use the big lift to get back up to this area. Once you arrive at where you got out of the water with the forge Lady, you can just retrace your steps back, as if you were leaving this place for the first time.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Lindwyrm in Alberich Hollow in Svartalfheim

chapterContent.content: Alberich Hollow is a completely optional area in Svartalfheim, located to the north of Dragon Beach, which is north of Nidavellir. Once you have the spear, head back and set sail for Dragon Beach. Find the chain here and climb up it, then look for the wind vent on the one side. Use your spear on the vent to get to the upper ledge, then follow the trail until you reach the large Dwarven statue with the large hammer. If you’re doing The Lost Treasure and/or Spirit of Rebellion favors, then you will be going this way during them.

There will be a cave tunnel off to the side, which is Alberich Hollow. Continue through it, using the fire bombs to clear debris and defeating enemies, until you run into a miniboss named Ormstunga. Defeat the miniboss, then look for a small ledge you can climb on the side, which is where you will find the Yggdrasil Rift and Lindwyrm.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Lindwyrm in Alberich Island in Svartalfheim

chapterContent.content: Alberich Island, not to be confused with Alberich Hollow, is the northernmost island in the Bay of Bounty in Svartalfheim. Upon setting foot there, you will find a wind vent to the right of the Berserker Gravestone, so toss the spear to get to the ledge above it. Follow the path and destroy the Soundstone to the left, then go down that trail to the end. Look for a rock with a wind vent across from you, near the water, and toss a spear over to it, detonating it to get the geyser flowing and the lift moving. Grapple across to a wooden platform to find the Yggdrasil Rift and the Lindwyrm.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Lindwyrm in The Applecore in Svartalfheim

chapterContent.content: To get to The Applecore after your first visit, head to the Mystic Gateway in Aurvangar Wetlands. Move forward a bit and take the left path to a ferry, which will bring you to Sverd Sands. At the end of this area will be a lift to take down to The Applecore. Follow the path inside, down a tunnel, and at the end will be a wind vent. If this is your first time back here, then you should encounter two Revenants along the way. Use the spear to access the ledge above, then take a left at the fork here, grappling across and straight onto a climbable wall. You should drop into the room where you found Tyr during the main story early in the game.

Crawl through the tunnel to get out of this room, then exit via the door. Look to the side after leaving through the door to find a ledge you can shimmy across, leading you to a grapple point across a small waterfall. Follow this down and jump off to a lower ledge at the first opportunity. Hop across the gap and go underneath the wooden waterway. As soon as you emerge, turn left and grapple across, then up the next ledge, before passing through the door to your left. There will be a wind vent in this room, so toss your spear at it and use it to cross to the other side. The Yggdrasil Rift with the Lindwyrm will be here.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Lindwyrms in The Plains in Vanaheim

chapterContent.content: There will be two Lindwyrms found in The Plains area, which cannot be gotten to until you clear the main story quest, Creatures of Prophecy. Once that is out of the way, there will be a short Favor you can begin in Freyr’s Camp. Scent of Survival is the name, where you need to follow Helka. Eventually, you will reach a cliff’s edge and after a cutscene, you will end up in The Crater section of Vanaheim, specifically The Plains. You are able to change the time of day via the altars here, although they may not be needed for one of them. The other Yggdrasil Rift will require you to change the time of day, though.

The first Lindwyrm will be found north of where you first drop into the area. If you’re having trouble reaching this spot, find an altar and turn the time of day into night, although it is right next to a Celestial Altar. As you head north, you should see a ledge on the right that doesn’t appear to have a way up to it normally. There will be some Seidr up here trying to pelt you with their magic. A little south of them, there will be some circular archways in an area you drop down to; if it’s night, there will be two Wisps here.

Pass through the archways and immediately turn left to find a ledge where you can grapple up to, right before a zipline. This will put you in the area with the Seidr enemies, as well as a blacksmith station. On the ledge above the Mystic Gateway, drop down, then do so once more to find the Yggdrasil Rift with the Lindwyrm.

If you’re doing the For Vanaheim Favor here in The Plains, then you will be able to get right to where the Yggdrasil Rift is for this one. However, you will have to face a boss before the Rift appears, the Crimson Dread, which is part of the above Favor. For more information on how to get to that area, visit the For Vanaheim! page. After defeating The Crimson Dread, go to the north end of the area to find the rift and the Lindwyrm.
Once you have caught all six Lindwyrms, return to Sindri’s House and summon Ratatoskr. Drop off the trap on the bench to return all of the Lindwyrms, then speak to the squirrel to finish the Favor.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Hel to Pay

chapterContent.content: This page will detail how to complete the Hel To Pay Favor in God of War Ragnarok. It will list the locations of all six Hel Tears.

chapterContent.head: Where to Start the Hel To Pay Favor in God of War Ragnarok

chapterContent.content: The Hel To Pay Favor will not begin until you go to close the first optional Hel Tear in the game. The first chance you get for this is during the main quest, Reunion, where you venture through Helheim. During this quest, you will come across a Hel Tear on the main path, with the option to close it or not. The first one you close as part of the story, at Sindri’s House, and while it actually counts towards the overall total, it doesn’t trigger the start the Favor.
Each Hel Tear will reward you with a Frozen Spark. Once you complete all six tears, you will have a complete Frozen Flame to use to upgrade your Leviathan Axe.

chapterContent.head: How to Close a Hel Tear

chapterContent.content: Hel Tears are a little different than the other Yggdrasil Tears, as you will send your companion to try and close them. While this is happening, a timer will appear at the top of the screen, which when depleted, will cause the tear to close. Your objective is to protect your companion while they are doing this, since enemies will come out of the Hel Tear to attack both you and your companion. So, you just need to survive/protect your ally and the Hel Tear will eventually be closed. As soon as it closes, the enemies will disappear, so you won’t need to do anything else past that point, besides grab the loot, of course.

chapterContent.aside: Only five Hel Tears will be listed here, since the one at Sindri’s House, during Reunion, is closed as part of the story.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Hel Tear in Helheim

chapterContent.content: You will come across this one as you’re doing the main story, Reunion. It’s impossible to miss this one, so you might as well do it while it’s in your way. You will find it in The Gleaming Bale area. This is the first optional one you can do, which if you do, you will start the Favor.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Hel Tear in Svartalfheim

chapterContent.content: Start off by going to the Aurvangar Wetlands gateway, then head north and hop into your boat. Row north and stop right before you pass the water wheel, docking on the beach to the right of it. Freeze the geyser and hop over it, then climb the wooden wall. At the top, zipline down and you will see the Hel Tear right in front of you. Be wary of the Archers during this, as they might be sitting on higher ledges and trying to pelt you with arrows, while you try to deal with the Hel-Viken.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Hel Tear in Alfheim

chapterContent.content: Teleport to The Strond Mystic Gateway, then go south a little bit and drop off the ledge to find the Hel Tear right there. This might be one of the more challenging ones, since you will be up against some level 7 enemies here. If you are likely doing this as soon as it’s available, then you will probably be around level 5. Of particular danger is the Hel-Viken, so try to avoid that enemy, if you can, and just concentrate on protecting your companion/surviving.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Hel Tear in Vanaheim

chapterContent.content: You won’t have to go far for this Hel Tear, so teleport to The Southern Wilds gateway, then head north a little bit. The Hel Tear will be right along the main path, so it’s pretty hard to miss. You’ll be pitted against a Hel-Traveler here, along with many Brood. While the Traveler is a bit slow in its movements, the Brood are the complete opposite and will try to swarm you. However, they don’t have much health, so they should go down rather quickly, while the Traveler is quite meaty, in terms of health.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Hel Tear in Midgard

chapterContent.content: The Hel Tear will be found on the way to the Well of Urd. Start out at the Lake of Nine Mystic Gateway, then head north-northwest. As you climb the path here, you will eventually run into the Hel Tear. This might be one of the easier ones, due to there being so few enemies, and all of them being level 5, too. The Raider Chiefs are a little more challenging to defeat, but shouldn’t pose much of a problem.
Once you close the final Hel Tear, that will be the end of the Favor. You will also receive the Frozen Flame after closing the sixth tear.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: The Last Remnants of Asgard

chapterContent.content: The Last Remnants of Asgard is a Favor that becomes available after finishing the story. Although the battle with Asgard is finished, the destruction of its realm has scattered wreckage across the nine realms. The Einherjar soldiers still loyal to Odin have made camps across the realms and may reorganize if left alone.

Completing this Favor leads to another Favor which involves fighting the super boss in God of War Ragnarok. If you’re hunting down 100% completion of each area, these count towards it, and you’ll need to complete this, and the following quest if you want the trophy for all favors.

chapterContent.head: How to Unlock The Last Remnants of Asgard

chapterContent.content: As mentioned above, this Favor is only unlocked after you finish the main story. After the ending, you’ll end up back in Midgard, descend the Hoddmimis Holt mountain by following the linear paths which lead you to the Lake of Nine, here, you’ll get a pop up about post-game. Once the tutorial disappears, the Favor “The Last Remnants of Asgard” will be automatically accepted, and completing this Favor will lead to the Favor “Defend Your Valor” which will see you battle against the new Valkyrie Queen of the game, Gna.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find Remnants of Asgard

chapterContent.aside: All the Remnants of Asgard can be taken out in any order, so feel free to take them out in any order you see fit, although you may want to leave the Muspelheim remnant for last, as the next Favor begins there.

chapterContent.content: There are 10 remnants scattered across five of the realms, and when you get close to them, you’ll see a bifrost fog around the area. Here there’ll be Einherjar in the area, and depending on the camp you are at, the types of Einherjar will change. After defeating all the enemies in the camp, you can open a red chest. These chests will reward you with various crafting resources that’ll allow you to upgrade some of your gear to level 9.

chapterContent.head: Svartalfheim Auravangr Wetlands Remnant

chapterContent.content: This remnant camp can be found in the secluded area north of the Auravangr Wetlands Mystic Gateway. From the Mystic Gate, proceed north through the river until you reach the first right bend. In the corner is a hidden location where you’ll need to find a small gap in the rocks to take your boat under. Just hug the left wall, and you’ll find it. As soon as you dock the boat, the camp will be right in front of you.

The enemies here shouldn’t cause you any problems as they’re just your generic Einherjar soldiers, take out the Tamer first. This particular enemy can summon other enemies with its blue-ring attack, after that, take out the ranged attackers, as they’ll just keep hitting you with bifrost, and use Rage (Fury) to take out any of the beefier enemies. Once you’ve dealt with them, open the red chest which can be found to the southwest of your boat. These chests will reward you with crafting resources that’ll allow you to increase some of your gear to level 9.

chapterContent.head: Svartalfheim Jarnsmida Pitmines Remnant

chapterContent.content: Next on the list is Jarnsmida Pitmines. Head to the nearest Mystic Gateway, and hover over the area where the Pitmines is, and teleport to the gateway there. Climb up the nearby chain, and you’ll be in the camp. This is a little tougher than the previous camp as you’ll have to deal with some Brutes. The easiest way to deal with this camp is to go straight into Rage (Fury), and take out the harder hitting enemies like the Brutes first. After that, mop up the archers, and open the red chest next to the chain you climbed to get in the area.

chapterContent.head: Svartalfheim Alberich Hollow Remnant

chapterContent.content: While you’re still in the region, teleport to The Watchtower Mystic Gateway, and head to the southern dock. From there, row the boat to the southwest, and dock at the beach. If you haven’t been back here since the beginning of the game, you’ll need to climb the chain, and throw your spear in the wall to the left. Climb up the platform, and open up the way forward with the runic pedestal with your chisel, and the camp will be on the other side of the bridge.

This can be quite tough as the Einherjar Captains are no joke. They have a lot of health, they don’t stagger much, and they have a few hard-hitting attacks. Focus on taking out the other enemies first while keeping an eye on where, and what the Captains are doing. When the other enemies are taken care of, defeat the Captain. Like most of the strategies above, abuse your Rage (Fury) to take him out. If you don’t outright kill him, he won’t have much fight left in him. The only real attack you need to watch out for is his Bifrost bolts which you can get hit from ranged, but you can avoid this easily by rolling to the side. Once you’ve dealt with all the enemies, it’s time to open the chest. You can find this at the end of the southern path, against the rocks.

chapterContent.head: Alfheim The Strond Remnant

chapterContent.content: Time to head to Alfheim, more specifically, The Strond. This camp is near the end of The Strond, near the door to the Temple of Light. Teleport to The Strond Mystic Gateway, and head up the eastern platforms. When you reach the top, head south, and go through the small gap in the wall. On the other side, climb up the platforms to the southwest, and drop to the path below. Follow the path west, and jump across the gap, and go through the cave where the Twilight Stones are. Go through the gate, head north, and climb up the wall to the east. Head out of the cave, and follow the linear path southwest where you’ll find the camp.

When you get to the camp, you’ll have to fight two Einherja Brutes of which come equipped with elemental shields One with a fire-shield, and one with a frost-shield. Among them will be a warrior. Take out the warrior first, as it’ll just attack you from behind while you deal with the more serious threats, but make sure to keep an eye on the Brutes. When you have just the Brute’s left, attack them with the weapon of the opposite element, so Blades of Chaos on the Frost Brute, and Leviathan Axe on the Fire Brute.

You can just use the spear on both, and detonate it to take their shields down too. When their shields have been stripped, can you think of what to do next? You guessed it, Rage time! Go into Rage, and focus on taking one of them down, and attack the other with whatever Rage you have left. After that, you’ll just have a half-health brute left to deal with which Runic Attacks should take down in no time. Once they’re dealt with, open the red chest to the west.

chapterContent.head: Alfheim The Barrens Remnant

chapterContent.content: The second remnant of Alfheim can be found in the optional area, The Barrens. Teleport to The Canyons Mystic Gateway or if you haven’t been there, take the other path from The Strond teleport. Either way, jump onto the sled at The Canyons, and follow the winding path to the northeast. When you get into the open area, head east, around the canyon, and past “The Below”. The Einherjar camp will be where you can see the Bifrost fog in the distance. Head over to it, and climb the large step on the easter side to enter the camp.

This camp will have you battle two minibosses who go by the names Stinnr, and Sterkr. You’ve most likely fought a few of these by now, and if you can remember, they can be quite tough as they don’t get staggered, and they can deal huge damage. Like always, jump into Rage (Fury), and start pummeling on either one. As soon as the  prompt appears, make sure you do it, as it’ll strip them of their armor, and significantly weaken them. Continue pummeling on them, and it’ll either be dead, or close to it. Finish the first one off if you need to, and start on the next.

chapterContent.head: Vanaheim Freyr’s Camp Remnant

chapterContent.content: This camp can be found just outside from Freyr’s Camp, teleport to the Freyr’s Camp Mystic Gateway, and row your boat to the western entrance. When you get off the boat, head south, and you’ll see the camp. Hmmm, this camp looks suspiciously quiet, try opening the red chest to see what happens. When you open the chest, three Einherjar Brutes will ambush you. The Brutes are quite strong, but nothing a simple Rage can’t deal with. Make sure you focus down one at a time as they have a fair bit of health. When they’re defeated, open the chest again to get your real rewards.

chapterContent.head: Vanaheim Eastern Barri Woods Remnant

chapterContent.content: One of the worst camps to find mainly because Barri Woods can be a pain to get through. There’s two ways to get to this camp. The first (and longest) is by unlocking the Mystic Gateway via the map at the top of Eastern Barri Woods, and making your way south. Or, you can head into Freyr’s Camp, and take the northeast exit with the doors, next to Sif, and Hildisvini. Follow the linear winding path north, and when you get to a crossroads with the blocked path, take the southern path. Keep following the path, and you’ll end up with a hole you can crawl through. Go through it, and you’ll be in the area with the ruins. Head through the hole in the ruin, and head across the gap to grapple to the ledge above. Drop to your right, and you’ll be in the camp.

This camp isn’t too difficult as long as you kill the Einherjar Tamers as quickly as possible, otherwise, you’ll find yourself fighting Wyverns. Jump into Rage, and take the Tamers out, and at best you may only have to fight the single Wyvern.

chapterContent.head: Midgard Well Of Urd Remnant

chapterContent.content: The first camp in Midgard can be found in the northwest of the Lake of Nine, near the Well of Urd. Teleport to the Lake of Nine Mystic Gateway, jump on the sled, and head northwest. When you get as far northwest as you can, hop over the large step to the west. As soon as you jump over the step, you’ll be in the camp.

This can be a fairly tough camp mainly due to the Einherjar Rider. Take out the smaller enemies first with AoE Runic attacks, then Rage down the Rider. Once you’ve dealt with the enemies, you can open the red chest at the back-right of the camp.

chapterContent.head: Midgard Lake of Nine (Tyr’s Temple) Remnant

chapterContent.content: You’ll find this camp on the bridge connecting to Tyr’s Temple. Teleport to any of the nearby Mystic Gateways, and make your way to the bridge of the temple. Use the nearby elevator which can be found on the southern side, and it’ll take you up to the top of the bridge. Once you’re up there, head along the bridge to find the camp.

This camp will only have two Einherjar Riders. Although the Einherjar won’t be mounted at the start, they’ll jump on their mounts once you initiate combat. A nice way to start this fight is to throw charged Drill Spears at the Einherjar, if you’re lucky, you may take them out before they can mount. Either way, like always, focus on one of them while in Rage, and you should be able to take it down relatively easily. Now go and pound on the other one until the Rage goes, and finish it off with melee/rune attacks. Once they’re dealt with, open the red chest which can be found behind the frozen torch on the right, under the archway.

chapterContent.head: Muspelheim Burning Cliffs Remnant

chapterContent.content: Saving the best till last, teleport to the Burning Cliffs Mystic Gateway, and follow the linear path to the place where you have to walk along the ledge over the lava pool. As you’re crossing it, you should see the Bifrost Fog in the distance. Once you’re across the pool of lava, follow the path east, and jump over the large step at the bottom to enter the camp. The camp is more or less near Surtyr’s Forge. The only enemy here that may cause a problem is the Bifrost enchanted Einherjar Warrior, but nothing that Rage can’t take care of. After you’ve dealt with them, take out the archers, and open the chest which you find in the middle of the camp next to some rocks.
Once you’ve done this remnant, the Favor will be complete, and you’ll unlock the Favor “Defend Your Valor” which involves defeating the Valkyrie Queen Gna, the super boss of the game.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Born From Fire - All Draugr Holes Locations in God of War Ragnarok

chapterContent.content: This page details everything you need to know about where to find the Draugr Holes for the Born From Fire favor in God of War Ragnarok. There are a total of six Draugr Hole locations to be found, with two in Svartalfheim, one in Alfheim, one in Midgard, and two in Vanaheim. You need to close each of these Draugr Holes by defeating the Draugr associated with them, referred to as “The Hateful”, to complete the favor.

chapterContent.head: All Draugr Hole (The Hateful) Locations in God of War Ragnarok

chapterContent.content: The Born From Fire favor will begin only after you’ve closed your first Draugr Hole by defeating “The Hateful” associated with it. You can do these in any order, but they will become progressively more difficult as you move through the regions. You can always come back to a Draugr Hole if you fail to defeat The Hateful there multiple times. If you’re finding one in particular quite difficult, you’ll have plenty of time to gear up and increase your level, which will make things easier by increasing the base amount of damage that you inflict, while decreasing the amount that you take.

chapterContent.aside: Whenever you kill one of The Hateful, you will obtain a Chaos Spark item. You will need six of these to create a Chaos Flame, which can be used to upgrade the Blades of Chaos at the blacksmith with Sindri, Brok, or Lunda.

chapterContent.head: The Watchtower, Bay of Bounty, Svartalfheim - Draugr Hole Location

chapterContent.content: The Draugr Hole at The Watchtower in the Bay of Bounty of Svartalfheim is likely to be the first one that you encounter, and your first experience with The Hateful boss. The Watchtower is inaccessible to begin with, but you can unlock the area by hitting the red fire pot to destroy the rubble around it, then head up the steps to find the Draugr Hole near the top.
You can see our detailed guide on how to defeat The Hateful at this location, which serves as a good overview for how to defeat the others, on our How to Defeat The Hateful in The Watchtower page.

chapterContent.head: The Applecore, Svartalfheim - Draugr Hole Location

chapterContent.content: You will find this Draugr Hole in The Applecore, which you should encounter as you play through the main story during the search for Tyr. However, if you missed it the first time, you can access The Applecore (and the Jarnsmida Pitmines) from the ferry near the Mystic Gateway in the southern part of the Aurvangar Wetlands.

chapterContent.head: The Barrens, Alfheim - Draugr Hole Location

chapterContent.content: The Barrens region of Alfheim will be covered in a sandstorm when you first enter it, and the only way to disperse this storm is to complete Secret of the Sands favor. The Song of the Sands favor is required to clear the storm in The Forbidden Sands area, but you don’t need to go there for this Draugr Hole. You can actually access this Draugr Hole without clearing the storm at all, but it will be much more difficult to see things, and certain parts of the area will be blocked off while the storm rages, so we recommend doing that first.
Once you’ve cleared the storm, head over to the location shown on the map below, where the question mark icon is. You’ll find The Hateful on a platform here.

chapterContent.head: Lake of Nine, Midgard - Draugr Hole Location

chapterContent.content: You will find The Hateful in Midgard in the northeastern part of the region, as shown on the map below. You shouldn’t have any trouble accessing this part of the map, since all you need to do is step over a ledge to find it.

chapterContent.head: Eastern Plains, The Crater, Vanaheim - Draugr Hole Location

chapterContent.content: You can find this Draugr Hole in the Eastern Plains, in the northern part of The Crater, which is a subregion of Vanaheim. You need to complete the Return of the River favor to bring water back to the region before you can access this Draugr Hole, since you need to take the boat and row to the platform.

chapterContent.head: The Abandoned Village, Vanaheim - Draugr Hole Location

chapterContent.content: This Draugr Hole can be found in the northwestern part of The Abandoned Village, in the northeast of Vanaheim. You may be locked out of this area depending on where you are in the story, so be sure to check our page on How to Return to Old Areas in Vanaheim if you need to find you way back. The Draugr Hole here can be found within a glade of rock and trees here, and there will be some additional lesser Draugr in the area which may enter the fight.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Nidavellir

chapterContent.content: When you reach Svartalfheim for the first time, you’ll be in the sub-region Aurvangar Wetlands. As you progress north, you’ll end up in a Dwarven village that goes by the name of “Nidavellir”. This page will guide you to obtaining all collectibles including, but not limited to Nornir Chests, Odin’s Ravens, Legendary Chests, and Artefacts plus much more. A lot of the collectibles won’t be available to you until you’ve progressed further into the story, and unlocked more abilities. This guide will mention if that’s the case with as little spoilers as possible. None of the Collectibles in God of War: Ragnarok is missable as you can come back later in post-game.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - Nidavellir Collectibles Locations in Svartalfheim

chapterContent.aside:
Some of these collectibles can only be obtained after progressing the main story.
To get all the collectibles in Nidavellir, you’ll need the following:

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Artefacts in Nidavellir

chapterContent.content: Two Artefacts to find here, the first will be to the north of the docks, behind a blockade with a green hue. To break the blockade, you’ll need Atreus’ bow upgrade which you can get by speaking to Sindri the blacksmith first who can be found near the large statue in the center of town. This allows Atreus to fire green arrows that’ll destroy anything with the green hue mentioned earlier. Head back to the blockade, and aim at it, while aimed, press  to have Atreus destroy it. The lore will be sitting comfortably on top of a crate at the back.

The second Artefact can be found by going through the small tunnel to the east of Sindri. When you exit the tunnel in the new area, immediately go through the lit up walkway to the northwest, and follow it until you’re under the bridge. You’ll see a purple glowing object on the floor, pick it up to get the Artefact.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Ravens in Nidavellir

chapterContent.content: There’s only one Raven in Nidavellir, and you can find it almost at the beginning of the area. Once you’ve docked your boat, follow the wooden pathway northeast, then east until you reach the large statue in the center of town. If you look to your northeast, you’ll see a house with a water wheel built into it. The Raven will be sitting on top of the arched roof of that house.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Lore (Poems) in Nidavellir

chapterContent.aside: You will need the Spear to access the second lore.

chapterContent.content: You can only gain one of the two lore’s here without the spear, you can find this on the floor in between the barrel, and the sandbags west of Sindri. It’s a gold glowing object called the “Shopping List”.

For the second lore, you’ll need to come back later when you have access to the Draupnir Spear as it is hidden behind a path that can only be accessed by throwing your spear at it. More information is coming soon.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Legendary Chests in Nidavellir

chapterContent.aside: You will need the Spear to access the Legendary Chest.

chapterContent.content: This is in the same place that the second lore is. Once again, you’ll need the spear to get there. More information is coming soon.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all the Nine Realms in Blooms in Nidavellir

chapterContent.aside: You will need the Spear to access the Nine Realms in Bloom.

chapterContent.content: This is in the same place that the second lore is. Once again, you’ll need the spear to get there. More information is coming soon.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all the Spirit of Rebellions in Nidavellir

chapterContent.aside: You will need the Spear to access the Spirit of Rebellion in Bloom.

chapterContent.content: This is only needed as part of Durlin’s Favor which you’ll need to complete the main mission “Forging Destiny” to accept it. More information is coming soon.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all the Berserker Gravestones in Nidavellir

chapterContent.aside: You will need the “Inert Hilt of Skofnung” to interact with the gravestone which you can get in the mission “The Word of Fate”.

chapterContent.content: You’ll need to teleport to the “Nidavellir Beach” Mystic Gateway which you can’t access until you’ve completed the main mission “Forging Destiny”. You’ll also need the Story item “Inert Hilt of Skofnung” to interact with the gravestone which you can get in the previous mission “The Word of Fate”. More information is coming soon.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Modvitnir's Rig

chapterContent.content: This page details everything you need to know about where to find all Collectibles on Modvitnir’s Rig in God of War: Ragnarok. There are only four collectibles to find here, including the Mining Rig itself: one Legendary Chest, one Lore Marker, and some Buried Treasure which you can only acquire after finding the Fruits of Industry Treasure Map at Alberich Hollow.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - Modvitnir’s Rig Collectibles Locations in Svartalfheim
Where to Find the Legendary Chest at Modvitnir’s Rig

chapterContent.content: The Legendary Chest at Modvitnir’s Rig is difficult to miss. After hitting the spinning wheel to open the gate, you’ll need to climb around the platform ahead to find the chest at the top on your way to the mining rig furnace. You’ll need to kill a few Wild Wretches along the way, but it’s nothing you can’t handle. This Legendary Chest contains the Muspelheim Seed Half, which is half of an Yggdrasil Seed to Muspelheim, which begins The Crucible favor. You’ll find the second half of the seed at Alberich Hollow.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Lore Marker at Modvitnir’s Rig

chapterContent.content: The Lore Marker here is slightly more hidden. From the Legendary Chest, you’ll need to use the Blades of Chaos to grapple onto the crane hook and reach the platform to the south, then immediately turn right (west) and look down. You’ll see the Lore Marker for “Warning” below here, and you’ll need to jump down to access it.

Although not technically a collectible, you’ll also find a Loot Lizard next to the Lore Marker here. These are difficult to kill unless you can get them from behind, and there’s usually a tricky spot that you’ll need to find before you can hit them with a ranged attack from your Leviathan Axe. In this case, you’ll need to grapple back to the platform to the north, then turn around to aim at the lizard, as shown in the screenshot below.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Mining Rig at Modvitnir’s Rig

chapterContent.content: The Mining Rig here can be found by climbing up the chain to the south of where you dropped down to find the lore. You can then turn left to find the mining rig furnace which you’ll need to shut down before it counts as a completed collectible. If you need more help with this, see our page on the In Service of Asgard favor for more detail.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Buried Treasure at Modvitnir’s Rig

chapterContent.content: The Buried Treasure is located on the beach at Modvitnir’s Rig, just where you dock the boat. However, you won’t be able to access this until you’ve thoroughly explored Alberich Hollow, which requires the use of the Draupnir Spear (unlocked during the main mission “Forging Destiny”). We’ll update this page with more information on that soon.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in The Forge

chapterContent.content: Svartalfheim is the first realm you will be able to explore in the game, with one of the sub-regions you will visit being The Forge. This page will guide you to obtaining all of the collectibles in The Forge, including the Odin’s Ravens, Artifacts, and much more. A lot of the collectibles won’t be available until you’ve progressed in the story and unlocked more abilities. Note that none of the collectibles in God of War Ragnarok are missable, as you will always be able to come back upon finishing the main story.

chapterContent.aside: This page is a work in progress and the rest of the collectibles will be added as they are unlocked.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - The Forge Collectibles Locations in Svartalfheim

chapterContent.aside: On your first visit here during the main story, you will not be able to get everything listed above. In fact, you can only get one of the Ravens, the two Lores, and the Artifact on your first visit. The rest will come later, once you have access to more abilities.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Ravens in The Forge

chapterContent.content: There are two Ravens located here in The Forge, but you will only be able to get one of them on your first visit. You will come to The Forge after first meeting with Durlin, then riding the Dwarven train. Right by where you get off the first train, while staying in the same area, you will want to look north to find a Raven flying around the area. Of course, this Raven flies a set path, but you will need to hit it with an axe throw. This is especially annoying, as getting a good bead on the nuisance can be difficult. It may take a few tries, but the best way to do this is to aim at one spot, then toss the axe. If you miss, then readjust your throw instead of trying to chase after the Raven.
You will be unable to get this second Raven on your first visit to this area, so you will need to come back later.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Artifacts in The Forge

chapterContent.content: There’s only a single Artifact found in The Forge and it can be picked up before you squeeze through the wall and encounter the Dreki boss fight. There will be a small area off to the south, with some wooden debris and a crate. Break the crate/debris and you will find the Things Left Behind Artifact on the ground.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Nornir Chests in The Forge

chapterContent.content: There’s a single Nornir Chest in this sub-region and while you can find it during your travels, you won’t be able to open it on your first visit. Before you crawl through the small opening leading to the Dreki boss fight, there is a path off to the side, where you should see a green heart painted on the rock wall. The Nornir Chest will be right here, but you will need to come back later, once you have the proper item.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in The Forge

chapterContent.content: There’s two pieces of Lore to be found in The Forge, both of which are pretty much right next to each other. After defeating the Dreki boss, squeeze through the narrow gap on the opposite end to arrive at a fork. Head north first, climb the ledge right there and you should see a Dwarven house right there. In front of that house is this Lore scroll.
From the previous Lore Scroll, go behind it and you should see a locked gate. On the wall to the right of the gate will be the Rune Read, so just approach it and press the X button.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in The Applecore

chapterContent.content: Svartalfheim is the first realm you will be able to explore in the game, with one of the sub-regions you will visit being The Applecore. This page will guide you to obtaining all of the collectibles in The Applecore, including the Odin’s Ravens, Artifacts, and much more. A lot of the collectibles won’t be available until you’ve progressed in the story and unlocked more abilities. Note that none of the collectibles in God of War Ragnarok are missable, as you will always be able to come back upon finishing the main story.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - The Applecore Collectibles Locations in Svartalfheim

chapterContent.aside: On your first visit here during the main story, you will not be able to get everything listed above, so the rest of them will be added to this page as they are unlocked.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Ravens in The Applecore

chapterContent.content: The singular Raven is located pretty deep into the mine, on your first visit. In the large room where you have Atreus pull a lever to drop some Soundstone in the wooden waterway, you will eventually solve the puzzle and be able to get to the other side. There will be a door to enter over here, but look to the north to spot a ledge you can shimmy across. While facing in that same direction, you should spot the Raven sitting on a beam.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Artifacts in The Applecore

chapterContent.content: As you go through The Applecore, you should eventually unlock an elevator via flipping a switch with your Blades of Chaos, after climbing a chain. Just before this, you should have seen some debris just across a gap. In the little area you drop down to with the chain, if you look at that debris, you should be able to hit the red pot to clear it. Head down that path behind the now-cleared debris to find a bunch of enemies you need to defeat. Find the door after clearing them out, and go through it, where you will find a materials chest and the Artifact.

You will get to this Artifact after you get your first Relic, which is required as part of the story. In the area where you have to pull a chain to make a zipline (after clearing the Soundstone), you should have seen a wooden walkway end, with a small waterfall just beyond it. There’s actually a grapple point here, so use that to cross the gap, then drop off the ledge. You should see a big deposit of Soundstone here, so have Atreus clear it and grab the Artifact behind it.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Legendary Chests in The Applecore

chapterContent.content: There are two Legendary Chests in The Applecore, but you will only be able to open one of them on your first visit. The first chest is in the same room as the Draugr Hole. Clear out the room first, then go on the one side to find the chest. You will receive the Axe Attachment - Fortified Frost Knob from this Legendary Chest.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in The Applecore

chapterContent.content: After you first get off the little boat and arrive at Sindri’s blacksmith shop, continue along the path to the first grapple point. Instead of going across, you should see a wooden wall with some Soundstone on it. Have Atreus fire an arrow at the Soundstone to destroy it and unveil the Rune Read behind it.

Go through The Applecore as you normally would, until you get to your first fight with some Draugrs. The path will be split here, so head west to find a wooden wall you can bust down. Do that, then drop down the ledge behind it to find the Lore Marker.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Draugr Hole in The Applecore

chapterContent.content: The Draugr Hole is located in the same area as the Durinn’s Stone Statue Artifact. There will be a door to the right of the Artifact, leading to the room with the Draugr Hole. The Hateful here is more or less the same as the one at The Watchtower, except instead of the shockwave attack, it will throw some projectiles at you. You know this is coming whenever you see the yellow circle, indicating it will break your guard, although it also means you can parry it. Of course, there will also be two normal Draugrs that spawn, so be wary of that happening. Defeat all of the enemies to complete this Draugr Hole.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Draugr Hole - How to Defeat The Hateful in The Watchtower

chapterContent.content: In God of War Ragnarök, there are six Draugr Holes you need to complete for the Favor “Born From Fire”. Draugr Holes, like their name suggests, is a hole that spawns Draugr, more specifically a Draugr that goes by the name “The Hateful”, and some minions. Once you defeat The Hateful, you’ll receive a Chaos Spark among other loot for your troubles. You’ll need six of these to create a Chaos Flame which is what you need to upgrade your Blades of Chaos an extra level as well as complete the Favor. This page will tell you how to locate, and defeat The Hateful that spawns from the Draugr Hole in The Watchtower - Svartalfheim.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - Where to Find the Draugr Hole Location in Svartalfheim

chapterContent.content: The first Draugr Hole can be found in the Svartalfheim region. After you’ve progressed the story past the dwarven town Nidavellir, you’ll ultimately end up sailing into the Bay of Bounty area in the search of a dwarf who goes by the name “Durlin”. This is the first time the game really opens up, and you’ll have a lot of diversions available. What you want to do is to head to the area called “The Watchtower”. This area can be found by going under the arches that lead to the northern end of the bay, and the beach you need to land at to reach The Watchtower, can be found east of the arches.

chapterContent.head: How to Defeat The Hateful

chapterContent.content: As soon as you approach the hole on the floor, a Draugr will spawn called “The Hateful”. This is a miniboss, and has a similar health bar to normal bosses. After doing a small amount of damage to it, it’ll summon two minions. Although you don’t need to defeat them to complete the Draugr Hole, they will attack you, and make the fight significantly harder. Whether you choose to defeat the minions or not is your call, but if you don’t, be prepared to dodge whenever you see a small red arrow around you as one of them will be attacking you.

On easier difficulties, this fight shouldn’t pose too much of a problem. On the higher difficulties, it can be quite challenging. The Hateful has a few different attacks to watch out for which you can read about below:

The Draugr will charge at you while waving its dual axes in tandem. It’ll perform three slashing strikes, with the last attack being a spinning overhead slash. All of these attacks can be parried, blocked or dodged. This attack and the unblockable variant are most likely the toughest attacks you’ll have to avoid.

This attack can throw you off if you get too used to the normal combo. Almost the same as its normal variant, but it’ll toss an unblockable attack indicated by a red ring. The easiest way to avoid this attack is to keep dodging to the side. Try to dodge by pressing double  as it’ll give you more distance. Only the first hit is unblockable, so you can parry/block the following hits, although it’s easier to just dodge all of them.

The Hateful will slam its weapon into the ground sending a stream of fire in a line towards you. You’ll know this is coming as it’ll raise its weapon in the air, and an unblockable red circle will appear around it. This can be easily avoided by dodging/moving to either side, just don’t stand in front of it. This attack can, and will be used from ranged, so always keep an eye on what The Hateful is up to if you’re fighting the minions. Note: If you do get hit by this attack, you’ll get afflicted with the burn status which will deal damage over time to you for a short period of time.

The Draugr will charge and throw a singular lazy slash at you where it almost stumbles over. You can parry/block or dodge this attack. After avoiding the attack, you’ll have a short window to get some free damage in.

It rarely uses this attack, but if you spend a prolonged time in front of the creature, it’ll perform a backhanded uppercut which deals a fair bit of damage. This can be tough to dodge as it comes at you pretty quickly, but if you see the unblockable indicator when both axes are pointed downwards, odds on the uppercut will follow. To avoid it, simply dodge any direction other than forwards. Sometimes he’ll combo this attack at the end of the Reaching Slash attack.

A simple overhead slashing attack that does a decent amount of damage, but you should only get hit by this if your camera is turned away from it. Simply parry/block or dodge it, and punish it for its aggressiveness.

Although not an actual attack, the Draugr can use a retreating evade which can make some of your attacks miss. The reason this “move” is mentioned here is that it can combo it into a charge, so make sure you’re ready for any follow-up attacks.

chapterContent.head: Tips

chapterContent.content: Here are a few tips to make your life easier during the battle:

chapterContent.li: Save your Rage for the fight, if you’ve already used it, explore the nearby islands, and fight some enemies to charge it up again.
Although the Draugr Hole has fire coming out of it, it’s safe to stand on, and it won’t deal any damage to you, so feel free to fight in it.
You don’t have to fight just where the hole is, you can use the entire area including the stairs, and the path next to it.
Repeatedly use Atreus’ Arrows, get used to using them whenever they’re off cooldown. This tip is useful for the rest of the game. You can achieve this by repeatedly pressing .
Take out the other Draugr’s first, they don’t respawn, and they have relatively low health, and stun bar. This will make the battle a lot easier.
The Hateful is susceptible to large stun damage from parrying, shield strikes, and Atreus’ arrows, make use of this.

chapterContent.head: Strategy

chapterContent.content: Before you approach the Draugr Hole, power up your Leviathan Axe by holding . This will increase the damage you do with your next attack as well as change what attack you do. When you approach the hole, The Hateful will spawn. It almost always uses its Fire Slam attack from the start. You can use the time it takes it to spawn to rush in and get a few free attacks, just be ready to dodge its inevitable Fire Slam attack.

When you deal about 10% of its health, two normal Draugrs will spawn. On their own, they shouldn’t cause you many problems, but when combined with The Hatefuls attacks, that can get in a few cheap attacks on you when you’re focusing on The Hateful. For this reason, we suggest taking out the minions first while you keep your distance from The Hateful.

When you combine your attacks with Atreus’ arrows, you can get them stunned in no time, then you can press  when it’s stunned to finish them off. If you take the time to defeat them at the beginning of the fight, no more will spawn, and it’ll just be you, and The Hateful which makes the battle a lot easier. On lower difficulties, you can most likely ignore them, and focus on the boss.

The best way to deal with the miniboss, is to wait for it to perform its singular attacks, and punish it each time it attempts to hit you. Also, you should repeatedly launch arrows at it with Atreus to build up its stun bar. If you’re more skilled or feeling particularly lucky, you can parry all of its normal Charging Slash Combo for big stun damage. A lot of its attacks can be interrupted with a shield strike (double-tap ) for large amounts of stun damage too.

One thing to note, when the stun bar feels up, it won’t become stunned (yeah, I know), but it will take a large amount of damage from it, so it’s still worth doing. For the most part, this shouldn’t be too tough to defeat as long as you don’t stand in front of it, and button mash. Slowly chip away at its health, and you’ll have it defeated in no time.

chapterContent.head: The Hateful (The Watchtower) Rewards

chapterContent.content: Once The Hateful has been defeated, you’ll be rewarded with various materials, but more importantly, the Cursed Empress Handles Hilt, and a Chaos Spark. You’ll also begin the Favor “Born From Fire” which will require you to defeat another five of them!

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Yggdrasil Dew Drop Locations in Svartalfheim

chapterContent.content: This page details where to find all of the Yggdrasil Dew Drops in Svartalfheim, including one in the Aurvangar Wetlands, and three in the Bay of Bounty. The Dew Drops are not officially counted among the collectibles, but they’re important to find as they permanently increase your stats for Strength, Defence, Vitality, Runic, Luck, and Cooldown. The Dew Drops provide an opportunity to make Kratos more powerful and they require only a small effort to obtain.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Yggdrasil Dew Drops in Svartalfheim

chapterContent.content: This Yggdrasil Dew Drop permanently increases your Runic stat by 2. You’ll find it as you’re rowing through the Aurvangar Wetlands, more specifically just after you pass under a bridge on the boat, before you reach the main gate that you need to open to reach Nidavellir. The precise location is shown in the screenshot below.

The next Yggdrasil Dew Drop that you’re likely to encounter is located just northwest of the dwarf capital Nidavellir, as shown in the screenshot below. You’ll find this one just as you leave the cave system from the city as you enter the Bay of Bounty in Svartalfheim. This one permanently increases your Cooldown stat by +2.

The next Yggdrasil Dew Drop we’ll cover is located just west of Durlin’s House, in the southwest part of the Bay of Bounty. All you need to do to reach this one is turn left and head westward from the first dew drop you found Northwest of Nidavellir. Approach Durlin’s house as you’re heading southwest and then turn right to head westward towards a dead end. Here you’ll find a small beach with a chest on it, and the dew drop is located just opposite. This Dew Drop permanently increases your Strength stat by +2.

The third Yggdrasil Dew Drop that you can find in the Bay of Bounty is located directly east of Lyngbakr Island, in the northeast part of the Bay of Bounty. This is an island that you need to unlock first, so be sure to check our page on How to Access the Hidden Area Lyngbakr Island if you haven’t done that yet. You can still reach the Yggdrasil Dew Drop here even if you haven’t unlocked Lyngbakr Island, but you’ll see it as being southeast of Alberich Island instead. Either way, this one can be found just behind a small rock island, as shown in the screenshots below. This one permanently increases your Defence stat by +2.

The final Yggdrasil Dew Drop that can be found in Svartalfheim can’t be accessed on your first run through the Bay of Bounty. You’ll need to wait until you’ve completed the Forging Destiny main quest, at which point you’ll acquire the Draupnir Spear and you’ll be able to progress beyond the initial beach area of Alberich Island. This will lead you to a rune slate which you can interact with to unlock the gate in the water that is blocking access to the last Yggdrasil Dew Drop in Svartalfheim.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in The Strond

chapterContent.content: This page will reveal the location of every collectible in The Strond, a region of Alfheim in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - The Strond Collectibles Locations in Alfheim

chapterContent.aside:
Some of these collectibles can only be obtained after progressing the main story.
To get all the collectibles in The Strond, you’ll need the following:

chapterContent.head: How to Find The Strond

chapterContent.content: During the main quest Groa’s Secret you’ll travel to Alfheim; The Strond is the area the Mystic Gateway takes you to. This page will guide you to obtaining all collectibles including, but not limited to Nornir Chests, Odin’s Ravens, Legendary Chests, and Artefacts plus much more. A lot of the collectibles won’t be available to you until you’ve progressed further into the story, and unlocked more abilities. This guide will mention if that’s the case with as little spoilers as possible. None of the Collectibles in God of War: Ragnarök are missable as you can come back later in the post-game.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Lore (Poems) in The Strond

chapterContent.content: There are two lores’ to be found in The Strond. As soon as you enter the area via the Mystic Gateway, there’ll be some glowing blue writing on the wall straight in front of you, walk over, and interact with it to get the first lore.

The second lore can be found by heading back to the Mystic Gateway, and taking the eastern path up the two platforms. When you get outside, keep walking east to the ledge, and look down to find a lore tablet resting in the snow. Drop to the ledge below, and interact with it to collect the second lore.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Hels Tears in The Strond

chapterContent.aside: Progress to the Main Mission “Reunion” to make Hels Tears spawn.

chapterContent.content: Just the one Hels Tear in The Strond. This can be found right at the beginning of the area. From the first lore, drop to the ledge on your right where you’ll see the Hels Tear. This will not spawn until you’ve reached the Main Mission: “Reunion”.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Nornir Chests in The Strond

chapterContent.content: There are two Nornir Chests in The Strond. The first Nornir Chest can be found nearby the second lore. Grapple back up, and squeeze through the gap to the south. Now head southeast, and drop to the ledge below. This chest requires you to light up three braziers by using your Blade of Chaos’ skill “Flaming Surge” which can be done by holding  and pressing . The three braziers can be found in the following locations:

chapterContent.li: Rune 1 (C) – This can be found to the left of the chest on the small northern platform.
Rune 2 (n) – Follow the path to the right of the chest, and look below the southern ledge.

Rune 3 (R) – The last Rune will require you to grapple back up the way you got to the chest, and climb up the two ledges to the southwest. When you reach the top, look over the southeastern ledge to find the last brazier sitting on a ledge to your right.

chapterContent.aside: The second Nornir Chest will require the Draupnir Spear to attack the runes. This can be obtained by completing the main mission: “Forging Destiny”.

chapterContent.content: For the second Nornir Chest can be found by retracing your steps until you reach the area with the twilight stones. Now instead of dropping west like before, head north a little, and turn towards the eastern wall. If you look carefully, you should see the washed out white runic words on the wall. Climb up, and then left until you reach the next area. This next area will be where the Remnants of Asgard will be if you’ve completed the main story (read below). If you haven’t, ignore the last sentence, and continue following the linear path south until you lift, and go under the large stone pillar. Progress a little further forward, and the chest will be on your right. This chest requires the Draupnir Spear (unlocked during the main mission “Forging Destiny”) to unlock it.
You’ll need to throw your spear at all three runes, and have them explode at the same time. The runes can be found in the following locations:

chapterContent.li: Rune 1 (n) – Head past the chest towards the gap (don’t jump over), and turn 180°. The “n” rune will be to the right of the left tree.
Rune 2 (N) – Same as above, but to the right of the right tree.
Rune 3 (F) – For the last rune, head towards the gap again, and turn your camera to the right. The “F” rune will be on a ledge in the distance to your west.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Ravens in The Strond

chapterContent.content: Only one Raven to find in The Strond. Head back to where you found the last brazier for the first Nornir Chest, and follow the linear path south until you reach a large gap that you need to jump. The Raven will be perched on a branch of the overhanging tree across the other side of the gap on your left.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Artefacts in The Strond

chapterContent.content: You can obtain two Artefacts during your exploration of The Strond. The first can be found just after the Raven above. Jump over the large gap where the Raven was, and progress through the northern cave. If this is your first time here, you’ll find out about Twilight Stones. After you open the exit to the cave, continue forward, and drop off the western ledge. Follow the path south into a small room that will contain a purple glowing object to the right of the chest.

The second Artefact can be found by retracing your steps until you reach the area with the twilight stones. Now instead of dropping west like before, head north a little, and turn towards the eastern wall. If you look carefully, you should see the washed out white runic words on the wall. Climb up, and then left until you reach the next area. This next area will be where the Remnants of Asgard will be if you’ve completed the main story (read below). If you haven’t, ignore the last sentence, and continue following the linear path south until you lift, and go under the large stone pillar. Progress a little further forward, and the Artefact will be to the left of the second Nornir Chest.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Legendary Chests in The Strond

chapterContent.content: This can be found in the exact same place as the first Artefact. Jump over the large gap where the Raven was, and progress through the northern cave. Continue forward, and drop off the western ledge. Now follow the path south until you enter the small room on your left where a golden chest will be ripe for plundering.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Remnants of Asgard in The Strond

chapterContent.aside: Complete the main story to access Remnants of Asgard.

chapterContent.content: There’s only one Remnant of Asgard in The Strond. From the Legendary Chest, grapple back to the ledge above, turn left, and climb the wall on the eastern wall. Follow it up, and then left until you reach the next area. When you enter the area, you’ll have a battle with the Remnants of Asgard. This will only appear after completing the main story.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Temple of Light

chapterContent.content: This page will cover the location of every collectible in the Temple of Light, a region of Alfheim in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - Temple of Light Collectibles Locations in Alfheim

chapterContent.aside: All the collectibles in the area can be obtained through your first playthrough.

chapterContent.head: How to Find the Temple of Light

chapterContent.content: During the main quest Groa’s Secret you’ll travel to Alfheim, passing through The Strond before entering the Temple of Light. This page will guide you to obtaining all collectibles including, but not limited to Nornir Chests, Odin’s Ravens, Legendary Chests, and Artefacts plus much more. A lot of the collectibles won’t be available to you until you’ve progressed further into the story, and unlocked more abilities. This guide will mention if that’s the case with as little spoilers as possible. None of the Collectibles in God of War: Ragnarök are missable as you can come back later in the post-game.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Lore (Poems) in Temple of Light

chapterContent.content: At first, you won’t find any collectibles for a short while when you enter the Temple of Light, then you’ll get three all at once!

There are two lores to be found in this area, and the first one can be found by progressing through the linear paths until you have to make three grapples. These will be two grapples, one for each panel, and one to reach the bridge. Once you’re on the bridge, head south, and follow the spiral staircase up. As you reach the top of the first set of stairs, hang a left (before the arched doorway) and drop to the path below. Follow the path left (south), and you’ll find the lore sitting in front of the wall and twisted branches.

The second lore can be found near the end, in the room with the second Raven (read below). Exit the room via the northern door into the statue puzzle room. Complete the puzzle, and progress through the door at the end which will lead outside briefly. Head southeast, up the two ledges, and through the hallway on your right to the next room.

In this room, you’ll see some stairs leading up, to the right of the stairs is a statue. On the statue, you can shoot a sonic arrow at the weapon (spear?) it’s holding to reveal a grapple point. Grapple across on to the circular platform, and turn your camera to the northwest. The lore will be in the form of glowing blue writing, and you’ll find it on the statue’s palm.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Legendary Chests in Temple of Light

chapterContent.content: There are three Legendary Chests in the Temple of Light which is a change from the norm. From the first lore scroll above, turn 180°, and walk northwest a little until you can drop to the ledge to your northeast. Follow the path to where you’ll find the first Legendary Chest sitting at the back next to the bright lights.

The second Legendary Chest can be found a bit later on. From the first Artefact (read below), head back into the room with the blinding pillar of light in the center of the room. Head northeast, and go through the door at the end. Continue up the next set of stairs until you reach a small bridge, and a large archway. Drop off the bridge to your left, and go through the door to your west. In this room, you’ll have a chain that’ll raise a Twilight Stone panel, and a chain-linked fence covering the light crystal that needs to be destroyed.

Raise the panel all the way to the top, and throw your axe at the panel to make it reflect on to the light crystal. Make sure that the axe is stuck behind the fence before you drop the chains, then recall the axe to destroy the crystal. This will make the chest drop for you to open. Lean over the western ledge, and drop to reach the chest.

Finally, the third, and final Legendary Chest can be found in the next room from the previous chest. When you enter the room, turn the camera to your left. At the back, you’ll see the chest. To get to it, you’ll need to do some grappling. Walk further forward, and grapple on the ledge to your left. Grapple to the panel on your left, and you’ll have two options, one panel to your left or the archway to your right.

The latter is the way forward for the mission while the former is towards the chest. Take the left panel, and keep following the panels until you reach another platform. Turn your camera west, and connect your blades to the Twilight panel in front of you. Yank it to the right, and quickly throw your axe at it to hit the light crystal underneath the archway in front of you to open up the gate. Finally, grapple on the panel to the south, and from there, grapple into the now open archway to open the chest. Note: You can open the door to the left of the chest (when facing it) to continue on with the story.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Ravens in Temple of Light

chapterContent.content: Two Ravens here in the Temple of Light. The first one will be in the same area as the first Legendary Chest. Once you’ve looted the Legendary Chest, head back the way you came, grapple up, and take the northwestern path until you see a chain-linked fence. The raven will be behind the fence, but you can only hit it by using the combination of the Twilight stones. Stand back from the pillar a bit, and aim your axe in the middle right of the Twilight Stone. If done correctly, you’ll see a light-blue line linking to the second stone.

The second raven can be found near the end of the area. From the Nornir Chest (read below), go up the stairs next to it. Follow them into the next area with the large pillar of light, and take the small stairs up to the left. The raven will be sitting on an enclosed platform at the back behind one of the Twilight panels. Aim, and throw your axe at it to get the last Raven.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Artefacts in Temple of Light

chapterContent.content: There are two Artefacts in the Temple of Light. The first one can be found at the top of the spiral staircase. From the Raven, grapple up to reach the staircase, and follow it west, then north all the way to the top. As you go through the doorway, look to your right to see a broken piece of wall. Go past the gap in the wall into the shallow water, and look up to use your grapple to the ledge above. Go left, and the Artefact will be sitting by the balcony to your left.
