The second Artefact can be found in the same general area as the second Legendary Chest (read above). It can be found in the room with the door wheel, and the chain for the Legendary Chest. You can find it in the alcove room on the left from the main door.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find all Nornir Chests in Temple of Light

chapterContent.content: Carrying on from the last Legendary Chest (panel room, read above), climb up the wall obscured by leaves, and you’ll be in a room with four Twilight panels, and a bridge of light. Go across the light bridge, and the chest will be at the bottom of the stairs on your right. This chest requires you to destroy all three runes in quick succession, and it doesn’t leave you much time before it resets. First things first, destroy the green metal on the runes by having Atreus fire his arrows at them. When all the runes are cleared of that, you can destroy the runes. The runes can be destroyed in any order provided it’s done within the time limit. You can find the runes in the following locations:

chapterContent.li: Rune 1 (R) – This can be found hanging to the left of the chest.
Rune 2 (C) – On a platform slightly higher to the left of Rune 1.

Rune 3 (n) – The last Rune can be found in a small alcove to the right of the stairs to the right of the chest. If you look down the stairs, you’ll see a Twilight panel which needs to be used to hit the last rune. Make sure you clear the metal of this first as it can be hard to spot at first.

chapterContent.content: As mentioned above, you have a few seconds to hit all three runes, so time is of the essence. Start with rune 3 first as that will take the most time to hit as you need to line it up with the Twilight panel. Aim your axe until the blue line appears, and throw it to hit rune 3. Adjust your aim to hit rune 1 to your left. Now quickly head towards the steps to hit rune 2. If done quick enough, the chest will be unlocked.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Alfheim - The Burrows

chapterContent.content: This page will reveal the location of every collectible in The Burrows, a region of Alfheim in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - The Burrows Collectibles Locations in Alfheim
How to Find The Burrows

chapterContent.content: The Burrows is an optional region in Alfheim where the favor Song of the Sands takes place. If you completed Secret of the Sands in The Barrens, you know roughly what to expect; like The Below, The Burrows is a small area buried under a larger region (in this case, The Forbidden Sands), and your purpose here is to free a confined Hafgufa. That said, there are also numerous collectibles you can find as you travel through the depths of The Burrows.

You can reach The Burrows immediately following the main quest The Reckoning, during which you’ll obtain the upgraded chisel. With this tool in hand you can return to The Barrens where, along its western edge, you’ll find a sealed door. Use the improved chisel to open the door and reach The Forbidden Sands - the cave that leads to The Burrows can be found within this storm-swept desert region.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in The Below

chapterContent.content: Progress through The Burrows until you encounter your first Wretch Hive, after which you’ll enter into a large chamber open to the sky, with a tree growing in the middle. It’s also swarming with Grims and a few Light Elves. Clear the room, then search a wall southwest of the tree to find the Rune Read - Sacrifice.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Legendary Chests in The Burrows

chapterContent.content: From the Lore collectible (see above) carry on through The Burrows, squeezing through a narrow gap before completing a series of climbing/grappling segments, at the end of which you’ll find yourself at the southeastern edge of a large cavern where you’ll have to fight more Grims and Light Elves.

Defeat them and make your way to the southwestern edge of the room to find a wall you can climb. Do so, turn north, northwest and look down to find a horizontal slab of Twilight Stone you can use to cut through a dense hive tendril. Once done, climb back down and head over to where the dense hive tendril was - you can now climb the wall here, ultimately allowing you to reach the ledge upon where this Legendary Chest sits. Plunder it to obtain the Hel’s Touch Light Runic Attack for the Leviathan Axe.

After freeing the Hafgufa, return to the entrance to the chamber and head right (northeast) to reach a chamber that was previously blocked by hive. Drop down a ledge and you’ll be attacked by a Bergsra (not to be confused with a Bergsra Mother) and two Grims. Kill them, then search the northern end of the chamber to find this Legendary Chest. Inside you’ll find the Nemean Crush, a Heavy Runic Attack for the Blades of Chaos.

chapterContent.head: How to Kill the Loot Lizard in The Burrows

chapterContent.content: While not technically a collectible, you can find a Loot Lizard in the depths of The Burrows, which is well worth killing for the resources it yields. You’ll find this elusive reptile in the same cavern as the Legendary Chest that contained the Hel’s Touch Light Runic Attack (see above), and you’ll go about killing it by largely following the same steps you took to reach said Legendary Chest. Once on the elevated ledge that houses the Legendary Chest, look off the edge to the south to spot the Loot Lizard on the floor below - it otherwise abstains from surfacing, being tricky to spot save for the glowing patch it leaves on the ground. Just chuck the Leviathan Axe at it from the ledge with the Legendary Chest and it’ll die, allowing you to drop down and grab whatever it leaves behind.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Artifacts in The Burrows

chapterContent.content: After freeing the Hafgufa, return to the entrance to the chamber and head right (northeast) to reach a chamber that was previously blocked by hive. Drop down a ledge and you’ll be attacked by a Bergsra (not to be confused with a Bergsra Mother) and two Grims. Kill them, then search the northwestern end of this room to find this Artifact lying on the floor near a ruined column. Pick it up to obtain the Tribute to Freyr - Pipe Artifact.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: How to Return to Old Areas in Vanaheim

chapterContent.content: Details about how to return to previously-explored areas in Vanaheim, including The Southern Wilds, [Noatun’s Garden], the [Eastern Barri Woods], [The Abandoned Village] and the [Western Barri Woods].

chapterContent.head: What Collectibles Can You Find During The Reckoning?

chapterContent.content: You’ll first visit Vanaheim fairly early in the game, during the main quest The Reckoning, where you’ll travel through many of the realm’s eastern areas, including The Southern Wilds, [Noatun’s Garden], Freyr’s Camp, the [Eastern Barri Woods], [The Abandoned Village] and the [Western Barri Woods]. You can acquire most of the collectibles in these areas on your first visit (save for the East Barri Woods - you won’t get any of the collectibles here), but once the main quest The Reckoning is over you’ll be locked out of all these areas save for The Southern Wilds and Freyr’s Camp (the former of which you can only reach via Mystic Gateways). None of the collectibles in this realm (or game, for that matter) are ultimately missable, but anything you don’t collect during The Reckoning will be unavailable for a while, as you won’t return until the main quest Creatures of Prophecy, and you won’t have total freedom to explore these areas at your leisure until after the aforementioned quest (technically after the favor [Scent of Survival], which can be started immediately following Creatures of Prophecy).
Suffice to say, anything you miss on your first visit will be out of reach for a long while.
Below you’ll find a list of all the areas you can visit on your first trip through Vanaheim and the collectibles you can not obtain at this time:

chapterContent.head: Exploring Vanaheim After The Reckoning

chapterContent.content: After finishing The Reckoning you’ll have the opportunity to explore Vanaheim further… albeit new areas to the west of Freyr’s Camp. Unlike the areas you travel through during The Reckoning, you’re unencumbered by the restraints of a main questline, so you’re free to explore as you wish. These areas include Freyr’s Camp, Pilgrim’s Landing, the River Delta, Noatun’s Garden, the Cliffside Ruins, The Veiled Passage, the Goddess Falls, and the Vanir Shrine.

Like with the areas you explore during The Reckoning, you’ll be able to acquire most of the collectibles in these areas; in fact, you can scratch off every collectible on your map in all these areas save for the Berserker Gravestone at Pilgrim’s Landing. Your access to them will be restricted during Creatures of Prophecy, but you’ll be able to explore freely following said main quest, after you complete [Scent of Survival]. You’ll also be able to return to Vanaheim and explore these areas further at regular breaks during the main questline (one of your companions will usually prompt you to explore), so you don’t need to fret over these areas quite as much.

chapterContent.head: How to Return to Old Areas in Vanaheim

chapterContent.content: Below you’ll find details about how to return to old areas in Vanaheim following The Reckoning. Most of these can only be revisited during and after the main quest Creatures of Prophecy.

One of the few areas you can return to after finishing The Reckoning but before Creatures of Prophecy. Just use a Mystic Gateway to return here. Note that despite the fact you can return to Freyr’s Camp and The Southern Wilds after The Reckoning, there will be a barrier preventing you from traveling between the two aforementioned areas directly.
Freyr’s Camp is one of the few areas in Vanaheim that you can return to at pretty much any point in the game… after you visit it the first time during The Reckoning, of course.

Your first visit to Vanaheim, during the quest The Reckoning takes you through the Eastern Barri Woods, albeit along a route that bypasses all the collectibles. While there are a few fights here, you’re mostly just working your way towards [The Abandoned Village]. Later, after completing the main quest Forging Destiny, you’ll have the tool you need to open new routes in the Eastern Barri Woods… but alas, the way will be sealed by some barriers.

You’ll return later during the main quest Creatures of Prophecy, where you’ll need to use the Draupnir Spear to destroy a boulder leading back to the Eastern Barri Forest. The exact route you took during The Reckoning will be blocked by a barrier, but the Draupnir Spear can be used to open another path, along which all this area’s collectibles can be found. After you complete Creatures of Prophecy and the following favor [Scent of Survival] you’ll be able to return to the Eastern Barri Woods at your leisure just by going through the gates at Freyr’s Camp.

You’ll visit [The Abandoned Village] during the main quest The Reckoning, where you can obtain every collectible sans Odin’s Raven. Once you leave, however, you won’t be able to return until the main quest Creatures of Prophecy, which is quite a ways into the main questline.
During Creatures of Prophecy you’ll return to The Abandoned Village via an alternate route through the Eastern Barri Woods

chapterContent.li: From Freyr’s Camp, exit through the gate, cross a bridge, then go through the opening you created with the Draupnir Spear during Creatures of Prophecy.
Follow the linear path ahead to the ruins where you fought the Ancient during The Reckoning.
Crawl through a cave to reach the Eastern Barrie Woods.
At a fork turn right (southeast) and go through a cave created by the Draupnir Spear during Creatures of Prophecy.
After the cave, take a left at a fork and continue following the path ahead. Climb some ledges and go through a cave to reach the den of Skoll and Hati.
Sidle across a narrow ledge and follow the linear path ahead until you pass by two Scorn Totems and reach some more ruins.
Drop down a ledge and use the Blades of Chaos to swing into a house.
Exit the house to the west, then turn right (north) to find a ledge, atop which is a rope you can slide down.
Enter some ruins (north) and immediately turn left twice (west and south), then turn southwest and go through an arched structure, beyond which is a Draupnir Spear placement you can swing across.
Once across the water, head west and southwest to find a cliff you can climb. Climb up and when you reach a fork, head right (continuing up will set you back on the path to Freyr’s Camp).
Climb until you use the Blades of Chaos to swing into a cave, then continue through the cave until you find the bridge to The Abandoned Village to the right (northeast).
Head into a house and, if necessary, throw the Leviathan Axe at the panels on the crane to the left to move it so you can use the Blades of Chaos to swing over to the village.

chapterContent.content: You can now pick up any collectibles you missed on your first visit. You can also destroy a barricade leading back to the chamber where you fought the Einherjar for the stolen moon, which will make getting between areas… well, a tiny bit easier, at best. To return to Freyr’s Camp, just head to the cliffs you climbed to reach The Abandoned Village and climb up at the fork instead of right.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Vanaheim - Freyr's Camp

chapterContent.content: This page will reveal the location of every collectible in Freyr’s Camp, a region of Vanaheim in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - Freyr’s Camp Collectibles Locations in Vanaheim
How to Find Freyr’s Camp

chapterContent.content: During the main quest, The Reckoning, you’ll visit Vanaheim. Proceed through Vanaheim and you’ll eventually reach Freyr’s Camp. There are a number of areas where you can find 100% of the collectibles during your first visit to Vanaheim, but unfortunately, Freyr’s Camp isn’t one of them. You can obtain the Lore and Artifacts on your first visit and Odin’s Raven shortly after leaving for the first time, but the Legendary Chests can’t be reached until you obtain the Draupnir Spear during the main quest Forging Destiny, and the Remnants of Asgard can’t be cleared until the quest Beyond Ragnarok is active.

chapterContent.aside: The collectibles listed below can be obtained on your first visit to Freyr’s Camp.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in Freyr’s Camp

chapterContent.content: There are two different Lore collectibles in Freyr’s Camp, and both can be obtained on your first visit.

From the cooking fire/gathering spot in the middle of the area, turn southwest to spot some tents. Search the central one (the one with a campfire in the middle and you’ll find a scroll on the ground. Pick it up to obtain the Scroll - Freyr’s Lament collectible.

From the cooking fire/gathering spot in the middle of the area, turn west and you’ll find a passage. Head down it a short distance and when you reach a fork, turn right to spot a body of water. Immediately turn right again to find some runes scribbled on the wall. Examine them and you’ll score the Rune Read - Vanaheim Lullaby.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Odin’s Ravens in Freyr’s Camp

chapterContent.content: You can find the sole Odin’s Raven just after your first visit to Freyr’s Camp. Talk to Freyr and leave Mimir behind and you’ll be directed to continue deeper into Vanaheim.

From the cooking fire/gathering spot in the middle of the area, turn northeast to find some closed doors. Provided you’ve talked to Freyr you should be able to open them. Do so and continue on, cross a bridge, go through a cave, and you’ll eventually find yourself at a fork back in the forested wilderness of Vanaheim. The quest marker will direct you northeast into another cave. Ignore this route for now, and instead go west, northwest and make your way to a ledge to the north. Look up at to the north and slightly west to spot Odin’s Raven perched on a branch just over some ruins.

chapterContent.aside: The collectible listed below can only be obtained after you return to Freyr’s Camp at the end of the main quest The Reckoning.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Artifacts in Freyr’s Camp

chapterContent.content: There’s only one Artifact in the Freyr’s Camp area, and it being listed under the Freyr’s Camp area is more of a categorical fiction rather than a geographic reality.

After returning to Freyr’s Camp at the end of The Reckoning you’ll be charged with seeking out a Mystic Gate and returning to Sindri’s House. Navigate a few puzzles (mostly tutorials on Freya’s abilities) and row a boat until you reach a beach where you can land. In addition to the Mystic Gateway you seek you’ll find this Artifact, the Family Crest - Skirnir’s Crest to the west.

chapterContent.aside: The collectibles listed below can only be obtained after the main quest Forging Destiny.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Legendary Chests in Freyr’s Camp

chapterContent.content: From the campfire in the middle of camp, head down a passage to the west, then turn right (north) to find yourself at the shore of a river. Follow the shore to the west, then north, jump across the river to the north and turn left to spot a boulder you can destroy with the Draupnir Spear. Do so and you’ll find a Legendary Chest on the other side, which contains Divine Ashes x500.

chapterContent.aside: The collectibles listed below can only be obtained after the main quest Reunion.

chapterContent.content: While technically listed as one of the collectibles in Freyr’s Camp, this Legendary Chest is right on the edge of the Eastern Barri Woods, and is a good ways outside of the camp proper. Exit the camp via its gates, destroy a boulder with the Draupnir Spear to open the path back up to the eastern and northern areas, and continue on until you reach some ruins. On your first visit during The Reckoning you fought an Ancient here, on your second visit during Creatures of Prophecy you’ll encounter a Stalker and some Wisps.

Defeat whatever you encounter here, then work your way to the northeastern end of these ruins, where you’ll likely encounter some Gulon. Once they’re defeated, look at the northwestern end of the ruins to find a wall standing at the edge of some water - you can damage this wall with the Draupnir Spear, creating handholds that will allow you to climb up and over to a wooden platform. You can use a rope to slide back down to the southern half of the ruins, but if you drop down a ledge and turn southeast you’ll find another wall you can climb, which leads to a Legendary Chest wherein you’ll find the Leviathan’s Roar, a Heavy Runic Attack for the Leviathan Axe.

chapterContent.aside: The collectibles listed below can only be obtained after the main quest The Realms at War.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Remnants of Asgard in the Freyr’s Camp

chapterContent.content: You can only clear the Remnants of Asgard if you’ve reached the main quest Beyond Ragnarok. Once Beyond Ragnarok has started, travel to the Freyr’s Camp Mystic Gateway and hop in the bow, then row up the river to the north and beach the boat at the landing west of Freyr’s Camp. You’ll know you’re going in the right direction if you see rippling rainbow effects. Once you land at the beach, turn south to find an apparently abandoned camp - the Einherjar here will appear if you loot the chest in their camp. Defeat them to clear this collectible.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Vanaheim - Eastern Barri Woods

chapterContent.content: This page will reveal the location of every collectible in the Eastern Barri Woods, a region of Vanaheim in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - The Eastern Barri Woods Collectibles Locations in Vanaheim
How to Find the Eastern Barri Woods

chapterContent.content: During the main quest The Reckoning you’ll travel to Vanaheim, passing through The Southern WIlds and Freyr’s Camp before reaching the Eastern Barri Woods. There are five collectibles in this region, but you can’t actually obtain any of them on your first visit - you’re just passing through en route to The Abandoned Village.

A fair bit later in the game you’ll return to Vanaheim as part of the main quest Creatures of Prophecy, where you’ll have to pass through the Eastern Barri Forest again, albeit via an alternate route that allows you to nab most of the collectibles, save for the Remnants of Asgard, which is only available in postgame play.

From Freyr’s Camp, exit through the gate and follow the linear path until you’re prompted to use the Draupnir Spear to destroy a boulder in your way. Beyond this point the path largely links up with your first trip through the area, taking you through some ruins (you’ll fight a Stalker here on your second visit, instead of an Ancient) before you need to crawl through a cave to reach the Eastern Barri Forest. Follow the path until you reach a fork - on your first visit you turned left (north), but since this route is now blocked turn right (southeast) to find another boulder you can destroy with the Draupnir Spear. Most of the collectibles in the Eastern Barri Forest are beyond this boulder.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Nornir Chests in the Eastern Barri Woods

chapterContent.content: After destroying the second boulder with the Draupnir Spear, continue forward until you reach a fork in the path. Take a left (east) at this fork and follow this path until you find some stone steps to the left (east). Head up these stairs and follow this path to reach some ruins, where this Nornir Chest lies. This particular Nornir Chest is a rune pole puzzle where you have to strike panels to cycle between several runes - once all the runes on the poles match those on the chest, the Nornir Chest will unlock.

chapterContent.li: Rune 1: From the Nornir Chest, turn around and head southeast to exit the ruins. Once outside, immediately turn right to find some brambles. Use Runic Arrows and the Blades of Chaos to ignite the brambles and reveal the first rune pole.
Rune 2: Just to the left (west) of the Nornir Chest. This one is basically a freebie.

chapterContent.content:
:::image-block-3



:::

chapterContent.li: Rune 3: From the Nornir Chest head southwest to find another path leading into the forest, overlooking the path you were on previously. Kill the Wulver at the end of the path, then look up and to the southwest to find a hard-to-spot rune pole hiding in front of some distant ruins. You might have to aim just above the panel to hit it from this distance.

chapterContent.content: Turn all three rune poles to unlock the Nornir Chest, after which you can claim your prize - either an Idunn Apple or a Horn of Blood Mead.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in the Eastern Barri Woods

chapterContent.content: After destroying the second boulder with the Draupnir Spear, continue forward until you reach a fork in the path. Take a left (east) at this fork and follow this path until you find some stone steps to the left (east). Go up the stairs and keep looking to the right of the path and you should spot theScroll - The Aesir Promise on the ground.

One of the few collectibles that can’t be found immediately past the second boulder you need to destroy with the Draupnir Spear, continue through the area until you pass by Skoll and Hati’s lair, beyond which you’ll reach some ruins. Once inside the ruins, search the walls to the left (southwest) to find the Rune Read - Verdant scrawled on the ruins.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Odin’s Ravens in the Eastern Barri Woods

chapterContent.content: From the Nornir Chest (see above), turn southwest and head through an arch to find an alternate path leading back into the forest. Kill the Wulver at the end and look west to find one of Odin’s Ravens hiding in a tree.

chapterContent.aside: The collectibles listed below can only be obtained after the main quest The Realms at War.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Remnants of Asgard in the Eastern Barri Woods

chapterContent.content: You can only clear the Remnants of Asgard if you’ve reached the main quest Beyond Ragnarok. Once Beyond Ragnarok has started, travel to Freyr’s Camp and exit via the northeastern gate, which will lead to the Eastern Barri Woods. Travel through the Eastern Barri Woods to reach some ruins - the same ruins where you fought an Ancient on your first visit and a Stalker on your second visit. Cross the river to the northeast to find the Einherjar camp, where you’ll find a Dodher Wyvern in addition to several Einherjar. Kill them to complete this collectible, but note you can also pick up the Lore Scroll - Defend the Prison, which one of the Einherjar will drop. This doesn’t count as a collectible.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Vanaheim - The Abandoned Village

chapterContent.content: This page will reveal the location of every collectible in the Abandoned Village, a region of Vanaheim in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - The Abandoned Village Collectibles Locations in Vanaheim
How to Find The Abandoned Village

chapterContent.content: During the main quest The Reckoning you’ll travel to Vanaheim, passing through The Southern WIlds, Freyr’s Camp and the [Eastern Barri Woods] before reaching The Abandoned Village.

You can find numerous collectibles here - eight in total - of which seven can be acquired on your first visit. The lone remaining collectible, Odin’s Raven, can’t be found until a good bit later in the main questline, during Creatures of Prophecy. It’s also worth noting that if you miss any collectibles on your first visit, you won’t be able to return until the aforementioned Creatures of Prophecy quest. Once you’ve finished Creatures of Prophecy (and the mandatory favor [Scent of Survival]) you’ll finally be able to explore various areas along the eastern and northern ends of Vanaheim - including The Abandoned Village - at your leisure.

As you near the end of the Eastern Barri Woods area you’ll climb across some cliffs before swinging into a cave with the Blades of Chaos. Pass through the caves and you’ll be introduced to Cursed Nokken enemies, which heal nearby enemies - make them a priority whenever you encounter them. Cross a bridge to reach a house on the outskirts of The Abandoned Village, then use the Leviathan Axe to strike the panels of a crane so you can swing over to another house using the Blades of Chaos. From here there are two ways you can go - continue northeast across a bridge, which ultimately leads to the grand hall or hit the crane again so you can swing over to the northwest. You’ll want to head northwest first, where you can pick up a Lore scroll, clear a Draugr Hole and plunder a Legendary Chest, then cross the bridge to the northeast, get a Lore collectible, before finally continuing through the grand hall.

Once you reach the grand hall you’ll have to fight a horde of Einherjar, after which you’ll progress a bit, climb some cliffs and reach a crane puzzle, near which you’ll find the Nornir Chest and the other two Legendary Chests, which are the last two collectibles you can obtain at this time.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Draugr Holes in The Abandoned Village

chapterContent.content: From the entrance to The Abandoned Village, use a crane to swing from one house to the next, then move the crane again to swing outside to the northwest. When you land, turn west and cross a bridge to find this Draugr Hole, where you’ll have to fight The Hateful. Defeat it to complete this Draugr Hole.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Legendary Chests in Abandoned Village

chapterContent.content: Kill The Hatred to clear the Draugr Hole (see above), then search the wall northeast of the Draugr Hole to find a passage you can crawl through. Do so and leap into a building to the southeast, wherein you’ll find a Legendary Chest containing the Rond of Restoration.

After searching the village proper, enter the grand hall and fend off some Einherjar. Once they’re defeated, open a gate and turn left (north) and head down a passage, stopping to freeze a Scorn Pole with the Levithan Axe before continuing through a doorway to the left. Destroy some bursting plants, then use the Blades of Chaos to destroy some bramble to free a chain, then climb up the chain to reach a wooden walkway. Proceed forward and turn right when you find another ledge to spot this Legendary Chest just off the walkway, in a depression full of poisonous mist. Use the Leviathan Axe on another Scorn Pole to clear the poison, then loot the Legendary Chest to obtain the Shatter Star Shield.

After the Nornir Chest (see below), continue forward and you’ll reach a second crane puzzle (you’ll have to defeat an Einherjar Captain named Fiske along the way). Drop down a ledge and search some ruins to the southwest, where you’ll find a hole in a wall - the torch beyond makes it pretty easy to see this hole. Jump on in, turn left twice, then look up to the north to spot a weak pillar you can topple with the Blades of Chaos. This will allow you to manipulate the crane outside.

Exit the hole in the wall and return northeast to return to the ledge you dropped down earlier. Hit the panels on the crane until you can swing across to the southwest, then follow a path around a tree to reach another ledge - you should see the Legendary Chest across the gap to the northeast. Move the crane again until you can swing across, then loot the Legendary Chest to obtain the Helios Flare, a Light Runic Attack for the Blades of Chaos.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in Abandoned Village

chapterContent.content: From the entrance to The Abandoned Village, use a crane to swing from one house to the next, then move the crane again to swing outside to the northwest. When you land, turn east and search the ground near some wicker containers to find the Scroll - Chores Lore pickup.

From the entrance to The Abandoned Village, use a crane to swing from one house to the next, then cross a bridge to the northeast. Search the entrance to the grand hall (the large building in front of you) to find some glowing blue runes on the wall to the north. Examining them will earn you the Rune Read - Prayer to Freya Lore collectible.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Nornir Chests in The Abandoned Village

chapterContent.content: After going through the grand hall and subsequently climbing some cliffs you’ll find yourself at a broken bridge. Fortunately there’s a crane to the left (southwest) with panels you can strike to turn the machine. Unfortunately, some bramble is clogging up the works. To get across, follow these steps:

chapterContent.li: Head up a short flight of stairs near the bridge to reach a ledge. Use the Blades of Chaos to burn away the brambles entrapping the crane, revealing a hanging brazier in the process.
Turn the crane until you can swing across to an island to the southwest.

Head to the western end of the island and look northwest to find more brambles obstructing the far end of the broken bridge. Hit the crane to bring the brazier between you and the brambles, then use the Blades of Chaos to swing the brazier into the brambles, burning them.

chapterContent.content: You can now swing back to the northeast, then swing across from one broken section of bridge to the other side (west). Continue west and turn right to find a trail leading downhill beside the broken bridge. You’ll find the Nornir Chest to your right, under the western section of the broken bridge. This particular Nornir Chest is another rune brazier puzzle, and you’ll have to use the brazier hanging off the crane to light two of these rune braziers. Being able to freely operate the crane and cross the broken bridge was a precondition for solving the puzzle, the solution for which is below:

chapterContent.li: Rune 1: The first brazier - and the only one that doesn’t involve the crane - can be found opposite the Nornir Chest. Just look northwest from the Nornir Chest and you should spot the brazier - ignite it with the Blades of Chaos.

Rune 2: Make your way back to the island south of the crane, then turn the crane until the hanging brazier is to the north. The rune brazier is nestled between the roots of a tree to the northwest - use the Blades of Chaos to swing the hanging brazier to the left and it should ignore the rune brazier.

Rune 3: From the island south of the crane look northeast and you should see this rune brazier on a ledge. Swing across to the northeast, then head to the eastern end of the broken bridge. Use your Blades of Chaos to swing the hanging brazier left into the rune brazier on the ledge below.

chapterContent.content: Return west across the water and loot the Nornir Chest to claim your prize - either an Idunn Apple or a Horn of Blood Mead.

chapterContent.aside: This Nornir Chest puzzle may become glitchy. You should have no trouble clearing the bramble, but if you just can’t get the hanging brazier to swing into the rune braziers, don’t fret! - it’s probably not your fault. This isn’t a complicated puzzle that requires a lot of nuance, and if the physics just aren’t doing what you think they should, save, quit the game, then boot it back up and the physics should be functioning properly.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Odin’s Ravens in The Abandoned Village

chapterContent.content: The lone Odin’s Raven in this area is the only collectible you can’t obtain on your first visit. When you come back to Vanaheim later during the main quest Creatures of Prophecy you’ll be tasked with recovering the stolen moon, which can be found in the grand hall in The Abandoned Village. Kill the Einherjar and afterwards you’ll need to chase an Einherjar Captain. Follow your foe through an arched structure, beyond which is a Draupnir Spear placement you can swing across. Before using the Draupnir Spear and continuing your pursuit, however, look southeast to find one of Odin’s Ravens in a tree.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Vanaheim - Western Barri Woods

chapterContent.content: This page will reveal the location of every collectible in the Western Barri Woods, a region of Vanaheim in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - The Western Barri Woods Collectibles Locations in Vanaheim
How to Find the Western Barri Woods

chapterContent.content: During the main quest The Reckoning you’ll travel to Vanaheim, passing through The Southern Wilds, Freyr’s Camp, the Eastern Barri Woods and The Abandoned Village before reaching the Western Barri Woods.

There are only two collectibles in this region, one of which is a mandatory favor, Scent of Survival that you can’t complete until immediately after the main quest Creatures of Prophecy. The other is a Lore collectible you can find during the main quest The Reckoning. If you miss the Lore pickup, you won’t be able to return until the aforementioned main quest Creatures of Prophecy, which is quite a bit after your first visit.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in the Western Barri Woods

chapterContent.content: After defeating Nidhogg during the main quest The Reckoning, continue forward. You’ll have to clear some bramble using Freya’s Runic Arrows and the Blades of Chaos and defeat some Einherjar followed by some Wisps. Use Freya’s Runic Arrows and the Leviathan Axe to bypass some Scorn Poles and continue on until the sun comes up… rather abruptly. After Freya is done talking, continue along the linear path to the southwest, but keep your eye to the ring to find a Lore Marker. Examine it and you’ll gain the entry Harmony.

chapterContent.head: Scent of Survival

chapterContent.content: Complete the main quest Creatures of Prophecy and you’ll find yourself back in Freyr’s Camp. Exit via the western cavern and on your way out you’ll encounter the hound Helka, who has caught the scent of something interesting and seems to want you to follow. Follow the dog throughout Vanaheim and it’ll lead you to the Western Barri Woods (you’ll have to take a boat part of the way, and use a Celestial Altar to transition from night to day). Once you catch up to Helka and disembark on Freyr’s boat you’ll complete this favor, which counts as a collectible.

chapterContent.aside: The favor Scent of Survival leads you to The Crater - The Plains region of Vanaheim. You’ll find a Mystic Gateway shortly after arriving, so you don’t have to do much here before you can return.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Vanaheim - Pilgrim's Landing

chapterContent.content: How to find every collectible in Pilgrim’s Landing, a region of Vanaheim in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: How to Find Pilgrim’s Landing

chapterContent.content: After completing the main quest The Reckoning you’ll be tasked with making your way to a new Mystic Gateway southwest of Freyr’s Camp. Once you reach your destination you’ll be given a choice - continue exploring the western half of Vanaheim or return to Sindri’s House and continue the main questline. Assuming you chose the former, use Sonic Arrows to clear an obstruction and continue sailing down the river. Sail down the winding river and you’ll reach the River Delta, whereupon you’ll find some ruins on an island. Turn right (southwest) and follow the coast until you find a beach - Pilgrim’s Landing.

When you land you’ll need to defeat some Reavers, after which you can talk to a spirit to start the favor Cure For the Dead, which counts as one of this location’s collectibles. See the linked page for more details about how to complete said favor, but a lot of the collectibles for Pilgrim’s Landing will be collected as you work on said favor, so there’s no reason not to take care of both at the same time.

chapterContent.head: Pilgrim’s Landing Collectibles in Vanaheim

chapterContent.aside: The collectibles listed below can be obtained on your first visit to Pilgrim’s Landing.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in Pilgrim’s Landing

chapterContent.content: You’ll find one bit of Lore - a Lore Marker - on Pilgrim’s Landing. As with most collectibles in this area, it’s found on the island ruins.

Almost all the collectibles in this region are on the island ruins. To get there, you’ll need to head east and climb a ledge to find a raised drawbridge. Use Freya’s sigil magic on a burning brazier to the left of the drawbridge to clear some brambles, then throw the Leviathan Axe through two targets on either side of the drawbridge to lower it.

chapterContent.aside: Freya’s runic magic functions similarly to Atreus’ sonic arrows. Aim at the target and press . Swap between runic magic and sonic arrows by pressing .

chapterContent.content: Once the bridge is down, continue forward and kill more Reavers, including a pair of Cursed Nokken that’ll heal your enemies if you don’t deal with them, first. Smite your foes, then search to the northwest to find the Rune Marker - Dead on Arrival.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Legendary Chests in Pilgrim’s Landing

chapterContent.content: To reach the lone Legendary Chest in Pilgrim’s Landing, you’ll need to make your way north from where you fought the group of Reavers and Cursed Nokken. Blocking your way you’ll see another raised drawbridge… which means another puzzle.

To lower the second drawbridge, make your way to where you fought the Reavers and Cursed Nokkens, then look up and to the east to spot a device with two braziers on it chained to a distant tree. The goal is to light a brazier on the right side of the drawbridge to the north, but you’ll have to transport flames a good distance to reach your goal, using three other braziers to facilitate your pyromania.
To solve the puzzle, follow these steps:

chapterContent.li: Throw the Leviathan Axe at the target to free the brazier-bearing device.
Use the Blades of Chaos to swing the device to the right, this will light the right brazier.

Use Freya’s sigil magic to create two sigils on the device - one to the left, one in the center - then have Freya use her sigil magic on the (lit) right brazier to transfer the flame. This will light up the left brazier.
Pull the brazier-bearing device to the left using the Blades of Chaos. This will light a brazier atop some stonework to the left.
Use Freya’s sigil magic on the aforementioned brazier to clear the nearby bramble, which extends all the way to the drawbridge.
Break the targets next to the drawbridge to lower it.

chapterContent.content: With all that done you can finally cross the drawbridge, where you’ll find a Legendary Chest containing the Grip of the Fallen Alchemist.

chapterContent.aside: From the Legendary Chest, look through a stone arch to the northwest to spot one of Odin’s Ravens prancing around on a ledge. This raven is a collectible in the River Delta area, despite the fact that the ideal spot from which to attack the bird is located in Pilgrim’s Blessing.
The collectibles listed below can only be obtained after the main quest The Word of Fate.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Berserker Gravestone at Pilgrim’s Landing

chapterContent.content: Before you can activate Berserker Gravestones, you must find the Inert Hilt of Skofnung, which you’ll acquire automatically during the main quest The Word of Fate. You can use the hilt to activate Berserker Gravestones any time you’re free to explore afterwards, although waiting to improve your gear might be a wiser course of action. When you’re ready for a fight, row back to Pilgrim’s Landing - the Berserker Gravestone is right out in the open, and interacting with it will summon [Hvitserkr the Bold]. Defeat him to clear this “collectible”.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Vanaheim - River Delta

chapterContent.content: This page will reveal the location of every collectible in the River Delta, a region of Vanaheim in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - River Delta Collectibles Locations in Vanaheim
How to Find the River Delta

chapterContent.content: After completing the main quest The Reckoning you’ll be tasked with making your way to a new Mystic Gateway southwest of Freyr’s Camp. Once you reach your destination you’ll be given a choice - continue exploring the western half of Vanaheim or return to Sindri’s House and continue the main questline. Assuming you chose the former, use Sonic Arrows to clear an obstruction and continue sailing down the river. Sail down the winding river and you’ll reach the River Delta.

Finding the River Delta is one thing, actually getting the collectibles here is a good bit trickier. The River Delta is, as the name implies, fragmented into numerous bits of land, all of which are a good ways south of the actual words “River Delta” on the map, and worse, surrounded by numerous other areas with their own collectibles list. The lines between the River Delta and these other areas are blurry, and you’ll need to travel extensively to find all these collectibles.

There are two boat docks that count as the River Delta, one in between Pilgrims Landing and Noatun’s Garden and another just across the river from the Cliffside Ruins. The latter is fairly easy to find, but the former can be a bit tricky. From the gate that leads to the River Delta, turn left (south, southeast) to find two channels. Take the rightmost of these two channels and stick to some cliffs to the left until you find a passage (also to the left). Enter the passage, then turn left again the first chance you get to find this elusive beach.

The favor The Mysterious Orb counts as a collectible for the River Delta, and to complete it you’ll need to head to The Veiled Passage. You’ll also need to set foot on the Cliffside Ruins and Pilgrim’s Landing areas to find some of the other River Delta collectibles, so don’t expect to finish this region until you’ve covered quite a bit of ground.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Artifacts in the River Delta

chapterContent.content: Land at the boat dock between Pilgrims Landing and Noatun’s Garden and search a rock slab to the north. This Artifact, Family Crest - Odin’s Crest is lying out in the open.

This collectible can be found at the southern of the two River Delta beaches, just sail south until you find two beaches - the southern one is the Cliffside Ruins, while the northern one will be the beach you seek. Brok’s shop and a Mystic Gateway both serve as fine landmarks. Search to the left (west) of Brok’s shop to find this collectible, the Family Crest - Freya’s Crest Artifact - near the Mystic Gateway.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in the River Delta

chapterContent.content: Land at the boat dock between Pilgrims Landing and Noatun’s Garden and head upstairs to find a bridge. Continue past the Yggdrasil Rift, cross the bridge to the northeast, and turn right at a chest to find the Scroll - Nonviolence lying on the ground.

chapterContent.aside: If you look east, southeast from the Scroll - Nonviolence Lore collectible you’ll find some brambles running into a building. This is part of the Noatun’s Garden area, but you’ll need to clear the bramble from here to open up the building. Use Freya’s runic magic to create a line of sigils on the nearby wall, then ignite the sigils with Kratos’s Blades of Chaos. With the bramble burnt, destroy a target with the Leviathan Axe in the hole in the building’s wall - this will allow you to reach said building when you explore Noatun’s Garden.

chapterContent.content: This collectible can be found at the southern of the two River Delta beaches, just sail south until you find two beaches - the southern one is the Cliffside Ruins, while the northern one will be the beach you seek. Brok’s shop and a Mystic Gateway both serve as fine landmarks. Search to the right (east) of Brok’s shop to find the Lore Marker - Living Masterpiece Lore collectible.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Odin’s Ravens in the River Delta

chapterContent.content: To take down this raven, you’ll need to land at Pilgrim’s Landing, then make your way onto some ruins to the east. You’ll have to fight through two groups of Reavers (the second group is accompanied by Cursed Nokkens) and solve two puzzles to lower some drawbridges (check out the Cure For the Dead page for more details).

Once the second drawbridge is lowered, cross it to find a Legendary Chest. From this chest, look through a stone arch to the northwest to spot one of Odin’s Ravens prancing around on a ledge. Hit it with the Leviathan Axe to finish this collectible.

This raven can be found on a branch overhanging the river east of the Cliffside Ruins, but spotting it and killing it are different matters. You simply don’t have the range to reach it from the easily accessible western part of the Cliffside Ruins, and instead you must pass through the entirety of The Veiled Passage to reach the eastern end of the Cliffside Ruins. Check out the linked walkthrough for The Veiled Passage for details on how to reach and pass through this area.

Once you’re done with The Veiled Passage you can slide down a chain, which will lead to the eastern section of the Cliffside Ruins. From here, head east and look down over the river to the east, southeast to spot this raven.

chapterContent.head: How to Clear All Yggdrasil Rifts in the River Delta

chapterContent.content: Land at the boat dock between Pilgrims Landing and Noatun’s Garden and head upstairs to find a bridge. Just at the top of these stairs you’ll find the Yggdrasil Rift. Be wary, as when you interact with it you’ll be attacked by two Lv5 Light Elves, and if you’re only Lv3 at the moment (very likely, if this is your first visit), they’ll have purple life bars.

While not unbeatable, expect them to deal immense damage if they land a hit, while they can weather a significant amount of punishment. You’re probably best off jumping to the far side of the bridge and hoping one of them doesn’t chase you, or better yet, that you can knock one off the bridge as they try to pursue you. Or, you know, you can always just come back later when you’re a high level to make this fight much, much easier.
However you manage it, once you defeat the Light Elves you can loot the Yggdrasil Rift to obtain a variety of resources.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Loot Lizards in the River Delta

chapterContent.content: While not technically a collectible, there is a Loot Lizard in the River Delta region, which, given how fractious it is, doesn’t really narrow things down much. Make you way to the southern of the two River Delta beaches, just sail south until you find two beaches - the southern one is the Cliffside Ruins, while the northern one will be the beach you seek. Brok’s shop and a Mystic Gateway both serve as fine landmarks. Head up a hill to the right (southeast) of Brok’s shop and you’ll find the Loot Lizard standing across from you. As usual, if you get too close or make a frontal attack, it’ll burrow to safety, and there’s no real way to get around to its flank or rear, either.

Fortunately, Vanaheim delivers. Its hazardous flora - normally a nuisance - this time proves beneficial. Look up and to the left of the Loot Lizard to find a flower on the cliff above it. Strike this plant with your Leviathan Axe and it’ll discharge some poisonous pollen, landing right where the Loot Lizard is located. An indirect kill is just as good as any other - once the Vanaheim plant has done your dirty work for you, pick up whatever the Loot Lizard drops.

chapterContent.head: How to Find the Buried Treasure in the River Delta

chapterContent.content: Before you can start looking for this Buried Treasure, you have to find the Treasure Map for it, which itself is a Lore collectible in the Vanir Shrine. When you first arrive in Vanir Shrine, defeat all of the enemies in the room with the scorn poles. After doing that, venture to the northern side to find a bridge you have to lower. The Lore Marker - The Feast will be near the bridge. As you’re facing the aforementioned Lore Marker, turn right and you should see a dead end there. The Treasure Map - The Giant’s Toes will be on the ground, at that dead end.
With this Treasure Map in hand, return to Brok’s Shop and beach your boat there. Search to the left of Brok’s Shop, near the Mystic Gateway, to find this Buried Treasure.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Vanaheim - Noatun's Garden

chapterContent.content: This page will reveal the location of every collectible in Noatun’s Garden, a region of Vanaheim in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - Noatun’s Garden Collectibles Locations in Vanaheim
How to Find Noatun’s Garden

chapterContent.content: After completing the main quest The Reckoning you’ll be tasked with making your way to a new Mystic Gateway southwest of Freyr’s Camp. Once you reach your destination you’ll be given a choice - continue exploring the western half of Vanaheim or return to Sindri’s House and continue the main questline. Assuming you chose the former, use Sonic Arrows to clear an obstruction and continue sailing down the river. Sail down the winding river and you’ll reach the River Delta; follow the leftmost (southeastern) channel and you’ll pass under a bridge, beyond which is a beach you can land at to the left.

When you land you’ll need to kill several waves of Gulon and a pair of Graoungr, and some more Gulon may appear as you work your way through the area’s puzzles. Otherwise this location plays host to the Garden For the Dead favor, which counts as a collectible. Check out the linked page for a full walkthrough for this favor. Even if this favor wasn’t one of the collectibles in Noatun’s Garden, you’d have to clear out most of the poison-spewing Scorn Poles to reach various collectibles anyways, so completion of the aforementioned favor is very much linked with finding all the collectibles on Noatun’s Garden.

While somewhat combat heavy, you can complete every collectible in this location on your first visit. That said, you’ll have to travel to a hidden beach in the River Delta to solve one of the puzzles here and hence obtain all the collectibles, so it’s not a straight-forward endeavor.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Legendary Chests in Noatun’s Garden

chapterContent.content: There’s only one Legendary Chest in Noatun’s Garden, and aside from the Garden For the Dead favor it may just be the most complicated collectible in this area.

This Legendary Chest can be found in a building along the northern end of Noatun’s Garden. Only problem is, the door is sealed, and it cannot be opened from Noatun’s Garden. Instead, you need to head to the hidden beach between Pilgrim’s Landing and Noatun’s Garden, an area which technically counts as the River Delta area.

From the gate that leads to the River Delta (marked on your map with an “entrance” marker), turn left (south, southeast) to find two channels. Take the rightmost of these two channels and stick to some cliffs to the left until you find a passage (also to the left). Enter the passage, then turn left again the first chance you get to find this elusive beach. You can also reach this hidden River Delta beach from Noatun’s Garden by sailing west from the southernmost beach at Noatun’s Garden, going between some massive tree roots and into a passage. Follow the passage and turn right at the first opportunity to find this beach.

When you land, head up some stairs and cross a bridge to find a chest. To the right of this chest you’ll find the Scroll - Nonviolence, and more importantly you’ll be able to see the other side of the building that houses this Legendary Chest. There’s a hole in the wall of the building and some bramble growing out of said hole in the wall, creeping towards the bridge you’re on. Use Freya’s sigil magic to ignite the bramble, then toss the Leviathan Axe through a hole in the building’s wall at a target inside. This will cut a weight and open the door.

Cross the bridge again and turn left to find a rope you can slide on to quickly return back to Noatun’s Garden. Enter the now-accessible building and you’ll find the Legendary Chest beckoning you. Kill several Nightmares, that spawn, then loot the Legendary Chest to score the Jewel of Yggdrasil.
Whew.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in Noatun’s Garden

chapterContent.content: You can find this collectible along the northern end of the island, alongside the building that houses the area’s lone Legendary Chest. It’s just… lying on the ground near some rocks. Snag is to pick up the Treasure Map - Under the Rainbow, which counts as a Lore collectible.

Along the eastern end of the island, between two troll statues (opposite the ghost who gives you the favor Garden For the Dead you’ll find a sealed door you need to open with the chisel. Beyond this is a chest where you’ll find Lunda’s Broken Belt, so it’s well worth doing, but as far as this Lore collectible is concerned, it’s just a landmark. To the right (south) of this door you’ll find the Lore Marker - Golrab of the Ashes and Frost.

Along the southern end of the island you’ll find a building. A sealed door prevents you from entering, but that’s just as well - the collectible you seek is on the roof. Be wary of a spine-spewing Vanaheim plant above the Scorn Pole to the east and work your way around the poison to reach the eastern end of the building, where you’ll find a wall you can climb. Do so and search the southern end of the roof to find the Lore Marker - Garden’s Progress. You can also find the bulb you need to ignite to kill the aforementioned spine-spitting Vanaheim plant to the left of this Lore Marker.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Artifacts in Noatun’s Garden

chapterContent.content: Make your way to the eastern edge of the of the building along the southern end of Noatun’s Garden to find this collectible - the Family Crest - Hoenir’s Crest Artifact lying on the ground. You may want to bypass this at first and kill the spine-spewing Vanaheim plant by climbing up to the roof of the nearby building and igniting the bulb.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Vanaheim - Vanir Shrine

chapterContent.content: This page will reveal the location of every collectible found in the Vanir Shrine area of Vanaheim in God of War Ragnarok.

Vanaheim is one of the nine realms you will visit during the main course of the story, and was the home of Freya. One of the areas of Vanaheim you will explore is called Vanir Shrine, although it is initially locked to you. You won’t be able to explore this area during the main story section, but after that is over, you will have a large optional area to visit. One of these optional areas holds the key to unlocking the way to Vanir Shrine.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - Vanir Shrine Collectibles Locations in Vanaheim
How to Find Vanir Shrine

chapterContent.content: After completing the main story quest, The Reckoning, you will be tasked with going to a Mystic Gateway to return to Sindri’s House. However, you have the option to continue exploring Vanaheim, with there being a log with some Soundstone on it blocking the path. Use your Sonic Arrows to clear the obstruction, then begin sailing down the river. Doing so will put the Freya’s Missing Peace Favor in your log, which is one of the two requirements to access the Vanir Shrine. So, as long as you commit to exploring the optional area of Vanaheim, you will have one of two requirements already handed to you.

To get to Vanir Shrine, you will first have to go to Goddess Falls, which requires you to clear some large rocks out of the way. To do this, head to Cliffside Ruins and climb the one wall there, then jump onto the isolated platforms to find some vines holding up a chain. Use Freya’s sigil arrows and your Blades of Chaos to burn the vines and drop the chain. Climb that chain now and follow the path to the end, where you can use the chisel on the mirror thing to create a rune word, which you can have Freya say the word to remove the rocks. Return to your boat and sail down that river path, then dock your boat at Goddess Falls. Climb to the uppermost area and have Freya open the large doors (covered with normal vines), leading to Vanir Shrine.
Upon first entering this area, you will have to fight a Soul Eater, as well as some other minor enemies.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Artifact in Vanir Shrine

chapterContent.content: The Artifact is located past the raised bridge you see on the one side in the main area. Look below, at the The Auburn Crown Lore Marker, to see how to lower it. As you progress through this area, you will eventually be jumped by some Gulons. Defeat them, then look where they came from to find the Artifact.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in Vanir Shrine

chapterContent.content: When you first arrive in Vanir Shrine, defeat all of the enemies in the room with the poison totems. After doing that, venture to the northern side to find a bridge you have to lower. The Lore Marker - The Feast will be near the bridge.

This one is very close to the previous Lore Marker. As you’re facing the Lore Marker, turn right and you should see a dead end there. The Treasure Map - The Giant’s Toes will be on the ground, at that dead end.

Return to the raised bridge mentioned earlier, which you now need to drop. Use sigils to make a chain to the vines, while blocking the projectiles from the spitting flower. Ignite the sigil to burn the vines, then destroy the runic disc behind it. Head to the middle portion of this area, at the cliff, and look towards the bridge to spot the second disc you need to break. With the bridge now lowered, go into the next area and clear the enemies, then you’ll find the Lore Marker - The Auburn Crown right there.

In the main area of the Vanir Shrine, look opposite the raised bridge to spot a large gate. At the top of the gate are two torches, which must be lit simultaneously. Clear the vines below the left torch, then place sigils between the two torches, before lighting them with your Blades. If done right, then they will light simultaneously and the gate will open. Ignore the first enemy ahead, burn the next set of vines, and kill the Nokken first, as it’s regenerating the other enemies’ health. Clear the rest of the enemies after, then return to where the first enemy was located to find the Rune Read - Traitor in bright, blue letters on the wall.
After reading the Rune Read above, head into the area where you found the Nokken and look for the Lore Marker - Blessing of Two along the one wall.

Do the two side paths in this area, for the Favor, then have Freya read the rune word back in the main area. Doing this will cause a bridge to appear, leading to a mirror door. Before opening the door, look on the ground to the right of the door to find the Lore Scroll - Abandoned.

After crossing the middle bridge and opening the door, there will be a cutscene past the mirror door, with Freya receiving a new weapon. Once the cutscene is over, as you’re leaving, look to the right of the doorway to find the Lore Marker - The Ceremony.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Legendary Chest in Vanir Shrine

chapterContent.content: The Legendary Chest is located past the raised bridge you see on the one side in the main area. Look above, at the The Auburn Crown Lore Marker, to see how to lower it. You will see a locked gate in the first area past the bridge, with the chest behind it. Open the gate that leads into the final area in this section, where you will see some Hel’s bramble just right of opening the gate. Burn them with your Blades to reveal a hole in the wall, as well as a runic disc. Destroy it with your axe, which will open that locked gate with the Legendary Chest. Note that there will be an enemy there, so watch out for it when you go back for the chest. Your reward is the Rampage of the Furies Light Runic Attack for the Blades of Chaos.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Vanaheim - The Jungle

chapterContent.content: This page will detail all of the collectibles found in The Jungle area of Vanaheim in God of War Ragnarok.

Vanaheim is one of the nine realms you will visit during the main course of the story, and was the home of Freya. One of the areas of Vanaheim you will explore is called The Jungle, although you won’t be able to visit this place until much later in the game. After finishing the second story trip to Vanaheim, you will have to do a few more things and then, you will have access to The Jungle.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - The Jungle Collectibles Locations in Vanaheim
How to Find The Jungle in Vanaheim

chapterContent.content: First and foremost, progress the main story until you have completed Creatures of Prophecy. When that is over, you will find a hound by one of the exits in Freyr’s Camp, allowing you to start the Favor, Scent of Survival. Doing this Favor will automatically bring you to The Crater section of Vanaheim, where you will end up in The Plains. Once you have control on The Plains, you will need to follow the steps to reach The Jungle, which can be found on the How to Reach The Jungle page. It’s ideal to complete the Return to the River Favor, too, while in The Jungle, as it is needed to get everything there. There’s only a few things that can be gotten without finishing that Favor.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Nornir Chest in The Jungle

chapterContent.content: After restoring water, return to the main area of The Jungle and get a boat. Starting from the shore by the initial gateway (Jungle Entrance), row south, then west when you can, and finally south once more. You should see the Nornir Chest located just a little inland from where you can get on shore. If this is your first time here, you will have to take care of some enemies first (Wulvers and Nokken). This Nornir Chest will require you to hit the devices and turn it to the correct rune.
The first Rune will be to the right of the Nornir Chest, up in the air a little bit. This will be right above the spirit that gives the Casualty of War - The Toy Favor.

Head on over to the Celestial Altar and look to the northeast. You should see some red vines in that direction, just to the left of the Hacksilver chest on the ledge above you. Burn the vines to reveal the Rune underneath it, so all you have to do is change it to the correct one.

Right next to the previous Rune, there is a wall you can climb, putting you on the ledge with the Hacksilver chest. Facing the Celestial Altar, look up and you should see this Rune sitting on top of the structure housing the altar.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Legendary Chests in The Jungle

chapterContent.content: The first Legendary Chest will pretty much be in the way when doing the Trail of the Dead favor. Head to the area with the two Wulvers and the Nornir Chest, which is also where the Celestial Altar is located. Climb the wall by the altar and drop off to the side, where you will come to a bunch of grapple points. Take these to a ledge and opposite of you will be some vines. Use the ceiling to place sigils and burn the vines, then use the grapple points to go across to open the Legendary Chest, with the Whisper of the World Light Runic Attack for the Draupnir Spear being your reward.

First, you need to make sure it’s daytime, so head to the Celestial Altar to change it, if needed. Use your boat to head over to the area with the Ogres, where you should see a grapple point to get across the waters during the day. Follow this trail all the way to a giant footprint, which is also where you can squeeze through a wall nearby it. If this is your first time here, you will start the Path of Destruction Favor. There will be a large hole in the center of this area, so drop down into it to find yourself in a cage.

If you look upwards near where you dropped down, you should see a rotating object you can hit with your axe. Hit it once, then quickly recall your axe and toss it at the runic disc, allowing you to escape this cage. The Legendary Chest will be in the nearby hallway, so open it up for a Jewel of Yggdrasil.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in The Jungle

chapterContent.content: This will be found at the dam, which you will go to when you do the Return of the River Favor. After entering The Jungle, drop off the ledge to the right and go past the poison totem. You will fight some Wulvers here, so defeat them and climb the wall behind them. Keep going on this path, past some more enemies, and burn the vines at the end to reveal a lift that will take you to the dam itself. After defeating the enemies at the dam, you will find the Lore Marker - Unforgiven there, before busting open a wall and passing through it.

This get this Lore, you will first need to turn it day. The Celestial Altar is on the island with the Wulvers and Nornir Chest. After doing that, head over to the area with the Ogres and some large vines will have semi-formed a bridge over the waters. Grapple across and follow the path until you find a large footprint, similar to the others you’ve found in The Jungle. Near that footprint, there will be a spot where you can slide along the wall, bringing you to a lair filled with bones.

In the middle of the lair (the Path of Destruction Favor starts here) is a large hole, so drop down into it to put yourself into a makeshift cage. Just above where you dropped down, there is a rotating wooden thing you can hit with your axe, which raises the cage. Hit it once, then quickly recall the axe and strike the runic disc to keep the cage raised, allowing you to get out of it. After doing that, look on the wall just outside the cage to find the Rune Read.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Artifact in The Jungle

chapterContent.content: This is the first collectible you will find in The Jungle, as it’s pretty much right in your face as you venture to the area. When you go through the tunnel after turning it into night, on the way to the proper part of The Jungle, you will have to climb a wall to overcome a large gap. After getting to the other side of the gap, look in the corner to find the Kvasir’s Poems.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find Odin’s Raven in The Jungle

chapterContent.content: You will likely get this Raven while doing the Trail of the Dead Favor, which is one of the sidequests you will do in The Jungle. After fixing the dam and gaining access to your boat, you will open the rest of The Jungle. One of the things you can do now is get rid of the one Ogre that was throwing boulders at you when you first entered this area, which is also where the Raven is located. To get there, start at the shore where the Jungle Entrance gateway is located, then sail east until you see a dock. Squeeze through the gap here, take care of the Ogres and Nokken, then look above the chest to find the Raven.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Yggdrasil Dew Drop Locations in Vanaheim

chapterContent.content: This page details the location of all Yggdrasil Dew Drops in Vanaheim, including three in the main region, two in The Crater, and one in The Jungle. You won’t be able to access those in The Crater or The Jungle until you’ve completed the Return of the River favor, which brings water back to most of the canyons in both regions, allowing you to use the rowing boat to reach the dew drops.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Yggdrasil Dew Drops in Vanaheim

chapterContent.content: This is likely to be the first Yggdrasil Dew Drop that you encounter in Vanaheim. You’ll find it just west of the Freyr’s Camp Mystical Gateway, as shown on the map below. Your Luck stat will be permanently increased by +2 from this one.

This one can be found at the tip of the river bend located west of the River Delta Mystical Gateway, as shown on the map below. Your Cooldown stat will be permanently increased by +2 for obtaining this dew drop.

You won’t be able to access this one until you’ve completed the Reunion main quest. Upon returning to Vanaheim at this point you’ll find that some new parts of the river have opened up to you, and this is one of them. You can take the boat and row just a bit north of the Freyr’s Camp Mystical Gateway to reach it. This one permanently increases your Runic by +2.

chapterContent.aside: The following Yggdrasil Dew Drops can only be obtained after completing the Return of the River favor in The Jungle, which brings water back to the canyons of both The Crater and The Jungle, allowing you to row on it with the boat.

chapterContent.content: This dew drop can be found opposite the beach in the southeastern part of The Jungle, which is an optional area that serves as an expansion to Vanaheim, and still counts as Vanaheim. Your Defence stat will be permanently increased by +2 from this one.

This one can be found in the northern waters of The Crater region. As with the one in The Jungle, you won’t be able to access it until you’ve completed the Return of the River favor. Your Strength stat will permanently increase by +2 for finding this one.

This one can be found in the southern part of The Sinkholes, which is a subregion of The Crater located in the southeastern part of the map, as shown in the screenshot below. You’ll find it just southwest from the Berserker Gravestone here, and it will permanently increase your Vitality stat by +2.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Midgard - Lake of Nine

chapterContent.content: This page will reveal the location of every collectible in the Lake of Nine, a region of Midgard in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - Lake of Nine Collectibles Locations in Midgard
How to Find the Lake of Nine

chapterContent.content: Just like in the last game, the Lake of Nine is the hub area of Midgard. While you’ll visit this area early on with Atreus, it won’t be explorable in any meaningful sense until you’re midway through the game. You’ll come here during the main quest The Word of Fate, where you’ll finally be able to properly explore the Lake of Nine - and its numerous side areas - more thoroughly.

Around a third of all the collectibles in Midgard can be found in the Lake of Nine, but even this is underselling how central this location is, as many subregions with their own collectibles are encompassed by or peripheral to the Lake of Nine. Tyr’s Temple, while not all that interesting on its own, serves as a fine landmark which will be used to help find collectibles and subregions in the Lake of Nine.

Note that the transitions between some of the subregions and the Lake of Nine can be - aside from the text that pops up when you cross between one region and another - somewhat subtle. Moving the cursor on the map over the text for various regions will list different collectibles, and that’s how they’ll be organized in this guide, even if some subregions only have one or two collectibles.

It’s also worth noting that three of the collectibles in the Lake of Nine are requirements for the favor [Guiding Light], while the Remnants of Asgard collectible cannot be completed until you reach the main quest Beyond Ragnarok. Other collectibles may require progress in different main quests - anything that requires the Draupnir Spear can’t be obtained until after Forging Destiny, for example.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Loot Lizards in the Lake of Nine

chapterContent.content: Northwest of the Raider Fort area you’ll find a chunk of ice that can be destroyed with the Draupnir Spear. If you don’t possess this, you’ll have to return after completing Forging Destiny.

Destroy the ice chunk, climb up the ledge beyond it, then follow the linear path ahead to find the Loot Lizard standing right in front of you. You can’t flank this one, but if you look up you’ll find a fire pot hanging above it. Strike the target with the Draupnir Spear or Leviathan Axe to drop the fire pot on the hapless reptile, then loot it.

chapterContent.aside: The Buried Treasure - Demise of Dagestr is found pretty much right where the Loot Lizard was located.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Midgard - Raider Fort

chapterContent.content: This page will reveal the location of every collectible in the Raider Fort, a region of Midgard in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - Raider Fort Collectibles Locations in Midgard
How to Find the Raider Fort

chapterContent.content: The Raider Fort location is an island in the Lake of Nine, in Midgard. While you’ll travel to Midgard a few times early in the game, you won’t really get the opportunity to explore it properly until the main quest The Word of Fate. After this point, any time you’re free to explore you can return to Midgard and seek out collectibles.

Midgard was always centered around the Lake of Nine, but in God of War Ragnarok this trend is reinforced. Around a third of the collectibles in Midgard can be found in the Lake of Nine region, which is underselling how central this location is, as many subregions with their own collectibles are encompassed by or peripheral to the Lake of Nine. The Raider Fort is a prime example, being a small area located along the northwestern end of the Lake of Nine (northwest of Tyr’s Temple).

The Raider Fort is, as its name implies, occupied by Kol Raiders, these ones being particularly fond of fire. Once you kill them you’ll start the favor Animal Instincts, which tasks you with eliminating four Kol Raider camps, including The Raider Fort. Unlike most favors, Animal Instincts doesn’t count as a collectible… It counts as four, with each raider camp being its own separate collectible. Merely clearing the Kol Raiders out from the Raider Fort is sufficient to complete one of the two collectibles for this region.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Lore in the Raider Fort

chapterContent.content: Other than the Kol Raider Camp collectible - which you’ll obtain simply by killing the Kol Raiders occupying the Raider Fort (pretty much a precondition for searching this area) - you can find one Lore collectible. Kill the Kor Raiders, then search the western end of their camp to find the Treasure Map - Vikings Gift lying on the ground.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Collectibles in Midgard - Well of Urd

chapterContent.content: This page will reveal the location of every collectible in the Well of Urd, a region of Midgard in God of War Ragnarok.

chapterContent.head: God of War Ragnarok - Well of Urd Collectibles Locations in Midgard
How to Find the Well of Urd

chapterContent.content: You’ll first pass through the Well of Urd - a location in Midgard - during the main quest The Word of Fate. During this obligatory story trip you can get most of the collectibles, but you’ll have to return to complete the Hel Tears and the Remnants of Asgard, which unlock during the main quests Reunion and Beyond Ragnarok, respectively.

The Well of Urd is northwest of the Lake of Nine; from a Mystic Gateway (where a dwarven shop is also located) just follow a ravine to the northwest. Climb up a ledge to the west and, assuming Beyond Ragnarok is the active main quest, you’ll encounter the Einherjar who make up the Remnants of Asgard collectible, which includes an Einherjar Rider and its Gradungr mount. If you failed to reach the other collectibles in this area, this encounter will be mandatory to continue. Once the Einherjar are dead you’ll need to use the Blades of Chaos to pull down an obstruction, after which you can climb up a second ledge to the west.

Continue west and you’ll find some cliffs you can ascend with the Blades of Chaos. Do so, climb a ledge, squeeze through a gap between two rocks to the west, the continue northwest to find a cliff you can climb - something you’ll need to do if you want to obtain the Legendary Chest and/or Odin’s Raven. If you’re at or past the main quest Reunion, a Hel Tear will be blocking your way, forcing you to fight some Hel-Reavers to close the rift. Once the rift is closed you can access the cliffs and reach the rest of the collectibles.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Nornir Chests in the Well of Urd

chapterContent.content: As you continue west through the Well of Urd you’ll eventually reach a dead end, which you can only bypass by using the Blades of Chaos to swing between some cliffs, ultimately reaching a higher ledge. To the west of this cliff you’ll find an alcove where a Nornir chest hides. Although the chest is at the bottom of the cliffs, two of the braziers you need to light require you to ascend the cliffs, so you must clear the Hel Tear if you want to finish this Nornir Chest… assuming you didn’t open it before the main quest Reunion, ideally during your mandatory visit during the main quest The Word of Fate.
This is a surprisingly simple Nornir Chest puzzle to solve - you just need to light three braziers, and all three can be directly lit with the Blades of Chaos. Their locations are below:

chapterContent.li: Rune 1: From the Nornir Chest turn east and look up - you’ll spot the brazier on a ledge, within easy reach of the Blades of Chaos.
Rune 2: Climb the cliffs to the east of the Nornir Chest and when you reach top, ascend a ledge to the west, then turn south to find a brazier on a ledge along the southern cliffs.
Rune 3: From the second brazier, turn east and drop down a ledge. When you land, look up to the east, northeast to find this brazier on a ledge.
