articleData.chapterTitle_bc: How to Get the Nidavellir Finest Armor Set

chapterContent.content: This page details everything you need to know about how to get the Nidavellir Armor Set by completing the In Service of Asgard favor, and how the perks and stats of this armor compare with others, including what it costs to level up the armor and the stat boosts that you acquire by doing so.

chapterContent.head: How to Get the Ore for Nidavellir’s Finest Armor Set

chapterContent.content: “Traditional Dwarven armor. Built with Nidavellir Ore acquired from the mining rigs in Svartalfheim’s Bay of Bounty. The craftsmanship is unparalleled, and increases the wearer’s Vitality.”

As the description suggests, the only way to acquire this armor is by first completing the In Service of Asgard favor in the Bay of Bounty in Svartalfheim. At the end of this favor you will have a total of 6 Nidavellir ore, which is enough to craft the entire set with 2 ore per piece. You obtain this ore by looting the contents that each mining rig spits out, so be sure to collect these. If you think you’ve missed anything, you can loot the blue chest next to Brok or Sindri’s shop, where the ore will be stored as something you’ve missed, so long as you’ve shut down all the mines. Once you have all the ore, you can visit Brok or Sindri’s shop to craft the armor.

chapterContent.head: Nidavellir - Best Early Game Armor Set in God of War Ragnarok?

chapterContent.content: The Nidavellir’s Finest Armor Set is a good contender as being one of the best to use in the early game for God of War Ragnarok. It’s crafted at level 2 by default, and it can be upgraded to acquire some useful perks, shown in the table below.

The Plackart perk is particularly useful since it provides you with a persistent extra heal so long as you can consistently stun lock enemies. To increase your chances of doing this, combine arrow shots from Atreus with quick melee strikes from Kratos. You can also use your bare hands for fighting which inflict more stun damage than your Leviathan Axe or Blades of Chaos on some enemies. The health burst will give you an initial burst of health, but it will also heal you over time for about 8 seconds.

The perk for the Arm Guards and Waist Guard complements the perk for the Plackart, since it provides you with more time to press  to execute a stun grab and heal yourself. The perk basically means that the stun bar will remain filled for a slightly longer period of time, so you don’t have to worry as much about not being fast enough to reach the enemy to execute the stun grab and heal yourself.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: How to Get Lunda's Armor Set

chapterContent.content: This page will tell you everything you need to know about Lunda’s armor set in God of War Ragnarok, including where to find all three pieces of this armor set, its stats, and the best builds involving it.

During the main quest The Reckoning you’ll be introduced to the rather licentious dwarf, Lunda. After the aforementioned main quest you’ll be free to explore the western half of Vanaheim, notably its riverlands, where you can find the three pieces of this armor set stashed in various chests. These armor pieces have seen better days, and you’ll need to bring them to Lunda for repairs before you can actually use them:
That said, you don’t need to expend any resources to bring this broken armor into a usable state, and each piece is Lv5, so it’s likely to be more powerful than whatever you’re wearing, stats aside.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find Lunda’s Broken Bracers

chapterContent.content: You can find Lunda’s Broken Bracers at the Cliffside Ruins. Land at the beach and defeat the Revenant and her retinue of Nightmares, then from the beach head south to find some ruins you can climb to the east. When you reach the top, turn northeast, head under some ruins, then turn left (north) to find a room full of bursting plants. Pop them from a distance, then loot the chest inside to obtain this armor piece.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find Lunda’s Lost Belt

chapterContent.content: Lunda’s Lost Belt can be found in the Noatun’s Garden area. Kill the Gulons and Gradungr when you land, then make your way east to a chisel-seal between the poison of two Scorn Poles. Since Freya enchanted your chisel you should be able to open the seal - and the door beyond - to find a chest. This armor piece is inside.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find Lunda’s Lost Cuirass

chapterContent.content: Sail to The Veiled Passage, which requires you to solve a bramble puzzle at the Cliffside Ruins to lower a chain, after which you can climb up and - with Freya’s help - open the way. There are two beaches you can land at that count as part of The Veiled Passage - skip the first to the right (east) and keep sailing north to land at the second beach. Continue north past a rock to find a chest in an alcove, where you’ll find a chest containing this armor piece.

chapterContent.head: Best Lunda’s Armor Build

chapterContent.content: Once you’ve found all three pieces of Lunda’s armor, repair it by taking it to Brok/Sindri and you’ll be able to equip it. At a base Lv5 it’ll probably be stronger than anything else you have when you get it, but the real allure of this armor is its stats:

chapterContent.li: Vanir Poison: Bare-Handed attacks, Parrying, and Blocking have a High LUCK chance to deal bonus damage and Poison enemies, lowering their Power Level.
Prey Upon Poison: Melee Attacks against Poisoned enemies do +20% increase damage.

chapterContent.content: The utility and synergy of these two attacks should be pretty obvious - you hit enemies with your fists to inflict Poison (in many cases, a few strikes should suffice) and the enemy’s Power Level will be reduced, making your foe much less dangerous. The belt and bracers, meanwhile, will both boost your damage against poisoned enemies by +20%. Inflict Poison and you can switch to another weapon to enjoy the damage boost, but the duration of your Poison debuff won’t last long, so don’t expect to get more than one combo out. Still, the damage you can inflict in a short time can be awfully impressive.

In addition to inflicting Poison, unarmed strikes also inflict a high amount of Stun. If you pair Lunda’s armor with Vanaheim enchantments (Increases Kratos’ Melee damage against Status-Afflicted enemies based on his LUCK) and Svartalfheim enchantments (Increases Stun damage inflicted based on Kratos’ DEFENSE) you’ll further increase the Stun damage and normal damage as you attack enemies. Equip Leviathan Axe grips, Blade attachments and Spear attachments that proc bonus effects when you Stun Grab enemies and you’ll have a decent stun damage/stun grab/poison synergy build going.

This build excels against most enemies in the game, especially weaker foes and minibosses. Against the strongest enemies in the game, foes who are resistant to stun damage, and flighty enemies you can’t chain decent combos on, however, you may want to seek a different build. That said, Lunda’s armor and the aforementioned enchantments and accessories will easily get you through most of the game.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: How to Make the Dragon Scaled Armor

chapterContent.content: One of the best armors in God of War Ragnarok is the Dragon Scaled Armor. Obtained by defeating the various dragons in, and around the optional Crater areas in Vanaheim. This page will show you what Dragon Scales are used for, how to get them, and how many you need to obtain, and fully upgrade the Dragon Scaled Armor.

chapterContent.head: How to Find the Dragon Scaled Armor

chapterContent.content: To be able to start crafting the armor set, you’ll need to finish the story mission “Creatures of Prophecy”. This will unlock the optional area The Crater which hosts many sub-areas including, The Jungle, The Plains, and The Sinkholes. After completing the above story quest, you’ll find yourself back at Freyr’s camp. Once all the chatter is over with, take the west exit out of Freyr’s camp, and you’ll find a hound called Helka waiting for you. Atreus with his love for nature suggests that you follow the hound as it appears that it’s picked up a scent. This will start the Scent of Survival Favor which you’ll need to complete before you can start crafting the armor as it’ll lead you to The Crater.

chapterContent.head: Crafting the Dragon Scaled Armor

chapterContent.content: Now that you have access to The Crater, head over to The Plains sub-area to the west, and look for the Blacksmith Shop there. When you look at what you can craft, the Dragon Scaled Armor will be there. Here is what you need to craft the whole armor set:

chapterContent.head: Where to get Dragon Scaled Armor Materials

chapterContent.content: As you can see above, you’ll need quite a few materials in order to craft, and max out the Dragon Scaled Armor Set. If you’re wondering where you can get your hands on these materials, check the list below.

You’ll find Dragon Tooth an easy resource to acquire as they are dropped by any fallen dragon, drake or dreki. You can find drakes, and dreki all over the nine realm including, but not limited to Vanaheim, and The Crater. Dragon’s on the other hand are a little harder to come by.

These are more difficult to find as these are more commonly dropped by dragons, although you can get them from drake, and dreki. The best way to get the 12 dragon claws that you need for the set is to complete all the Dragon Hunts in The Crater areas. There are seven hunts in total, but some of them have multiple drakes or dreki which should put you at, or at least near the 12 that you need. You can find the Dragons Hunts by completing their respective Favors which are:

chapterContent.li: Trail of the Dead (The Jungle)
What Lies Below (The Jungle)
Path of Destruction (The Jungle)
The Burning Skies (The Sinkholes)
Quaking Hollow (The Sinkholes)
For Vanaheim! (The Plains)
In the Dead of Night (The Plains)

chapterContent.content: This material is actually a currency, which can only be obtained by participating in The Crucible Trials in Muspelheim. Unfortunately there isn’t any other way of obtaining them. The best way for you to get them is by completing the first couple of trials from each challenge sword. You can find out more about The Crucible, and how to complete the trials here.

These are a relatively easy resource to get your hands on. You get them by trading crystal fragments which are scattered throughout The Crater region to the Wishing Well. This can be reached from either The Jungle or The Sinkholes. Trading these fragments can net you some nice loot including, Hacksilver, Purified Crystalline, and other various goodies. The more you trade, the more you’ll get.

Once again, the only place to get these rare resources is from the Muspelheim Trials in The Crucible. Thankfully, these can be repeated to your heart’s content, so you can find the one you find the easiest, and repeat that specific trial.
A lot of The Crater Favors will yield a lot of Hacksilver, and if that isn’t enough, you can trade yellow crystal fragments to the Wishing Well for even more.

chapterContent.head: What are the Dragon Scaled Armor Set Stats and Perks

chapterContent.content: Here is a list of the stats of the Dragon Scaled Armor at base level, and fully upgraded. Use this list to decide if you want to go through the trouble of obtaining, and upgrading this armor set.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: How to Get the Radiance Armor Set

chapterContent.content: One of the best armors in God of War Ragnarok is the Radiance Armor Set. Obtained by defeating three specific Berserker Gravestones with one of them being only available in post-game. The Radiance Armor Set offers predominantly the Strength and Defense attributes, and the perk allows you to Realm Shift after a last-second dodge.

chapterContent.head: How to Find the Radiance Armor

chapterContent.content: You can get this set relatively early in the game. It becomes available to you after you unlock the optional area The Barrens in Alfheim. The first piece will come from completing the Favor “Secret of the Sands”. Not only will that reward you with a piece of armor, but it’ll clear the sandstorm that’s obscuring your vision there. This will make the other two pieces easier to find as you’ll be able to see where you’re going.

The second piece can be found in a Legendary Chest under the gazebo in the northwest of The Barrens. When you get there, you’ll have to defeat several Dark Elves including a Dark Lord, so be prepared. Once they’re defeated, head to the left side of the gazebo to find the chest containing the Gauntlets of Radiance.

The final piece can be found in the far east of The Barrens where the large skeleton is. Once again, this area will be surrounded by many enemies. Defeat The enemies, and climb the ledge to reach a Legendary Chest containing the Belt of Radiance.

chapterContent.head: Radiance Armor Upgrade Materials

chapterContent.content: Once you’ve obtained your armor, you can upgrade it in any of the Blacksmiths scattered around the realms. Head over to your nearest workbench to see what you need to upgrade it or check out the list below.

chapterContent.head: Where to get Radiance Armor Materials

chapterContent.content: As you can see above, you’ll need quite a few materials in order to craft, and max out the Radiance Armor Set. If you’re wondering where you can get your hands on these materials, check the list below.

Mainly found in the late-game area coffers, and treasure chests. The best way to get this rare resource is by using the Wishing Well in The Crater region in Vanaheim. Break the amber-colored ore around The Crater, and when you have a few, head to the Wishing Well, and toss them in it to get the ingots as well as other materials, and Hacksilver.
You can get Tempered Remnants as a reward from defeating the Berserker’s in the Berserker Gravestones. They’ll normally drop around 2-5 when defeated.

Similar to a lot of the rarer resources. The best way to get these are by using the Wishing Well in The Crater region in Vanaheim. Break the amber-colored ore around The Crater, and when you have a few, head to the Wishing Well, and toss them in it to get the ingots as well as other materials, and Hacksilver.

These are a relatively easy resource to get your hands on. You get them by trading crystal fragments which are scattered throughout The Crater region to the Wishing Well. This can be reached from either The Jungle or The Sinkholes. Trading these fragments can net you some nice loot including, Hacksilver, Purified Crystalline, and other various goodies. The more you trade, the more you’ll get.

The only place to get these rare resources is from the Muspelheim Trials in The Crucible. Thankfully, these can be repeated to your heart’s content, so you can find the one you find the easiest, and repeat that specific trial.
A lot of The Crater Favors will yield a lot of Hacksilver, and if that isn’t enough, you can trade yellow crystal fragments to the Wishing Well for even more.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: How to Get the Berserker Armor Set

chapterContent.content: One of the best armors in God of War Ragnarok is the Berserker Armor. Obtained by defeating three specific Berserker Gravestones with one of them being only available in post-game. The Berserker armor offers a wide range of attributes, and the perk will raise your attack at the cost of your defense whenever a Relic attack is used.

chapterContent.head: How to Find the Berserker Armor

chapterContent.content: Before you’re able to start crafting the armor set, you’ll need to be able to activate the Berserker Gravestones. For this, you’ll need the key-item Hilt of Skofnung which you’ll acquire during the story mission “The Word of Fate”. Once you have the hilt, you’ll be able to activate the gravestone to fight one of the Berserker bosses. There are 10 gravestones, and three of them will give you the option to craft the Berserker Armor. The three you need to defeat are:

chapterContent.li: The Barrens, Alfheim - This will have you face off against Svipdagr the Cold, and the Sisters of Illska. This is probably the toughest Berserker fight other than the King. Completing this gravestone will unlock the Berserker Cuirass.
Lake of Nine, Midgard - This will have you battle Fraekni the Zealous. Completing this gravestone will unlock the Berserker Waist Guard.

Mist Fields, Niflheim - This will have you face Skjothendi the Unerring. You can only gain access to this gravestone after finishing the main story as it’s in a part of Niflheim that you can’t reach until then. Completing this gravestone will unlock the Berserker Gauntlets.

chapterContent.head: Berserker Armor Upgrade Materials

chapterContent.content: After defeating the above Berserker’s, head to any Blacksmith workstation to find the Berserker Set ready to be crafted. Here is what you need to craft the whole armor set:

chapterContent.head: Where to get Berserker Armor Materials

chapterContent.content: As you can see above, you’ll need quite a few materials in order to craft, and max out the Dragon Scaled Armor Set. If you’re wondering where you can get your hands on these materials, check the list below.

Mainly found in the late-game area coffers, and treasure chests. The best way to get this rare resource is by using the Wishing Well in The Crater region in Vanaheim. Break the amber-colored ore around The Crater, and when you have a few, head to the Wishing Well, and toss them in it to get the ingots as well as other materials, and Hacksilver.
You can get Tempered Remnants as a reward from defeating the Berserker’s in the Berserker Gravestones. They’ll normally drop around 2-5 when defeated.

Similar to a lot of the rarer resources. The best way to get these are by using the Wishing Well in The Crater region in Vanaheim. Break the amber-colored ore around The Crater, and when you have a few, head to the Wishing Well, and toss them in it to get the ingots as well as other materials, and Hacksilver.

These are a relatively easy resource to get your hands on. You get them by trading crystal fragments which are scattered throughout The Crater region to the Wishing Well. This can be reached from either The Jungle or The Sinkholes. Trading these fragments can net you some nice loot including, Hacksilver, Purified Crystalline, and other various goodies. The more you trade, the more you’ll get.

The only place to get these rare resources is from the Muspelheim Trials in The Crucible. Thankfully, these can be repeated to your heart’s content, so you can find the one you find the easiest, and repeat that specific trial.
A lot of The Crater Favors will yield a lot of Hacksilver, and if that isn’t enough, you can trade yellow crystal fragments to the Wishing Well for even more.

chapterContent.content: Here is a list of the stats of the Berserker Armor at base level, and fully upgraded. Use this list to decide if you want to go through the trouble of obtaining, and upgrading this armor set.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: How to Get the Hunter's Armor

chapterContent.content: Do you fancy playing a runic-focused ranged build in God of War Ragnarok? Well, if the answer is a yes, the Hunter’s Armor has you covered. Obtained by completing three Favors in the optional The Crater region in Vanaheim which is only available after completing the “Creatures of Prophecy” story mission.

chapterContent.head: How to Find the Hunter’s Armor

chapterContent.content: To be able to start crafting the armor set, you’ll need to finish the story mission “Creatures of Prophecy”. This will unlock the optional area The Crater which hosts many sub-areas including, The Jungle, The Plains, and The Sinkholes. After completing the above story quest, you’ll find yourself back at Freyr’s camp. Once all the chatter is over with, take the west exit out of Freyr’s camp, and you’ll find a hound called Helka waiting for you. Atreus with his love for nature suggests that you follow the hound as it appears that it’s picked up a scent. This will start the Scent of Survival Favor which you’ll need to complete before you can start crafting the armor as it’ll lead you to The Crater.

Now that you have access to The Crater, you can get a few Favors. All of which offer some nice rewards, but for the sake of the Hunter’s Armor, you’ll want to complete the following Favors as each of these reward a Hunter’s Brand which is needed to craft the set:

chapterContent.li: In Plain Sight - This Favor can be found in The Plains sub-area of The Crater. You’ll need to defeat a Soul Eater at the end of this Favor.
Nocturnal Predator - This Favor is unlocked by talking to Ratatoskr at Sindri’s House after you have access to The Crater. You’ll need to defeat a Flame Phantom at the end of this Favor.
The Untamed Fury - The Final Favor is an odd one. You’ll fight a Huntress at five different locations in, and around The Crater. You can find the locations here.

chapterContent.head: Crafting the Hunter’s Armor

chapterContent.content: With all the Hunter’s Brands in your pocket head to the nearest Blacksmith Shop. When you look at what you can craft, the Hunter’s Armor will be there. Here is what you need to craft the whole armor set:

chapterContent.head: Where to get Hunter’s Armor Materials

chapterContent.content: As you can see above, you’ll need quite a few materials in order to craft, and max out the Dragon Scaled Armor Set. If you’re wondering where you can get your hands on these materials, check the list below.
You can get Tempered Remnants as a reward from defeating the Berserker’s in the Berserker Gravestones. They’ll normally drop around 2-5 when defeated.

Similar to a lot of the rarer resources. The best way to get these are by using the Wishing Well in The Crater region in Vanaheim. Break the amber-colored ore around The Crater, and when you have a few, head to the Wishing Well, and toss them in it to get the ingots as well as other materials, and Hacksilver.

Although you can get this resource from coffers, and treasure chests, your best bet is to defeat bosses that’ll drop them. You should get a lot of what you need from The Untamed Fury Favor you’ll need to complete to craft the armor in the first place. This is due to having to fight a Huntress which will drop some when defeated. You can also get some as a drop from some Berserker Bosses as well as other bosses/minibosses.

This material is actually a currency, which can only be obtained by participating in The Crucible Trials in Muspelheim. Unfortunately there isn’t any other way of obtaining them. The best way for you to get them is by completing the first couple of trials from each challenge sword. You can find out more about The Crucible, and how to complete the trials here.

These are a relatively easy resource to get your hands on. You get them by trading crystal fragments which are scattered throughout The Crater region to the Wishing Well. This can be reached from either The Jungle or The Sinkholes. Trading these fragments can net you some nice loot including, Hacksilver, Purified Crystalline, and other various goodies. The more you trade, the more you’ll get.

Once again, the only place to get these rare resources is from the Muspelheim Trials in The Crucible. Thankfully, these can be repeated to your heart’s content, so you can find the one you find the easiest, and repeat that specific trial.
A lot of The Crater Favors will yield a lot of Hacksilver, and if that isn’t enough, you can trade yellow crystal fragments to the Wishing Well for even more.

chapterContent.head: What are the Hunter’s Armor Set Stats and Perks

chapterContent.content: Here is a list of the stats of the Hunter’s Armor at base level, and fully upgraded. Use this list to decide if you want to go through the trouble of obtaining, and upgrading this armor set.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Best Amulet of Yggdrasil Enchantments And Upgrades

chapterContent.content: The Amulet of Yggdrasil is another new feature to God of War Ragnarök, giving you another way to power up Kratos’ arsenal. Obtained after completing the main mission “The Reckoning”, the amulet will offer you ways to add small buffs to your current build by placing Enchantments on it. These either come as individual enchantments or part of a set where you’ll need three of the same kind to unlock the perk.

Not only do they offer you perks, but you’ll also get attribute upgrades from them as well, as each individual enchantment will have different stats. When you first receive the Amulet, you won’t be able to do much due to seven of the nine slots where you place the enchantments are locked. On this page, we’ll explain where you can get every enchantment, what they do, and what we think are the best.

chapterContent.head: How to Unlock the Amulet of Yggdrasil

chapterContent.content: As mentioned above, you’ll need to progress the story until you finish the mission “The Reckoning”. This is in Vanaheim, and at the end of the mission, you’ll have to fight a boss. Upon defeating said boss, Kratos will collect the Amulet, and place it into his pocket.

chapterContent.head: How to Unlock Amulet Enchantment Slots

chapterContent.content: Once you’ve received the Amulet, you may feel a little underwhelmed at what you can do with it right now. Thankfully, this unlocks more as you progress through the game, and unlock more slots. There are nine slots in total, but seven of these will be locked to you at the start. So, how do you unlock more slots you may ask? Well, you’ll need items called Jewels of Yggdrasil which can be obtained by defeating specific story bosses or opening specific Legendary Chests. There are seven Jewels of Yggdrasil in total, two from bosses, and five from chests. If you want to know where to get all seven Jewels of Yggdrasil, check out our Jewels of Yggdrasil page.

chapterContent.head: How do Enchantments and Perks Work

chapterContent.content: Each enchantment requires one slot, and to unlock a set perk, you’ll need three enchantments equipped from that specific set. There are 10 sets in the game named after the realms, and six individual enchantments that come with their own perk, and don’t need to be a part of a set. Each perk will boost certain play styles like increasing melee damage, increasing stun damage, bolstering specific skills, and some even boost movement speed! Furthermore, each individual enchantment will give you a generous boost to your attributes.

chapterContent.head: All Amulet of Yggdrasil Enchantments

chapterContent.content: Here you’ll find a list of all the possible Enchantments in the game, and where you can get them.

chapterContent.aside: More Enchantments will be added to the list as they are found. These lists will contain various spoilers such as boss names, and locations. Read at your own peril.

chapterContent.content: All of these Enchantments are part of a set. You’ll need three of the same set to activate the set bonus.

These Enchantments are not part of a set, but offer you stronger perks to make up for it. The majority of these require you to meet a Stat Requirement to activate the perk. This is a balancing mechanic, so you can’t have all of these really powerful enchantments at once.

chapterContent.head: The Best Enchantments in God of War Ragnarok

chapterContent.aside: This list is more for a general build, some other enchantments are great, but only for specific setups.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Where to Find Jewels of Yggdrasil to Unlock Amulet Slots

chapterContent.content: When you get the Amulet for the first time in God of War Ragnarok, you’ll notice that seven out of the nine slots are broken, and need to be repaired. You may be wondering how to unlock these slots, well have no fear, this page will tell you exactly how to do that, and where to find them.

chapterContent.head: Unlocking Amulet Slots

chapterContent.content: As mentioned above, there are seven slots that can be unlocked/repaired, and to do this, you’ll need an item called “Jewel of Yggdrasil”. There are seven in total to get, and you’ll get them through Legendary Chests, and some story bosses. The reason you want to unlock these slots is so you can have more Enchantments added to your amulet thus making Kratos stronger. You can find out what Enchantments you can put into the amulet here.

chapterContent.head: Jewels of Yggdrasil

chapterContent.content: In the list below, we’ll show you where to get every Jewel of Yggdrasil in chronological order.

chapterContent.aside: This list will contain some spoilers as two of the jewels are from defeating story bosses. Read at your own peril.

chapterContent.head: Jewel of Yggdrasil 1 – The Word of Fate

chapterContent.content: You’ll obtain this Jewel by defeating the Frost Phantom about a quarter of the way through the story mission “The Word of Fate”. If you forgot to pick it up from the boss, it’ll be placed in the Blacksmith Chest among any other items that you failed to pick up.

chapterContent.head: Jewel of Yggdrasil 2 – Forging Destiny

chapterContent.content: Another Jewel from a story boss. This time it’ll be from one of the two Ogre’s that you’ll encounter near the end of the story mission “Forging Destiny”. Once again, if you forget to pick it up from the boss, it’ll be placed in the Blacksmith Chest among any other items that you failed to pick up.

chapterContent.head: Jewel of Yggdrasil 3 – The Forgotten Sands, Alfheim

chapterContent.content: Found inside a Legendary Chest in The Forgotten Sands sub-area in Alfheim. This area becomes available after you complete the story mission “The Reckoning”. Speak to the Light, and Dark Elf in Freyr’s Camp to get the Favor “The Elven Sanctum”. This will lead you to the Sanctum where the chest resides. Once you’re inside the Sanctum, progress until you make it into the room with tables, and chairs. Turn your camera to the west, and grapple up to the ledge. The chest will be behind the tree in the middle.

chapterContent.head: Jewel of Yggdrasil 4 - Noatunn’s Garden, Vanaheim

chapterContent.content: This Jewel can be found in Noatunn’s Garden in Vanaheim. The easiest way to get there is from the Delta River Mysterious Gate, and follow the river east. When you reach the garden, kill the enemies in the area, and then look at the small ruin to the northwest of the area, near where you docked. The Legendary Chest can be found inside there, but you’ll need to find a way to open it. Go to the right side of the building, and there will be a small metal window. If you look closely, you should spot a blue lock covered in vines. With a combination of Freya’s Hex Arrows, and your Blades of Chaos to rid the vines to open the door. With it open, head inside to get the Jewel of Life from the chest.

chapterContent.head: Jewel of Yggdrasil 5 – The Oarsmen, Midgard

chapterContent.content: You can find this Jewel inside a Legendary Chest in The Oarsmen situated in the north of the Lake of Nine in Midgard. You’ll need to interact with the large chains to advance through the area. Once you make it to The Oarsmen area, follow the linear paths until you go down the stairs into the building. There will be several Raiders in here, so be careful. When they’re taken care of, you should notice a Nornir (rune) Chest right in front of you, and the Legendary Chest will be past the gate next to it. Unfortunately, you’ll need to go the long way round to reach it.

Climb up the northern ledge to the left of the Nornir Chest, and then the wall to your east. As you reach the top, you’ll have a boss of sorts, and you may recognize them. It’s The Huntress boss from earlier, but this time she comes with a few friends. Focus on the “friends” first while always keeping an eye on what The Huntress is doing. Once she’s been defeated, climb the golden chain hanging from the top of the icy southern wall, follow the linear path, and drop to the floor below.

Here you’ll see the large chains mentioned earlier, interact with them to move them, and then turn around and break the wooden barrier by grappling onto it behind you. Go through the passage, take a right, and go down the stairs into the building. Once again, you’ll have some enemies, but this time in the form of Wisps, simply stun them with Freya’s Sonic arrows, and attack them after. Now that they’ve been taken care of, you can unlock the Legendary Chest on the right for the Jewel of Yggdrasil. Don’t forget to pick up the other half of the Fjoturlund Vault Key by the bird statue opposite it while you’re down there.

chapterContent.head: Jewel of Yggdrasil 6 - Alberich Hollow, Svartalfheim

chapterContent.content: Inside a Legendary Chest in Alberich Hollow. It’ll be part of the reward for completing “The Lost Treasure” Favor which can be started on Dragon Beach by talking to the Wayfarer Spirit. You will need the Draupnir Spear to reach the area of the quest. Follow the quest to its end, and you’ll have to fight a grim boss called “Ormstunga”. Once you defeat it, the chest will be at the back.

chapterContent.head: Jewel of Yggdrasil 7 – The Jungle, Vanaheim

chapterContent.content: This one can’t be accessed until you reach the story mission “Creatures of Prophecy”. When you leave Freyr’s Camp, you’ll automatically receive the Favor “Scent of Survival”. You’ll need to complete this Favor to gain access to The Crater. As you need to get to The Jungle, you’ll need to make your way south of The Crater by completing the various puzzles on the way. Once you’re in the Jungle, you’ll need to head west from the Mystic Gateway. Keep heading west until you can drop into a Dragon Pit, which is where you can accept the Favor “Path of Destruction”. In the hole, complete the simple chain puzzle to find the Legendary Chest.
Now that you have all slots unlocked you may want to know what enchantments you can put in there? Well, head to our Best Amulet Enchantments page now!

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: All Relics and Sword Hilts in GoWR

chapterContent.content: This page details the location of all 14 Relics and Sword Hilts that can be found in God of War: Ragnarok. We’ll cover what each Relic or Sword Hilt does, and how to obtain it.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find All Relics and Sword Hilts in God of War Ragnarok

chapterContent.content: There are a total of 14 Relics and Sword Hilts in God of War: Ragnarok, but not all of them can be acquired early on. You may be confused about the difference between Relics and Sword Hilts, but they are essentially both the same thing with different naming conventions. Both are used in the same way by holding  and pressing  once you have one equipped, and each Relic or Sword Hilt will provide a different kind of buff or effect.

chapterContent.aside: Almost all of the Relics and Sword Hilts listed here can be upgraded to tier III using XP from Kratos. Upgrading each one will enhance its power in different ways according to the primary effects of the Relic or Sword Hilt.

chapterContent.content: You’ll notice from the table below that a number of the Relics and Sword Hilts are acquired from the world by going through the story or defeating specific enemies. However, some will need to be crafted by Brok or Sindri at one of their shops, and you’ll need some Hacksilver for this. You will also need specific Lore Scrolls which are mentioned in the location where relevant below, which act as recipes so that the items appear in the shop for crafting.

chapterContent.head: Best Relics and Sword Hilts in God of War Ragnarok?

chapterContent.content: As you can see from the table above, there are quite a few Relics and Sword Hilts to choose from, especially considering that you can only use one at a time. However, you will acquire most of these gradually throughout the game, rather than all in a short space of time. This means that you’ll likely keep using the same one or two for the early game before gradually introducing new finds.

In terms of the best early game Relic or Sword Hilt, we’d recommend using the Hilt of Gram. The burst of rage is potentially useful in any situation, but it’s the stun damage that makes this one most useful. You can use this to briefly knock back or interrupt multiple enemies if you’re overwhelmed or trapped in a corner, giving you a chance to retaliate or regain some footing elsewhere. The can also interrupt most boss attacks, including unblockable ones, if you time the use of the Hilt of Gram properly. This can be extremely useful if you need to interrupt one of the more powerful attacks from a boss, especially if you use it early on so that you have an opportunity to use it again later in the fight.

chapterContent.aside: It’s worth noting that you should always try using any new Relic or Sword Hilt that you come across, if only to test the utility of it during a fight. You may find yourself surprised by how effective some of the abilities granted by them can be, especially those which inflict stun damage when you use them against powerful enemies. Stunning an enemy will almost always give you some free hits while you don’t need to worry about them retaliating.

chapterContent.content: You’ll notice that many of the other Relics and Hilts directly inflict damage in some form, such as the Hilt of Ridill’s electric shock damage or the hazardous poison explosions with the Hilt of Dainsleif. Most of the mid to late game Relics and Sword Hilts are intended to provide powerful destructive abilities, which you may choose according to your own preference. However, there are some such as the Hilt of Forsbrandr which provide more of a defensive ability, pushing enemies back and granting an aura of protection for a few seconds.

All of these will perform well in fights, but if you’re looking for a Relic that will inflict as much stun damage as possible, given how important it is to inflict this type of damage in almost any fight, it’s difficult to beat Motsognir’s Call. However, keep in mind that this can only be acquired near the end of the story, but it’s still worth using against any side content enemies or bosses that you might be struggling with.

chapterContent.head: Talisman of Meign

chapterContent.content: It’s impossible to miss this Relic as you need to pick it up from a corpse during The Quest for Tyr main story. This is a fairly basic Relic which boosts your melee damage for a short period of time upon use. The amount of damage boosted will increase with each upgrade to the item.

chapterContent.head: Glaive of Dodher

chapterContent.content: This one is dropped by Fiske, one of Odin’s guardians protecting the way to the last vestige of his magic which bound Freya to Midgard. The Glaive of Dodher provides a powerful ranged attack in the form of 3 Bifrost chakrams that swerve into enemies. Upgrades to this item will increase the number of chakrams launched upon use.

chapterContent.head: Hilt of Gram

chapterContent.content: You’ll find this one in a Legendary Chest that you encounter inside the Temple of Light, Alfheim. You can see our All Collectibles in Temple of Light page for its precise location. The Hilt of Gram is one of the most useful abilities to apply extra stun damage to nearby enemies, giving you a chance to hit them with a stun grab attack using . It will also provide you with a brief rage burst, and these effects can be enhanced by upgrading the item.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: How to Use Runic Attacks

chapterContent.content: Information about Runic Attacks in God of War Ragnarok, including details about obtaining, equipping and unlocking Runic Attacks.

chapterContent.head: What Are Runic Attacks in God of War Ragnarok?

chapterContent.content: Runic Attacks are powerful abilities you can use in combat, and while their effects vary - some focus more or less on elemental damage, physical damage or stun - they’re generally significantly more powerful than normal attacks. To compensate for this, Runic Attacks have a cooldown, the duration of which differs depending on the exact Runic Attack in question and Kratos’ COOLDOWN stat.

In addition to stat variances, the range, area-of-effect and the number of strikes performed by each Runic Attack differ, and these intangibles are worth considering depending on the enemy you’re fighting. Sometimes you’ll want more crowd control, other times a multihit Runic Attack that keeps a single enemy stunned, while against enemies who are aggressive and difficult to stun, you’ll just want to deal as much damage as possible as quickly as possible (you’re not always capable of defending yourself during Runic Attacks). Whatever the tactical situation, however, Runic Attacks are more potent the higher Kratos’ RUNIC stat is.

At the beginning of the game, Runic Attacks won’t likely have a tremendous impact on most fights, being a relatively rare special attack you can fall back on when you need a damage spike. Later in the game, however, as you accumulate a greater library of Runic Arts to choose from and your RUNIC and COOLDOWN stats improve, you’ll use these attacks more frequently and with greater effect - they may even go from being a supplemental bit of flashy offense to your primary means of dispatching enemies!

chapterContent.head: How to Use Runic Attacks

chapterContent.content: Runic Arts can be acquired in the same ways most loot can - you can obtain them as drops from enemies (these drops are static, and almost always from bosses), you can loot them from Legendary Chests, and you can earn them by advancing the main questline or completing Favors.

Once you’ve obtained a Runic Attack, you can equip it via the Weapons tab in the menu. All Runic Attacks are tied to one of Kratos’ weapons, and they come in two categories: Light Runic Attacks and Heavy Runic Attacks. Just select a weapon and pick the Light Runic Attack or Heavy Runic Attack slots to choose from any relevant Runic Attacks. For example, the [Winter’s Bite] Runic Attack is a Light Runic Attack for the Levithan Axe. Each weapon can have one Light Runic Attack and one Heavy Runic Attack equipped at a time, and their cooldowns are separate for each, meaning you can spam Runic Attack by swapping out weapons - the more weapons you have, the more Runic Arts you can make use of at a time.

To perform any Runic Attack, simply equip a weapon with Runic Attacks assigned and hold the , then press the  button to perform a Light Runic Attack or  to perform a Heavy Runic Attack. Some Runic Attacks will gain additional effects/attacks if you mash or hold the  /  buttons down during the attack. Check the description of each Runic Attack in the Weapons tab to get an idea for what each Runic Attack will do when used.

chapterContent.head: How to Upgrade Runic Attacks

chapterContent.content: While Runic Attacks are fairly powerful with their base effects, you can upgrade them to make them even more potent. Upgrading Runic Attacks will increase the attack’s stats (elemental damage, physical damage and/or stun), and may expand the Runic Attack’s range, give you the ability to charge the attack, or perform multiple attacks in succession. Needless to say, to get the most out of your Runic Attacks, you’ll need to upgrade them.

You can upgrade Runic Attacks simply by selecting the desired Runic Attack in the Weapons tab of your menu - the same place you go to equip them. Just hold down the  button and - assuming you have the required XP - you’ll upgrade the Runic Attack to the next tier.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Winter's Bite

chapterContent.content: Information about the Winter’s Bite Runic Attack for in God of War Ragnarok, including details about how to find this Runic Attack and its stats.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Winter’s Bite Runic Attack in GoWR

chapterContent.content: The first Runic Attack you’ll obtain in God of War Ragnarok, Winter’s Bite is a Light Runic Attack for the Leviathan Axe. You’ll obtain this Runic Attack during the main quest Surviving Fimbulwinter. Defeat The Huntress and pick up the loot she drops to obtain - among other things - this Runic Attack.

chapterContent.head: How to Use Winter’s Bite

chapterContent.content: To use Winter’s Bite, equip it to the Leviathan Axe’s Light Runic Attack slot, then hold  and press .

Despite the description, Winter’s Bite can hit multiple enemies if they’re grouped up enough. It generally has mediocre stats all around, but is fairly fast and can knock smaller enemies into the air, where you can subsequently juggle them. It’s a fine starter Runic Art that shouldn’t leave you vulnerable if you use it wisely in combat, but its crowd control and range leaves much to be desired.
Winter’s Bite has a COOLDOWN of 73 seconds. The potency of Winter’s Bite can be improved by increasing your RUNIC stat, and its cooldown can be lowered by increasing your COOLDOWN stat.

articleData.chapterTitle_bc: Flames of Anguish

chapterContent.content: This page will detail the Flames of Anguish Runic Attack for the Blades of Chaos in God of War Ragnarok, including how to obtain it and its stats.

chapterContent.head: Where to Find the Flames of Anguish Runic Attack in GoWR

chapterContent.content: The Flames of Anguish is the first Runic Attack you will find for the Blades of Chaos. You’ll obtain this Runic Attack during the main quest, The Quest for Tyr. You will face a boss called Dreki at some point, do defeat it to obtain this Runic Attack, among other loot. Note that if you forget to pick it up, then it will be sent to the chest at any blacksmith station.

chapterContent.head: How to Use the Flames of Anguish

chapterContent.content: In order to use Flames of Anguish, you will need to equip it to the Blades of Chaos’ Light Runic Attack slot, then hold L1 and press R1 while in the game to unleash it.

As the in-game description says, the Flames of Anguish is a quick uppercut and can launch nearby enemies. This allows you to continue juggling them in the air, making it a good starting Runic Attack for the Blades. Flames of Anguish is great for inflicting the Burn status, especially once it is fully upgraded. It does have a fairly long COOLDOWN of 93 seconds, although you can lower this by increasing your own COOLDOWN stat. Also, as with any Runic Attacks, increasing your RUNIC stat will cause it to deal more damage.
